  • This position requires an excellent control of the Dutch language in writing and speech. Minimum B2.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
In het kort

We zijn op zoek naar een ML Engineer die ons gaat helpen bij het oplossen van waardevolle business uitdagingen voor KLM's Operations afdeling, door het bouwen van innovatieve data science en ML oplossingen. Je werkt samen met Data Scientists en Machine Learning Engineers van de afdeling Operation Decision Support (ODS). De kernfocus van ODS is het optimaliseren van processen rondom vloot, bemanning en gronddiensten. Onze modellen zijn gericht op het beantwoorden van zeer relevante vragen zoals:

Hoeveel maaltijden zijn er nodig aan boord?
Hoeveel grondpersoneel is er nodig en op welk tijdstip?
Hoeveel no-shows kunnen we verwachten op deze vlucht?
Hoeveel vertraging zal een vlucht oplopen en hoe kunnen we de impact minimaliseren?




De antwoorden op deze vragen hebben direct invloed op de operaties van KLM, wat betekent dat er volop mogelijkheden zijn om te werken aan projecten die daadwerkelijk kosten besparen en/of inkomsten verhogen. Naast het bijdragen aan deze spannende projecten, zijn er mogelijkheden om:

Werken aan een innovatieproject in KickstartAI (kickstartai.nl);
Je nieuwste learnings te presenteren op een van onze Data Science Community events of tijdens onze wekelijkse kennisdelingssessies.




We zijn nu op zoek naar uitbreiding van onze Machine Learning mogelijkheden. Wil je de voorspellingen van je model in actie zien de volgende keer dat je een vlucht neemt?




Wat ga je doen?

Als ML Engineer kom je te werken in een groeiend agile Machine Learning team, momenteel bestaande uit 4 ML Engineers, 6 Data Scientists en 2 Business Consultants / Product Owners. Het team is volledig opgenomen in de afdeling en onze modellen zullen ondersteunen en adviseren op operationeel en tactisch niveau. Belangrijke aspecten van je dagelijkse werk zijn:




Werken aan voorspellingsmodellen, die 24/7 gebruikt worden in de live operaties van KLM. Deze modellen helpen je collega's bij de maaltijdvoorziening aan boord of bij de personeelsplanning in de terminals;
De volledige ML-pijplijn ontwerpen, onderzoeken en implementeren, van hertraining tot modelimplementatie en -monitoring
De geproduceerde ML-modellen voortdurend bewaken en verbeteren.
Aangezien KLM momenteel migreert naar Google Cloud Platform, ben jij een van de experts om onze cloudimplementatie tot een succes te maken.
Toezicht houden op de datapijplijn van ML-modellen
Nauw samenwerken met data scientists en data engineers
Je beste lessen delen op een Data Science Community-evenement
Plezier hebben en genieten terwijl je het doet!




Je wordt ook aangemoedigd en verwacht dat je 15-20% van je tijd bij ons besteedt aan het leren van nieuwe dingen, het doen van onderzoek en jezelf ontwikkelen. Dit kun je doen door cursussen te volgen, papers te lezen of coole hack-projecten te doen met je collega's. De projecten die je doet in je 15-20% tijd moeten gerelateerd zijn aan je functie, maar hoeven niet gerelateerd te zijn aan de projecten waar je normaal gesproken aan werkt.




Waar land je?

Je werkt op een hybride manier, deels vanuit huis en deels vanuit het kantoor op Schiphol-Oost, waar je de vliegtuigen kunt zien opstijgen terwijl je dockercontainer wordt gebouwd. We hebben flexibele werktijden en kantoordagen, dus we vinden wel iets wat bij je past. Het team is onderdeel van de grotere Operations Decision Support (ODS) afdeling, waar je ook nauw samenwerkt met andere data teams die gespecialiseerd zijn in bijvoorbeeld Operational Research of Data Engineering.




Jouw profiel

We hebben gemerkt dat mensen die aan de volgende eisen voldoen het beste bij ons passen:

Technisch onderlegd met gevoel voor logica, wiskunde en statistiek.
Ondernemend, analytisch, creatief en resultaatgericht.
Goed in het uitleggen van technische oplossingen in lekentaal.
Leergierig en op de hoogte van de nieuwste technologie√´n op het gebied van machine learning.




De vaardigheden en ervaring die je inbrengt in het team:

Een masterdiploma (of hoger) in Informatica, Data Science, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie of een aanverwant vakgebied.
2 jaar ervaring in softwareontwikkeling.
Ten minste 1 jaar ervaring in het werken met Data Science/Machine Learning-teams.
Aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwikkelen van MLOps-pijplijnen, inclusief implementatie, monitoring en hertraining.
Sterke basis in software engineering met expertise in Object Geori√´nteerd Programmeren (OOP) principes en design patterns.
Ervaring met het schrijven van Python-code op productieniveau, inclusief best practices in CI/CD, testgestuurde ontwikkeling en codeoptimalisatie.
Ervaring met ten minste √©√©n grote Cloud provider.
Ervaring met Git, Unix shell, REST API's, Docker, Kubernetes, Kibana, Prometheus, Grafana, (py)Spark, SQL, Terraform en andere relevante tools is een pr√©.
Ervaring met Large Language Models (LLM's) en Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines is een pr√©.




Competenties

Initiatief

Mondeling communiceren

Probleemanalyse

Samenwerken




Wat bieden wij?

Een brutosalaris tussen ‚Ç¨4.252,77 en ‚Ç¨6.075,38 bruto per maand;
Volop ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en mooie doorgroeimogelijkheden;
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling en 8% vakantiegeld;
Een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%;
Een regeling voor winstdeling, tot 20%;
25 vakantiedagen en 5 extra vrije dagen;
Fikse korting op vliegtickets (als je minimaal 6 maanden in dienst bent);
Een duurzaam vervoersbeleid, met o.a. 100% gratis reizen naar het werk met het Openbaar Vervoer (binnen Nederland);
Als je functie dit toelaat: thuiswerken en tot 8 weken werken vanuit het buitenland (EU en Caribisch gebied);
2% vrij te besteden ontwikkelbudget;




Ready for your next destination?

Wacht dan niet langer, en solliciteer voor de ‚Äòfinal boarding call‚Äô op 03-06-2025! Je hoeft geen motivatiebrief te schrijven; tijdens je online sollicitatie stellen we je enkele gerichte vragen. Je sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gesprekken en mogelijk een assessment, capaciteitentest en een veiligheidsonderzoek. Binnen twee weken na sluitingsdatum van de vacature krijg je bericht van ons.




Wist je dat volgens onderzoek vrouwen minder graag solliciteren dan mannen, als ze niet aan alle functie-eisen voldoen? Zonde. Want ‚Äòde perfecte kandidaat‚Äô is wat ons betreft een fabeltje. Dus heb jij de drive om op enkele aspecten in deze rol nog te groeien? We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie.




Een dossiercheck (voor ex-KLM-medewerkers) en/of een referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure. Door te solliciteren op deze vacature geef je toestemming voor deze checks.

Show more

  • 2 jaar ervaring in softwareontwikkeling.
  • Ten minste 1 jaar ervaring in het werken met Data Science/Machine Learning-teams.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwikkelen van MLOps-pijplijnen, inclusief implementatie, monitoring en hertraining.
  • Sterke basis in software engineering met expertise in Object Geori√´nteerd Programmeren (OOP) principes en design patterns.
  • Ervaring met het schrijven van Python-code op productieniveau, inclusief best practices in CI/CD, testgestuurde ontwikkeling en codeoptimalisatie.
  • Ervaring met ten minste √©√©n grote Cloud provider.
  • Ervaring met Git, Unix shell, REST API's, Docker, Kubernetes, Kibana, Prometheus, Grafana, (py)Spark, SQL, Terraform en andere relevante tools is een pr√©.
  • Ervaring met Large Language Models (LLM's) en Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines is een pr√©.


Competenties

Initiatief

Mondeling communiceren

Probleemanalyse

Samenwerken


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een brutosalaris tussen ‚Ç¨4.252,77 en ‚Ç¨6.075,38 bruto per maand;
  • Volop ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en mooie doorgroeimogelijkheden;
  • Een uitstekende pensioenregeling en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%;
  • Een regeling voor winstdeling, tot 20%;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en 5 extra vrije dagen;
  • Fikse korting op vliegtickets (als je minimaal 6 maanden in dienst bent);
  • Een duurzaam vervoersbeleid, met o.a. 100% gratis reizen naar het werk met het Openbaar Vervoer (binnen Nederland);
  • Als je functie dit toelaat: thuiswerken en tot 8 weken werken vanuit het buitenland (EU en Caribisch gebied);
  • 2% vrij te besteden ontwikkelbudget;


Ready for your next destination?

Wacht dan niet langer, en solliciteer voor de ‚Äòfinal boarding call‚Äô op 03-06-2025! Je hoeft geen motivatiebrief te schrijven; tijdens je online sollicitatie stellen we je enkele gerichte vragen. Je sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gesprekken en mogelijk een assessment, capaciteitentest en een veiligheidsonderzoek. Binnen twee weken na sluitingsdatum van de vacature krijg je bericht van ons.


Wist je dat volgens onderzoek vrouwen minder graag solliciteren dan mannen, als ze niet aan alle functie-eisen voldoen? Zonde. Want ‚Äòde perfecte kandidaat‚Äô is wat ons betreft een fabeltje. Dus heb jij de drive om op enkele aspecten in deze rol nog te groeien? We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie.


Een dossiercheck (voor ex-KLM-medewerkers) en/of een referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure. Door te solliciteren op deze vacature geef je toestemming voor deze checks.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
HTML:
This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Facebook, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. The people of Adyen are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Machine Learning Scientist

Adyen is looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team in Amsterdam, a person sitting at the cornerstone of algorithms, mathematics, and engineering, who can solve problems by designing and implementing production-ready machine learning solutions. You will be responsible for building, developing and deploying algorithms that power data products at Adyen.

What You Will Do

  • Research, design, implement, train, deploy and monitor machine learning algorithms, either for batch prediction or real-time. Examples are-on-line learning algorithms to pick the best optimization decision in a changing environment, clustering algorithms to group customers/shoppers, supervised and semi-supervised learning methods for inference on risk patterns or graph analysis, representation learning for behavior prediction and monitoring, Anti-Money Laundering (AML) systems and real-time anomaly detection based on time-series modeling;
  • Develop orchestrated pipelines for analytical purposes and machine learning training;
  • Contribute to ongoing automation efforts for our experiments, training runs, validation runs and monitoring before, during and after deployment. Furthermore, collaborate with MLOps to improve our machine learning tooling;
  • Create and iterate on state of the art machine learning algorithms with both merchant and product audiences;
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest research and developments in the machine learning field, and apply this where applicable.

Who You Are

  • You have 5+ years of experience as a machine learning or data scientist;
  • You have experience with the full machine learning model lifecycle in production flows;
  • You have experience with building and deploying Deep Learning models;
  • You have experience leveraging a big data framework to create the pipelines needed to feed the models with appropriate data;
  • You have a good understanding of software engineering practices as well as data engineering and MLOps principles;
  • You have knowledge of data science and statistics and machine learning techniques. These include a strong grounding in statistical inference, machine learning for prediction, and causal inference. Experience with Deep Learning is a must have.;
  • You have strong familiarity with the standard data science toolkit, such as (py)spark, (Trino) SQL, Tensorflow, PyTorch, XGBoost/LightGBM, Pandas, MLFlow or similar MLOps frameworks, and Airflow;
  • You have an experimental mindset with a launch fast and iterate mentality. Extensive experience with designing and running experiments is essential;
  • You proactively take the lead in projects, from ideation to deployment. You have experience working with a wide range of stakeholders and can clearly communicate complex outcomes over a wide range of audiences.

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you‚Äôre from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!

What‚Äôs next?

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don‚Äôt be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

Please, note that this role is a full-time position in Amsterdam. It will require a relocation in case you live outside of the Netherlands.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als senior Data Scientist maak je financial forecasting, anomoly detection modellen, en werk je mee aan HR Analytics-projecten, waarbij je innovatieve oplossingen van proof-of-concept naar productie brengt.

Jouw rol als Data Scientist

Sluit je aan bij het Finance Analytics team van KPN en ontwikkel machine learning-modellen en GenAI-producten voor Finance en HR. In deze functie maak je financial forecasting, anomoly detection modellen, en werk je mee aan HR Analytics-projecten, waarbij je innovatieve oplossingen van proof-of-concept naar productie brengt.

Jouw werkzaamheden kunnen onder andere omvatten:


Ontwikkelen van ML-modellen die strategische, tactische en operationele uitdagingen aanpakken.
Vertalen van businessvereisten naar effectieve technische oplossingen.
Implementeren en optimaliseren van modellen in productieomgevingen.
Cre√´ren van financial forecasting, anomoly detection modellen en optimaliseren van financi√´le en HR-processen.
Organisatiebreed stimuleren van datagedreven besluitvorming.


Dit is je team

Binnen Finance Insights & Analytics (FIA) werken +/- 40 developers, data scientists, data engineers, consultants, scrum masters en product owners verspreid over 5 scrum teams. Je komt terecht in een gepassioneerd en betrokken team waarin innovatie en samenwerking centraal staan. We spreken vloeiend Python, wisselen regelmatig kennis uit en vieren samen onze successen. Het Finance Analytics team specifiek bestaat uit een product owner, een medior en een senior data scientist. Op maandagen werken we in Rotterdam en op donderdagen afhankelijk van de afspraken met interne stakeholders. De overige dagen kan je vanuithuis of vanuit kantoor werken.

Wat breng

jij ons?

Voor deze vacature zoeken wij een collega met sterke communicatieve en organisatorische vaardigheden, een echte teamspeler met overtuigingskracht. Verder kun je stakeholders en anderen in duidelijke taal uitleggen hoe ons product werkt en wat de toegevoegde waarde is van het werk wat we doen. Dankzij jou kunnen we het finance analytics team verder professionaliseren en ons product portfolio verder uitbreiden.

Om dit succesvol te doen heb je in ieder geval:


Een WO diploma in Data Science, Econometrie of een vergelijkbare studie.
Ervaring met ML en GenAI-frameworks zoals Scikit-learn, Scipy, Langchain, NannyML, MLFlow en Polars.
Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal om goed te kunnen schakelen met diverse stakeholders.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden om data om te zetten in bruikbare inzichten.


Wat krijg je

van ons?

Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:


Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal ‚Ç¨ 5.742,- en maximaal ‚Ç¨ 8.865,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring, op basis van 40 uur
Vaste 13e maand, een deel krijg je maandelijks uitbetaald en een deel in januari van het volgende jaar. √ìf je zet het in voor een FLEX & BOOST doel naar keuze! Klik hier om er meer over te lezen
Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging conform onze CAO
‚Ç¨ 1500 per jaar aan inzetbaarheidsbudget dat je naar eigen inzicht mag gebruiken voor bijvoorbeeld trainingen, coaching en cursussen
Flexibele vrije dagen: onze collega‚Äôs mogen zelf (in samenspraak met de manager) bepalen hoe zij met verlof omgaan
Een goede werk-priv√© balans (zoals 2 dagen kantoor, 3 dagen thuis, transitieverlof, feestdagwissel naar een feestdag van jouw religieuze of culturele voorkeur)
Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten, uiteraard met een mobiele telefoon & laptop
50% korting op onze producten en diensten, zodat je voordelig kunt internetten, bellen √©n streamen
Goede reiskostenvergoeding: je krijgt je OV kosten volledig vergoed of ‚Ç¨ 0,23 per kilometer als je met de auto reist. Kom je liever op de fiets? Dan kun je aanspraak maken op onze fietsvergoeding ‚Ç¨ 0,40 per kilometer
Mogelijkheid tot het aanschaffen van een leasefiets waar KPN maandelijks aan meebetaalt (bij onbepaalde tijd contract): Van stadsfiets tot e-bike en van racefiets tot speed-pedelec; jij kiest waar je op fietst
Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden: een totale inleg van 23% van je pensioengevende salaris waarvan KPN 16% inlegt en jij 7%


Ons geloof in technologie is groot. Dit wordt n√≥g krachtiger samen met menselijk contact, daarom ontmoeten we je graag!

Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op met onze recruiter Rutger Schr√∂der via 06 18014776 of rutger.schroder@kpn.com.

Bij KPN hebben we recruitmenttalent dat slim samenwerkt en zo wint. Daarom wordt acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature niet gewaardeerd.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who we are

At Vandebron, we're transforming the energy landscape, steering away from the conventional to champion sustainability. Born in 2014, our journey began with Chapter 1, disrupting the market with a transparent platform connecting consumers directly to local, green energy producers. Now, in Chapter 2, we are dedicated to ensuring 100% green energy availability, 100% of the time. Think smart solutions ‚Äî flexible use of wind and solar farms, Smart EV Charging, and efficient energy storage.




No waiting around, we actively shape a sustainable future. Good energy, smart solutions, that‚Äôs Vandebron.

Your impact

You‚Äôll join our Energy Forecasting & Trade Algorithms (EFTA) team ‚Äî a tight-knit team at the core of Vandebron‚Äôs Producer domain. We create and operate mission-critical forecasting products and trading algorithms that empower data-driven decisions across energy markets.




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll act as the bridge between our data scientists and engineers. You‚Äôll bring machine learning models from concept to production, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and impactful in driving the energy transition forward. You‚Äôll translate business needs into ML solutions, refine our Python codebase, and deploy and monitor models that forecast energy production, optimize trading strategies, and enable smarter energy management.




If you want to build real-world ML solutions that have a direct impact on making the energy sector greener ‚Äî this is the role for you.




In this role you will be reporting to Tim Faber, Manager Data Analytics.




What you‚Äôll do

Translate business requirements into scalable designs for machine learning solutions.
Implement ML solutions as Python modules and iterate on the existing ML codebase.
Deploy and monitor machine learning models focused on energy forecasting, trading optimization, and related applications.
Collaborate with engineers to elevate the quality, reliability, and scalability of our ML products.
Manage and optimize ML orchestration tooling, ensuring reliable and timely model execution (e.g., using MLflow, Kubeflow, Dagster/Airflow).
Actively share findings and knowledge across teams, contributing to a strong internal ML community.
Stay ahead of the curve by continuously adopting new tools, techniques, and best practices to improve our ML operations.




What you bring

3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer working with machine learning pipelines.
Solid experience in Python and proficiency with relevant data/ML libraries.
Experience with time series forecasting.
Strong background in MLOps principles and hands-on experience with tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, or similar.
Practical experience with version control (Git), containerization (Docker), and orchestration frameworks like Dagster or Airflow.
Experience in setting up and using CI/CD workflows for ML applications.
Passion for the energy transition and a genuine interest in the real-world application of your work.
Strong communication skills ‚Äî you thrive in a close, collaborative team setting.
Bonus: product development in the energy domain.




What‚Äôs in it for you

A nice salary between ‚Ç¨4.500,- and ‚Ç¨5.400,- gross per month, based on 40 hours and excluding holiday allowance - based on experience.
An annual bonus based on company performance.
30 paid days off per year to recharge and find inspiration.
Two additional days: 1 for religious or personal celebrations and 1 volunteering day.
Work abroad for up to 6 weeks per year (max 4 consecutive weeks, including up to 4 weeks outside the EU).
A sabbatical opportunity after three years of service (one month paid with holidays, two unpaid).
An ‚Ç¨850 annual learning budget and access to Learning & Development programs.
A pension scheme to plan for the future.
A ‚Ç¨50 net monthly reimbursement for phone and Wi-Fi costs.
A one-time ‚Ç¨200 net allowance to set up your home workspace.
A hybrid work environment split between home and our carbon-neutral Amsterdam office. In this role, we expect you‚Äôll be at the office 3-4 days per week.
Daily healthy lunches by our in-house cooks.
An NS business card for those commuting 10km or more.




Why join Vandebron?

Work on impactful products ‚Äî Your ML models will directly contribute to a greener energy system and a more sustainable future.
Be part of a close, supportive team ‚Äî Tight collaboration, smart colleagues, and autonomy where it counts.
Develop your expertise ‚Äî You‚Äôll work on cutting-edge ML pipelines, contribute to the evolution of our forecasting capabilities, and extend your domain knowledge into areas like price forecasting and new markets.
Join a mission-driven company ‚Äî You‚Äôll see the real-world impact of your work on the environment and society.




A career move that matters

Within 6‚Äì12 months, success in this role means:

You‚Äôve fully onboarded into the EFTA team and built strong working relationships with engineers and data scientists.
You‚Äôve added fresh ideas and meaningful contributions to improve our ML pipelines and processes.
You‚Äôve taken ownership of ML deployment and orchestration workflows, improving reliability and scalability.
You‚Äôre actively shaping how we forecast, optimize, and trade green energy smarter every day.




Interested?

If this role excites you, apply via this page.




Still have questions? Feel free to ask via tommythomassen@vandebron.nl.




At Vandebron, we believe in diversity, inclusiveness, and equal career opportunities. Be your authentic self ‚Äî and it‚Äôs totally okay with us if you don‚Äôt mention your gender or date of birth on your resume. We also care about your privacy and handle your data carefully. Under the GDPR, you are not required to provide us with any information about your health, race/nationality, or religion, and you may also omit your social security number (BSN) and passport photo from your job application documentation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What it‚Äôs about

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to develop scalable, production-ready applications powered by data and AI. You are a Scientist or Engineer who embraces mathematics and understands the process of taking models from development to production. You possess the necessary skills and courage to bring ideas from your laptop to a cluster.




How you will help in creating value with Data & AI

At Xebia, we establish robust Data & AI practices to bring value to our clients and their customers. Our team of data professionals has successfully predicted daily bread demand, implemented energy-saving algorithms at a national scale, and established data innovation labs in large multinational corporations. By joining our team, you can contribute to even greater achievements in making top companies AI-driven.

As a machine learning engineer, your responsibility is to take AI solutions into production to generate value. You ensure that applications are scalable, testable, robust, and extendable through your expertise in engineering and machine learning.




What you will do to make AI-driven applications

You collaborate closely with data scientists on your team to understand the problem being addressed and their approach. You review their code, modularise it, identify areas for testing, and even challenge their solutions to enhance their effectiveness. Your proficiency in Python enables you to improve code quality or potentially translate it to other languages like Scala or Java.

During on-site client engagements, you may encounter challenging problems. Fortunately, Xebia organizes regular remote work sessions where you can discuss and find solutions with the collective intelligence of the entire team. If immediate assistance is needed, every Xebia member is just a quick message away, always ready to provide support.




THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚úÖ You like working on the overlap between AI and software or data engineering.

‚úÖ You like building your solutions with services on public clouds or want to learn how to do that.

‚úÖ You like working for different clients and enjoy the excitement of regularly getting to learn new environments and know new people.

‚úÖ You speak Dutch fluently.




THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚ùå You only want to build models from data and are not interested in doing the work involved in taking these models into production.

‚ùå You are just fine with spaghetti code or do not understand what that is.

‚ùå You do not like coding, scripting, or templating.




WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE A CONSULTANT AT XEBIA DATA

As a consultant at Xebia Data, you will have projects of varying lengths. Some are 2 weeks, some are 1 year, most are in between. Every project is different, as is every client. We, however, always deliver the best quality possible. It is not always easy, but it is always rewarding. You will be exposed to different companies, problems, systems, and solutions. Join our dynamic team and collaborate with industry leaders such as Ahold, ASML, Sligro, and Vattenfall! Explore the exciting projects we've undertaken by diving into our inspiring customer stories.




You will be surrounded by experts in different fields, and you will learn so many new things in a short time. Xebia Data offers the perfect environment to shine as a data professional.

You will never be alone on this journey. We have all experienced imposter syndrome, had a difficult project, or felt down at times. We know what it takes, we know it is difficult sometimes, and we will be there for you when you need it. We say People First, and we mean it.




Xebia Data offers you great benefits too, of course!

You can enjoy, for free, healthy lunches and not-so-healthy drinks/snacks at our offices.
You can use the great benefits we offer for your physical and mental well-being.
You get a generous tech budget.
You can build/test/experiment anything you want in our sandbox environments in GCP, AWS and Azure.
You can work on that innovative idea of yours during the monthly Xebia Data Fridays.
You have 5.000 Euros and 6 days of development budget per year which you can spend on anything that will make you a better data professional.
You also have a monthly mobility budget to spend on leasing a car, leasing the e-bike of your dreams, or getting an NS Business Card.

Title: Agricultural Data Scientist
Description:
As the Agricultural Data Scientist, you contribute to the growth and strategic goals of HZPC by combining Data Science (crop analytics using e.g. (learning) models and business intelligence) with expertise on crop production systems (epidemiology, post-harvest physiology, and disease management) including plant sciences (plant biology, plant and crop physiology). By combining domain-specific knowledge with technical skills, you can work on the design and deployment of decision support systems, offer data-derived analytics to the agronomy team, contribute to business data infrastructures, and be an active member in ongoing (research) projects.

What does this mean?
Agronomical and data science are translated into practical applications to improve the performance of our varieties in seed production.

Main responsibilities of this role
Develop and integrate data infrastructures for seed potato production, ensuring effective data collection and advanced analytics.
Support business decisions by extracting insights from existing and future datasets, using appropriate analytical techniques to enhance variety practices and improve performance.
Provide variety-specific production analytics and agronomic insights to the Agronomy team and other stakeholders.
Design, structure, and implement crop analytics for digital applications and decision-support systems.
Create and support business insight tools, including dashboards and models, to facilitate report generation and data-driven decision-making.
Develop and maintain tooling to share knowledge effectively with agronomy teams, field managers, and farmers, improving collaboration and cultivation practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in crop production data technologies, applying them to optimize business processes and analytics.
Take an active role in supervising data integrity and quality to ensure consistency and reliability within existing data infrastructures.
Contribute to experimental research project designs and provide technical support for production-related studies.


Your profile
You are a business-minded, result-oriented professional with strong analytical capabilities and a creative mindset. You excel at identifying opportunities, acting on your own initiative, and collaborating effectively within a team. Your strengths in time management and systematic analysis enable you to manage complex tasks while achieving predetermined goals. You have a natural eagerness to learn and apply new knowledge, coupled with the ability to create innovative solutions to challenges.

In addition, you have:
A Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs degree with solid knowledge of data science and crop science, along with experience in agricultural crop production.
Proficiency in analytical tools such as SQL, Python, and R, and familiarity with relevant software for the tasks described.
Strong command of English in speaking, listening, and writing. Knowledge of the Dutch language is desirable and considered an advantage.


What we offer
This is a full-time, permanent role with a maximum of 40 hours per week. We will discuss together what a workable structure is to be effective for you personally. You will be in our office in Joure, often traveling to our Research site in Metslawier, and collaborate internationally with our colleagues across the globe.

Additionally, we also offer:
A fully HZPC-paid pension, allowing you to focus on your future without worries.
33 days off based on a 40-hour workweek.
A 13th-month salary, paid out monthly for extra financial security.
A place in a dynamic international organization with diverse opportunities for career and personal development.
An additional reward in the form of our variable bonus, paid out every November based on achieved objectives.


About HZPC
Founded in 1898 and rooted in the Netherlands, HZPC has become a global market leader in innovative breeding, seed potato trading, and concept development. Our ambition is sustainable growth. We offer innovative potato varieties that are optimized for local cultivation conditions. We share knowledge and provide solutions that dynamically anticipate the climatic, cultural, and commercial challenges that the whole area of food has to deal with. With 400 employees in 16 countries and exporting to more than 90 countries, we contribute to the availability of responsible food for the well-being of millions of people worldwide. You can find more information on our website: www.hzpc.com.

Your Reaction
We are looking forward to receiving your response! You are invited to show your interest by submitting your application and CV via the application form on the website. For more information about the recruitment process, you can contact Ilse Kuiper (Talent Acquisition Lead) via ilse.kuiper@hzpc.com. For additional information please contact Frank van der Werff (Senior Head Production) via frank.vanderwerff@hzpc.com.

Title: Data Scientist (all genders)
Description:
Unser Bereich Digital begleitet unsere Kunden auf ihrem Weg in die digitale Zukunft und entwickelt mit ihnen innovative Konzepte und L√∂sungen. Als Data Scientist arbeitest du an spannenden und zukunftsweisenden Projekten in verschiedenen Branchen wie Automotive, Banking, Versicherungen, Transportation und dem √∂ffentlichen Sektor. Du transformierst komplexe Daten in wertvolle Erkenntnisse und unterst√ºtzt unsere Kunden dabei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Gesch√§ftsprozesse zu optimieren.

Verantwortlichkeiten


Modellentwicklung: Entwicklung und Implementierung von datengetriebenen Modellen und Algorithmen, die teilweise auf k√ºnstlicher Intelligenz (KI) basieren.
Datenverarbeitung: Erhebung, Verarbeitung und Bereinigung von gro√üen und komplexen Datens√§tzen.
Datenanalyse: Analyse von Daten zur Identifikation von Mustern, Trends und Zusammenh√§ngen.
Berichterstellung: Erstellung und Pr√§sentation von Berichten und Dashboards zur Visualisierung von Daten und Ergebnissen.
Teamarbeit: Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu unterst√ºtzen.
Prozessverbesserung: Kontinuierliche Verbesserung bestehender Datenprozesse und -strukturen.


Qualifikationen


Studium: Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium (ggf. Promotion) im Bereich Wirtschafts¬≠wissenschaften, Informatik, Physik oder einem vergleichbaren quantita¬≠tiven Bereich
Sprachkenntnisse: Du bringst verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und flie√üende Englischkenntnisse mit und wei√üt diese in der Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden einzusetzen


Erforderliche F√§higkeiten


Data Science: Du konntest bereits Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Data Science, Data Engineering und Data Analytics sammeln.
Programmierkenntnisse: Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python, R oder SQL mit.
Datenvisualisierung: Mit Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau, Power BI oder √§hnlichen bist du vertraut.
Big-Data-Technologien: Kenntnisse in Big-Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark oder √§hnliche sind von Vorteil.
Analytische F√§higkeiten: Du bringst starke analytische und probleml√∂sende F√§higkeiten mit und kannst komplexe technische Konzepte gegen√ºber Kunden verst√§ndlich kommunizieren.


Leistungen


Bei Expleo setzen wir auf Teamwork, Offenheit, Transparenz und Wertsch√§tzung. Wir gehen unsere Aufgaben gemeinsam an
Bei uns erwartet dich ein internationales und multikulturelles Team
Bei uns sind alle gleich und wir tragen alle die gleiche Farbe: LILA!
Wir bieten dir Gleitzeit, ein ausf√ºhrliches Onboarding, Home-Office-M√∂glichkeiten und unz√§hlige Mitarbeiter-Benefits. Wir bieten einen Arbeitsplatz, der deine pers√∂nlichen Lebensumst√§nde ber√ºcksichtigt und dich absichert
Man lernt nie aus: Deine Weiterentwicklung liegt uns sehr am Herzen. Wir bieten interne Aus- und Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten und unterst√ºtzen dich und deine perspektivischen Ziele
Wir haben Lust etwas zu bewegen, uns gegenseitig zu motivieren und freuen uns, wenn auch du deinen Teil zum gro√üen Ganzen beitragen: Deine Erfahrung, deine Ideen und dein Engagement finden bei uns Geh√∂r und werden honoriert
Unsere Kunden k√∂nnen sich nicht nur sehen lassen; sie geh√∂ren zu den Top-Playern ihrer Branchen, in den Bereichen Banken und Versicherungen, Automotive, Luftfahrt, Transport, Life Science und viele mehr
Das soziale Miteinander ist uns wichtig. Wir setzen auf Teambuilding und Identifikation


Du willst mehr √ºber uns wissen? Besuche einfach unseren Youtube-Kanal und schau Dir unsere Videos an. Wir freuen uns √ºber Deine Bewerbung und darauf, Dich pers√∂nlich kennenzulernen.

Title: AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir glauben an das Potenzial von Artificial Intelligence ‚Äì als Innovationstreiber, Probleml√∂ser und Gamechanger.




Mit unserer AI-Expertise helfen wir Unternehmen, intelligenter zu entscheiden, effizienter zu handeln und neue Gesch√§ftsmodelle zu realisieren. Daf√ºr bringen wir technische Tiefe und strategisches Denken zusammen ‚Äì in einem Umfeld aus agilen Projekten, starken Tech-Stacks und echter Zusammenarbeit.




Du m√∂chtest AI nicht nur verstehen, sondern gestalten? Bei uns arbeitest du an anspruchsvollen AI-Cases ‚Äì von Machine Learning √ºber MLOps bis zu Generative AI. Du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung, entwickelst dich kontinuierlich weiter und bringst dein Know-how direkt in die Umsetzung.




Werde Teil eines Teams aus Data Scientists, KI-Spezialisten und Business-Experten, das AI lebt ‚Äì pragmatisch, nahbar, kreativ.




Liefere echten Mehrwert mit Wirkung ‚Äì Simplify the complex.


Aufgaben


Du hast Lust auf Softwareentwicklung mit Generative Artificial Intelligence in einem modernen Consulting-Umfeld?




Als AI Engineer (m/w/d) √ºbernimmst du in unseren Teams technische Verantwortung f√ºr den produktiven Einsatz innovativer L√∂sungen auf Basis von Large Language Models. Du planst und realisierst hochmoderne AI-Architekturen in der Cloud und revolutionierst dadurch die Prozesse unserer Kunden.




Deine Aufgaben:





Pionierarbeit mit GenAI Projekten: Arbeite eng mit unseren Data Scientists und Engineers zusammen, um ein starkes Team zu bilden, das End-to-End generative AI-Anwendungen entwickelt und innovative L√∂sungen vorantreibt.


Integration und Nutzung von GenAI: Integriere und orchestriere Services aus innovativen AI-Infrastrukturen in ein belastbares Backend ‚Äì von der Datenquelle bis hin zum User Interface.


Skalierbare Cloud-Architekturen: Entwickle skalierbare Software und Infrastrukturen, die den Einsatz von KI bei unseren Kunden beschleunigen und langfristigen Erfolg sicherstellen.


Beratung & Workshops: Schaffe echten Mehrwert, indem du unsere Kunden von der Konzeption bis zur Produktivsetzung ber√§tst und begleitest.


Immer up-to-date: Bleibe gemeinsam mit uns auf dem neusten Stand der AI-Technologien und wende diese direkt im Projekt an.



Qualifikation



Abgeschlossenes Studium, Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Qualifikation


Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und relevanten Libraries zur API-Entwicklung (FastAPI, Pydantic) sowie AI-spezifischen Frameworks und Tools


Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von RAG-Infrastrukturen (LLMs, Embeddings & Vektordatenbanken) im Azure-Kontext (oder vergleichbar)


Erste Erfahrung mit CI/CD Workflows und Infrastruktur-as-Code im Cloud Kontext


Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und die F√§higkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte klar und verst√§ndlich zu pr√§sentieren



Benefits



Die AI-Branche w√§chst rasant und wir wachsen mit. Wir bleiben immer auf dem neuesten Stand, nutzen die neuesten Technologien, testen Trends und hinterfragen uns immer wieder.


Ob im zuhause, in unseren stylischen B√ºros oder √ºber eine Workation: Du entscheidest, wo du am produktivsten bist. Wir freuen uns trotzdem, dich regelm√§√üig auch pers√∂nlich zu sehen.


Jede Minute, die du investierst, wird direkt belohnt ‚Äì durch vollen √úberstundenausgleich und flexible Arbeitszeiten


√úbernehme in einem agilen Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien, kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation schnell Verantwortung.


Ein Team aus neugierigen K√∂pfen: Viel Zeit und Raum f√ºr bezahlte Weiterbildungen und Zertifizierungen sowie regelm√§√üige Feedback- und Entwicklungsgespr√§che.


Sommertrips, legend√§re Weihnachtsfeiern oder gemeinsame After-Work-Events. Hier erwartet dich das beste Team.


Wir bieten dir den Dienst von "doQtor", eine verg√ºnstigte Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft sowie betriebliche Altersvorsorge.


Moderne B√ºros mit h√∂henverstellbaren Tischen, gemeinsame Pausen an der Playstation / Switch und Tischtennisplatte oder ein wenig Sport im eigenen Fitnessraum.





Und das war l√§ngst nicht alles! Den kompletten √úberblick findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.




Interesse? Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei uns:




Um es einfach zu halten, verzichten wir gerne auf ein Anschreiben, denn wir brauchen von dir nur:





Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf,


Dein gew√ºnschtes Eintrittsdatum


Deine Gehaltsvorstellung


Und in einem Satz, was du von deinem Job bei taod erwartest.





Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung! Bei Fragen kannst du dich gerne an Lea (+49 151 420 369 99) oder Jeannine (+49 151 420 378 87) wenden.




Schon gewusst? Auf unserem LinkedIn- und Instagramprofil geben wir dir noch mehr Insights aus unserem Arbeitsalltag.




Schwerbehinderte werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt ber√ºcksichtigt.

HTML:
Wir glauben an das Potenzial von Artificial Intelligence ‚Äì als Innovationstreiber, Probleml√∂ser und Gamechanger.


Mit unserer AI-Expertise helfen wir Unternehmen, intelligenter zu entscheiden, effizienter zu handeln und neue Gesch√§ftsmodelle zu realisieren. Daf√ºr bringen wir technische Tiefe und strategisches Denken zusammen ‚Äì in einem Umfeld aus agilen Projekten, starken Tech-Stacks und echter Zusammenarbeit.


Du m√∂chtest AI nicht nur verstehen, sondern gestalten? Bei uns arbeitest du an anspruchsvollen AI-Cases ‚Äì von Machine Learning √ºber MLOps bis zu Generative AI. Du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung, entwickelst dich kontinuierlich weiter und bringst dein Know-how direkt in die Umsetzung.


Werde Teil eines Teams aus Data Scientists, KI-Spezialisten und Business-Experten, das AI lebt ‚Äì pragmatisch, nahbar, kreativ.


Liefere echten Mehrwert mit Wirkung ‚Äì Simplify the complex.


Aufgaben

Du hast Lust auf Softwareentwicklung mit Generative Artificial Intelligence in einem modernen Consulting-Umfeld?


Als AI Engineer (m/w/d) √ºbernimmst du in unseren Teams technische Verantwortung f√ºr den produktiven Einsatz innovativer L√∂sungen auf Basis von Large Language Models. Du planst und realisierst hochmoderne AI-Architekturen in der Cloud und revolutionierst dadurch die Prozesse unserer Kunden.


Deine Aufgaben:



  • Pionierarbeit mit GenAI Projekten: Arbeite eng mit unseren Data Scientists und Engineers zusammen, um ein starkes Team zu bilden, das End-to-End generative AI-Anwendungen entwickelt und innovative L√∂sungen vorantreibt.

  • Integration und Nutzung von GenAI: Integriere und orchestriere Services aus innovativen AI-Infrastrukturen in ein belastbares Backend ‚Äì von der Datenquelle bis hin zum User Interface.

  • Skalierbare Cloud-Architekturen: Entwickle skalierbare Software und Infrastrukturen, die den Einsatz von KI bei unseren Kunden beschleunigen und langfristigen Erfolg sicherstellen.

  • Beratung & Workshops: Schaffe echten Mehrwert, indem du unsere Kunden von der Konzeption bis zur Produktivsetzung ber√§tst und begleitest.

  • Immer up-to-date: Bleibe gemeinsam mit uns auf dem neusten Stand der AI-Technologien und wende diese direkt im Projekt an.


Qualifikation

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium, Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und relevanten Libraries zur API-Entwicklung (FastAPI, Pydantic) sowie AI-spezifischen Frameworks und Tools

  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von RAG-Infrastrukturen (LLMs, Embeddings & Vektordatenbanken) im Azure-Kontext (oder vergleichbar)

  • Erste Erfahrung mit CI/CD Workflows und Infrastruktur-as-Code im Cloud Kontext

  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und die F√§higkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte klar und verst√§ndlich zu pr√§sentieren


Benefits

  • Die AI-Branche w√§chst rasant und wir wachsen mit. Wir bleiben immer auf dem neuesten Stand, nutzen die neuesten Technologien, testen Trends und hinterfragen uns immer wieder.

  • Ob im zuhause, in unseren stylischen B√ºros oder √ºber eine Workation: Du entscheidest, wo du am produktivsten bist. Wir freuen uns trotzdem, dich regelm√§√üig auch pers√∂nlich zu sehen.

  • Jede Minute, die du investierst, wird direkt belohnt ‚Äì durch vollen √úberstundenausgleich und flexible Arbeitszeiten

  • √úbernehme in einem agilen Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien, kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation schnell Verantwortung.

  • Ein Team aus neugierigen K√∂pfen: Viel Zeit und Raum f√ºr bezahlte Weiterbildungen und Zertifizierungen sowie regelm√§√üige Feedback- und Entwicklungsgespr√§che.

  • Sommertrips, legend√§re Weihnachtsfeiern oder gemeinsame After-Work-Events. Hier erwartet dich das beste Team.

  • Wir bieten dir den Dienst von "doQtor", eine verg√ºnstigte Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft sowie betriebliche Altersvorsorge.

  • Moderne B√ºros mit h√∂henverstellbaren Tischen, gemeinsame Pausen an der Playstation / Switch und Tischtennisplatte oder ein wenig Sport im eigenen Fitnessraum.

Title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning
Description:
About Applied Intuition

Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the ADAS/AD toolchain, Vehicle OS, and autonomy stack to help customers build intelligent systems, create next-generation experiences, and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition‚Äôs solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at appliedintuition.com.

We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments. (Note: For EpiSci job openings, fully remote work will be considered by exception.)

About The Role

We are looking for software engineers with expertise in ML-first perception, prediction or planning for autonomous vehicles or mobile robots. Your contributions will focus on building out key ML capabilities of an autonomous vehicle stack.

In addition to your engineering contributions, by working in our dynamic and customer-focused team culture, you will contribute to and learn from best practices in the autonomy industry. We move fast and focus on excellence, for our products and for our business. If you are hands-on and looking for a place to have a multiplying effect on making autonomous systems a reality, Applied Intuition is the place for you!

At Applied Intuition, you will


Design and implement capabilities and workflows for cutting-edge real-world perception or planning/prediction systems
Leverage established products at Applied Intuition to build the software and infrastructure foundation for our ML developments


We're looking for someone who has


Experience with the end-to-end development cycle of deep learning models
Expertise in subdomains such as modeling, input pipelines, evaluation, deployment, and model optimization
3+ years of experience building production software using modern software practices
Fluency in C++, or fluency in Python with intermediate experience in C++
Deep understanding of the concepts and methods behind any frameworks or libraries that they worked with
Experience working with production level ML and DL perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles


Nice to have


MSc or PhD in machine learning, ideally applied to perception, prediction,planning or closely related field
Experience building and shipping software frameworks or tools
Experience with driver assistance or autonomous driving systems
Experience in evaluating and improving system-in-the-loop model performance
Deep hands-on expertise in relevant algorithms or methods, such as non-linear optimization, computational geometry, numerical analysis, or distributed systems


Benefits and perks


Lunch and dinner allowance
Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
Stock options


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.

Title: Software Development Engineer (Fullstack) (f/m/d)
Description:
About

Life is always about becoming‚Ä¶ Becoming means going on a journey to be the best version of our future selves. While we discover new things, we will face challenges, master them and grow beyond our individual limits.

Apply for a job at Mercedes-Benz and find your individual role and workspace to unleash your talents to the fullest. Empowered by visionary colleagues who share the same pioneering spirit. Joining us means becoming part of a global team that aims to build the most desirable cars in the world. Together for excellence.

Job-ID: MER0003NA9

Since 2016, Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services GmbH has been connecting the automotive and digital world around the connected vehicle: With innovative data-based solutions, the subsidiary of Mercedes-Benz AG enables its B2B customers to make business processes more efficient, improve customer experiences or develop new business models.

Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services creates digital solutions of the future that help B2B customers to increase their process quality and efficiency, improve customer experiences, act more sustainably or develop new business models. It is based on real-time data from measuring points and signals inside and outside of Mercedes-Benz vehicles worldwide. This data is used to generate added value for products and processes in companies from a wide range of industries. The secure and responsible handling of data is hereby the basis for the acceptance of services around connected driving. The Stuttgart-based company has about 75 employees working on the development, operation and sales of digital data-based products.

Our Engineering & Technology Team is looking for a Software Development Engineer (Fullstack) (f/m/d) on a full-time basis as soon as possible.

Engineering & Technology Team


We are an experienced & passionate team developing & operating data driven award winning digital products and innovative IoT services with cloud native microservices for business customers of Mercedes Benz
We are working agile, delivering new features to our customers with every sprint using our automated CI/CD pipeline, which relies on a fully automated quality assurance


These Exciting Tasks Are Waiting For You


Develop & run innovative digital products around the connected vehicle in an agile team
Assuring high quality by writing clean code, test cases & collaborating with the test engineers as well as keeping architecture & design documentation up-to-date
Discuss and challenge requirements together with the product manager, product owner and customer
Analyze and solve problems arising during development and production
Contribute to reviews and share your knowledge with the team


The position is filled as soon as possible on a full-time basis, juniors & seniors are welcome.

Your Profile


You are a full stack developer breathing an agile, cloud native and DevOps mindset
You are keen on developing API products and Dashboards, modular & scalable web applications
You are comfortable developing backend components using various programming languages such as Kotlin, Java, Python, Express or Node.js
You also have experience with Frontend development using JavaScript, TypeScript and React
You are experienced in writing scalable solutions for microservice and event driven architectures based on Springboot, Kafka & Kubernetes
You are enthusiastic in writing new and thoughtful code with privacy and security in mind
You assure high code quality by implementing proper test cases
You have experience with cloud providers like Azure and deploy your code using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions
You know how to monitor your applications
You are familiar with internet protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, REST, Messaging, WebSockets, OAUTH etc.) & database technologies
You love to learn new methods and technologies
You are fluent in English, German is a plus.
Scrum master skills are a plus


We Offer More Than Just An Employment Relationship


Help shape the future in a mix of corporate and start-up culture with a highly motivated and experienced team
Special benefits, such as accident insurance, company pension scheme allowance, regular breakfast together and lunch lectures etc.
Independent work and freedom to contribute your own ideas
Very good infrastructural connections (close to motorway, car park, underground station)


Please apply online only and include a CV, a cover letter and relevant certificates (max. total size of attachments 6 MB). Applications in both German and English are welcome.

We are particularly pleased to receive online applications from disabled persons and persons with equivalent disabilities directly in response to this advertisement.

Hybrid Work Possible

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Our mission is to create outstanding research and innovative technologies for networking, telecommunication, and software systems. Our team research focuses on the operational challenges in deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting networks and software systems. We create data-driven solutions and implement software systems to provide autonomy to network operation in such a way that scales with future workload demands.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn


Identify new and ambitious research challenges, define research projects to address these challenges, and carry out ground-breaking research in the areas of software systems and/or software engineering with focus on the aforementioned research agendas for creating both theoretical innovations and novel practical implementations.
Propose new innovations and generate patents to help continue Nokia‚Äôs leadership in intellectual property in software services and technologies.
Implement and validate new innovations and accelerate their adoption through Nokia business groups, incubation, or external spin-offs.
Publish research in major conferences and journals worldwide.
Keep an active and visible role in the research community through conference committees and reviewing panels.
Create and maintain strong collaborative associations with university-based researchers.


Key Skills And Experience

You have:


Ph.D. degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science, electrical engineering with a strong focus on software systems or software engineering research.
Deep understanding of distributed systems, AI/ML systems, Web3 technologies, and distributed software systems.
A proven track record in research, with publications in prestigious IEEE/ACM conferences and/or journals
Strong written and spoken English communication skills. You have delivered talks at relevant international workshops, conferences, or other events.
Demonstrable programming skills. Pointers to research prototypes you have built or open-source libraries you contributed to are much appreciated.
Ability to conduct independent research with minimal day-to-day guidance while also contributing to team-oriented projects.
Strong communication skills and the ability to successfully work in collaborative projects.


It would be nice if you also had:


Proven experience in designing and realizing large and complex software systems.
Familiarity with implementing decentralized systems.
PostDoc experience is a plus.


About Us

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:


One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

  • Ph.D. degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science, electrical engineering with a strong focus on software systems or software engineering research.
  • Deep understanding of distributed systems, AI/ML systems, Web3 technologies, and distributed software systems.
  • A proven track record in research, with publications in prestigious IEEE/ACM conferences and/or journals
  • Strong written and spoken English communication skills. You have delivered talks at relevant international workshops, conferences, or other events.
  • Demonstrable programming skills. Pointers to research prototypes you have built or open-source libraries you contributed to are much appreciated.
  • Ability to conduct independent research with minimal day-to-day guidance while also contributing to team-oriented projects.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to successfully work in collaborative projects.

It would be nice if you also had:

  • Proven experience in designing and realizing large and complex software systems.
  • Familiarity with implementing decentralized systems.
  • PostDoc experience is a plus.

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

  • One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
  • Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
  • Workplace Pride Global Benchmark

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We have one open position of Python Developer with one of our client based at Boblingen, Germany. This is a Permanent Position. Below is the job description for your reference. Please share your application once you are interested.




Role: Python Developer

Mode: Permanent

Location: Boblingen, Germany




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Python Process Automation Engineer to join our team, focusing on automating test reporting and FDA documentation for medical devices. This role involves working with Azure DevOps, Python, and various reporting tools to streamline documentation processes and ensure regulatory compliance.
Experience: 5+ years in Python Automation or Development, preferably with exposure to regulated industries or medical device environments.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Core Python, REST API development, SQL, WIQL query, and experience with tools like Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Docker, and JFrog Artifactory.
Compliance & Documentation: Experience with LaTeX Studio Tool scripting using MiKTeX engine, as well as handling documents in Word, Excel, HTML, PDF, and Zip formats.
GUI or Web Development: Familiarity with any Python framework for creating user-friendly tools.
Problem-solving: Strong analytical skills with a proactive approach to troubleshooting and optimizing reporting tools.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with the team.

Recruiter Email: nitinsharma@thriveitsystems.com

Title: Python Developer for Desktop Applications (m/f/d)
Description:
About

You will be a key member of the DLS development team by being responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of the desktop application for our DLS instruments. As the primary Python developer for this software, you will drive its evolution alongside new hardware and new features while creating an intuitive and user-friendly graphical application.

Your contribution to our team


Take over ownership of the desktop application for our DLS instrument.
Continue development of the existing software and conduct maintenance work wherever necessary.
Take care of continuously keeping technical debt to a minimum that is manageable.
Collaborate with the graphics designer to improve the UI/UX and implement changes accordingly.
Set up and maintain continuous integration, testing, and release management using GitLab.
Work closely with the applications and hardware development teams to integrate new features and algorithms.


Job requirements


A Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in Python development and designing graphical user applications, especially with Qt.
Significant contributions to large, long-term Python software projects.
Strong UI/UX design skills focused on usability for non-programmer users.
Experience with numerical computation libraries like NumPy and SciPy.
Experience with continuous integration and GitLab, knowledge of Linux is a plus.
Optionally: Knowledge of low-level hardware communication and measurement instruments.
Strong communication skills in written and spoken English, German is a plus.
Willingness to work on-site in Stuttgart most of the time, mobile working by prior arrangement.


What makes the difference for you


We work in a company made by scientists for scientists: You'll be part of a team that understands and shares your curiosity, working on cutting-edge technologies with a purpose.
We cultivate an open-minded, inclusive and collaborative working atmosphere with a flat organizational structure, helpful colleagues and team events.
We commute by train, car or bike: good public transport connections, parking space and bike leasing available.
We are situated in the same building as the ‚ÄúRockerei‚Äù, an indoor climbing park where a group of our employees meet regularly to climb. We have table soccer and darts sessions, perfect for recharging your energy while connecting with your teammates.
Also we are a family-friendly company that offers flexible working hours, mobile working and part-time models. We have family days and celebrations with employees and partners.


Explore our Employee Benefits

Flexible Working Hours

Enjoy the freedom of flexible working hours at Swabian Instruments, designed to help you achieve a healthy work-life balance. Tailor your schedule to fit your personal and professional needs, ensuring productivity and satisfaction.

Fruits & Coffee

Enjoy fresh fruit and premium coffee to keep you energized throughout the day at Swabian Instruments. We feature a high-quality espresso machine and locally roasted coffee beans.

State-of-the-art equipment

Experience the best with our state-of-the-art equipment, including height-adjustable desks and air conditioning. At Swabian Instruments, we ensure a comfortable and ergonomic workspace for maximum productivity.

Individual Training

Our Individual Training approach addresses your unique needs to enhance your skills and career growth. At Swabian Instruments, we focus on your personal development to help you reach your full potential.

Language courses

At Swabian Instruments, we support your language learning to help you thrive in our international environment. We cover the cost of language courses in German and English for our employees.

Bike Leasing

Take advantage of our Bike Leasing program through salary conversion in partnership with a leading provider.

Company Pension Plan

Enhance your future with our Company Pension Plan, where we match contributions up to 20%. At Swabian Instruments, we‚Äôre committed to supporting your long-term financial well-being.

Parking spaces

Enjoy free parking spaces provided by Swabian Instruments. We make your commute hassle-free with convenient and cost-free parking options.

Neugier gepaart mit dem Wunsch, praktische Experimente durchzuf√ºhren und die gesammelten Daten umfassend zu analysieren‚ÄØ




Intrinsische Motivation sich neue F√§higkeiten anzueignen und ein hohes Ma√ü an Eigeninitiative‚ÄØ

Benefits

Ein motiviertes und leidenschaftliches Team‚ÄØ

Title: V.I.E Software Developer for Autonomous Driving (all gender)
Description:
Company Description

We are the designers of today for the world of tomorrow.

As one of the world's leading engineering service providers, we at ALTEN are committed to positively shaping the future of our partners, the careers of our employees and the challenges facing our society and environment.

More than 50,000 employees in 30 countries are already working on innovative solutions in various engineering and IT sectors such as automotive, aerospace, renewable energy, medical technology and railway technology.

Are you a graduate with EU citizenship aged 18 to 28 and want to gain work experience in Germany?

Find out more about the V.I.E programme atVoluntary program V.I.E - International career at ALTEN Germany (alten-germany.de)

Job Description

YOU...


are responsible for system testing of autonomous driving systems (ADAS)
adopt the existing prototype software and port them to new hardware environments
take part of the development of the Ultra Long Range Radar Sensor Software based on the prototype software, including interfaces to Perception
Interface with German premium automotive OEM‚Äôs and suppliers


Qualifications

YOU..


fulfill the general V.I.E program requirements (European graduate, aged between 18 and 28 years)
hold a degree in Electronics, Electrical or Automotive Engineering
have knowledge in Linux, C/C++ programming, Python and DSpace or JIRA
Experience with AUTOSAR is a plus
are Fluent in English, good Knowledge of German, French is a plus


We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age and sexual orientation and identity.

Severely disabled persons will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified.

Do you have any questions?

Then contact me: Krystyna Kedziorek (+49 711 49091781)

Or apply now using our online application form.

Additional Information


Talent Management‚Äì we develop your career
Language skills‚Äì improve your language skills in your daily work or in online language courses
Work Life Balance‚Äì flexible working hours and mobile working possible
A to Z‚Äì Private International Health Care
Your future‚Äì possibility of permanent employment with ALTEN worldwide
and of course we offer the usual standards such as 30 days holiday, many events, relocation support and corporate benefits.

Title: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Forschungsbereich Bildverarbeitung in der Batteriezellproduktion
Description:
Ausschreibung f√ºr die Fachrichtungen wie z. B.: Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Mechatronik, Medientechnik oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang mit Schwerpunkt Bildverarbeitung / Computer Vision.

Sie wollen die Batteriezellenproduktion der Zukunft mitgestalten und begeistern sich f√ºr die Wertsch√∂pfungspotentiale der industriellen Digitalisierung sowie deren Realisierung in komplexen Produktionsumgebungen? Am Fraunhofer IPA bieten wir Ihnen die einzigartige Verbindung aus anwendungsnaher Wissenschaft und industrieller Beratungspraxis.

F√ºr das Zentrum f√ºr Digitalisierte Batteriezellenproduktion sucht das Fraunhofer IPA eine stud. Hilfskr. (m/w/d) mit Fachexpertise im Bereich der Bildverarbeitung in der Batteriezellproduktion, mit speziellem Fokus auf Echtzeitf√§higkeit der implementierten L√∂sung.

Was Sie bei uns tun

Im Rahmen dieser T√§tigkeit werden vorhandene Bilddaten von Li-Ion Elektrodenb√§ndern zun√§chst (h√§ndisch) klassifiziert und anschlie√üend unterschiedliche Modelle / Algorithmen zur automatischen Klassifizierung trainiert und evaluiert. Ihre Aufgaben umfassen:


Systematische Klassifizierung: Durchf√ºhrung einer (Literatur-)Recherche zur Identifikation und Klassifizierung von Bilddaten sowie m√∂glichen Fehlerarten an den Elektroden. Die definierten Klassen werden in das Modelltraining integriert
Entwicklung und Vergleich von Methoden: Evaluierung und Vergleich verschiedener Bildauswertungsmethoden unter Einsatz von YOLO, OpenCV, un√ºberwachtem Machine Learning und skriptbasierter Klassifizierung
Anforderungsanalyse: Untersuchung der daraus resultierenden Hard- und Softwareanforderungen, um die √úbertragbarkeit der Methoden auf ein bestehendes Visionsystem zu gew√§hrleisten
Leistungsoptimierung: Analyse der Einsatzm√∂glichkeiten und Vorteile von CUDA-Beschleunigungen zur Erreichung von Echtzeitf√§higkeit
Optional: Implementierung einer Kantendetektion, die sich auf ein normiertes Koordinatensystem bezieht, zur Erg√§nzung der Fehlerdetektion
Dokumentation, Interpretation und Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse
Ausf√ºhrung der Umsetzung / Implementierung der Software / Algorithmen als Docker-Container



Was Sie mitbringen


G√ºltige Immatrikulation an einer deutschen Hochschule/Uni
Student*in im Fachbereich Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Mechatronik, Medientechnik oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang mit Schwerpunkt Bildverarbeitung / Computer Vision
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Bildverarbeitung und Erfahrung mit Bildanalyse-Tools
Praktische Erfahrungen im Einsatz von YOLO, OpenCV und un√ºberwachtem Machine Learning
Sicherer Umgang mit skriptbasierten Programmierungen, idealerweise in Python
Grundverst√§ndnis f√ºr Hard- und Softwareanforderungen in visuellen Systemen
Optional: Kenntnisse in CUDA oder GPU-Programmierung sind von Vorteil
Selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise
Gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch
Grundkenntnisse im Umgang + v. a. Integration / Deployment mit Dockern notwendig



Was Sie erwarten k√∂nnen


M√∂glichkeit eigene Ideen in die Arbeit einflie√üen zu lassen
Flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort (1 Anwesenheitstag/Woche am IPA wird erwartet)
Aktive Mitarbeit an einem aktuellen, industrierelevanten Thema in einem engagierten und hilfsbereiten Team



Bei entsprechendem Interesse, Eignung und Definition eines Forschungsziels k√∂nnen die Inhalte im Rahmen einer Abschlussarbeit (Bachelor-/Studien-/Masterarbeit) vertieft werden.

Wir wertsch√§tzen und f√∂rdern die Vielfalt der Kompetenzen unserer Mitarbeitenden und begr√º√üen daher alle Bewerbungen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identit√§t. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.

Title: Junior/Senior Fullstack-Entwickler:in [Go, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript] (w/m/d) ‚Äì Start-up in Stuttgart
Description:
Das ist Steuerbot ü§ñ

Steuerbot ist ein Start-up aus Stuttgart (Fellbach). Unsere Mission ist es, allen Menschen eine Steuererkl√§rung wie vom Steuerberater zu erm√∂glichen. Dazu f√ºhrt Steuerbot den Nutzer im Chat mit pers√∂nlichen, leicht verst√§ndlichen und individuell angepassten Fragen auf dem optimalen Weg zu seiner Steuererkl√§rung. Mit unserer Steuer-App k√§mpfen wir daf√ºr, dass wirklich jeder seine Steuererkl√§rung selbst machen kann und das Maximale f√ºr sich herausholt ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Gehalt und Lebenssituation! üí™

Das sind wir üë´

Bei uns geht es darum, kreative Ideen umzusetzen und unsere Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. Wir verstecken uns nicht hinter ausgefallenen Berufsbezeichnungen oder b√ºrokratischen Prozessen. Stattdessen behandeln wir alle im Team gleich, fair und geben jede Menge Freiheit, um gemeinsam etwas Gro√üartiges zu (er-)schaffen.

Jeder macht Fehler, wir auch! Wir versuchen aber aus allen Fehlern zu lernen und treffen unsere Entscheidungen immer mit Daten, Logik üìà und gesundem Menschenverstand üß†

Seit 7 Jahren ist Steuerbot eine der bestbewerteten Steuer-Apps in Deutschland ü§© Seit zwei Jahren bieten wir zusammen mit Taxfix ein breites Spektrum an Steuerl√∂sungen an, die wir mit dir in die H√§nde von Millionen Steuerzahlern bringen m√∂chten.

Deine Aufgaben üë©‚Äçüíª

Als Fullstack-Entwickler wirst du Teil eines geteilten Teams zwischen Steuerbot und Taxfix unter der direkten F√ºhrung der Steuerbot Gr√ºnder. Du hilfst uns, die einzigartige Technologie zu entwickeln, die das Wachstum von Steuerbot und Taxfix erm√∂glicht und weiter beschleunigt. Gleichzeitig hast du die M√∂glichkeit, bereits bestehende Ans√§tze in den Bereichen CI/CD und Testautomatisierung weiter auszubauen. Das ist Steuerbot ü§ñ

Steuerbot ist ein Start-up aus Stuttgart (Fellbach). Unsere Mission ist es, allen Menschen eine Steuererkl√§rung wie vom Steuerberater zu erm√∂glichen. Mit unserer Steuer-App k√§mpfen wir daf√ºr, dass wirklich jeder seine Steuererkl√§rung selbst machen kann und das Maximale f√ºr sich herausholt ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Gehalt und Lebenssituation! üí™

Das sind wir üë´
