Title: Site Reliability Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
About

Life is always about becoming‚Ä¶ Becoming means going on a journey to be the best version of our future selves. While we discover new things, we will face challenges, master them and grow beyond our individual limits.

Apply for a job at Mercedes-Benz and find your individual role and workspace to unleash your talents to the fullest. Empowered by visionary colleagues who share the same pioneering spirit. Joining us means becoming part of a global team that aims to build the most desirable cars in the world. Together for excellence.

Job-ID: MER0003NA5

Since 2016, Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services GmbH has been connecting the automotive and digital world around the connected vehicle: With innovative data-based solutions, the subsidiary of Mercedes-Benz AG enables its B2B customers to make business processes more efficient, improve customer experiences or develop new business models.

Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services creates digital solutions of the future that help B2B customers to increase their process quality and efficiency, improve customer experiences, act more sustainably or develop new business models. It is based on real-time data from measuring points and signals inside and outside of Mercedes-Benz vehicles worldwide. This data is used to generate added value for products and processes in companies from a wide range of industries. The secure and responsible handling of data is hereby the basis for the acceptance of services around connected driving. The Stuttgart-based company has about 75 employees working on the development, operation and sales of digital data-based products.

Our Engineering & Technology Team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer (f/m/d) on a full-time basis as soon as possible.

Engineering & Technology Team


We are an experienced, passionate & self-organized team being in charge to develop & operate data driven award-winning digital products and innovative IoT services with cloud native microservices for business customers of Mercedes Benz
We are working agile, delivering new features to our customers with every sprint using our automated CI/CD pipeline


These Exciting Tasks Are Waiting For You


Assure high availability of our digital products in front of our customers
Run & monitor our digital products in the cloud
Maintain and enhance our CI/CD pipeline
Shape and enhance our developer platform which is used to develop our digital products
Analyze & solve problems arising in our development and production environments in a blameless culture
Contribute to reviews and share your knowledge with the team


The position is filled as soon as possible on a full-time basis.

Your Profile


You are breathing an agile, cloud native and DevOps mindset
You have a good IT Security & cryptography understanding
You know how to run solutions 24/7
You love automation & Infrastructure as Code
You are familiar with microservice and event driven architectures as well as distributed systems
You are familiar with the Azure cloud and Azure services such as AKS, ADX, API Management, Event Hubs, Log Analytics & Azure DevOps
You are familiar with SQL and NoSQL Databases
You know how to use & tweak tools like Grafana, Kibana, Prometheus and Datadog
You have experience in Gitops and running a CI/CD pipeline
You also like to touch code of our digital products
You are eager to learn new methods and technologies
You are fluent in English; German is a plus.


We Offer More Than Just An Employment Relationship


Shape the future in a mix of corporate and start-up culture with a highly motivated and experienced team
Special benefits, such as accident insurance, company pension scheme allowance, regular breakfast together and lunch lectures etc.
Independent work and freedom to contribute your own ideas
Very good infrastructural connections (close to motorway, car park, underground station)


Please apply online only and include a CV, a cover letter and relevant certificates (max. total size of attachments 6 MB).

Applications in both German and English are welcome.

We are particularly pleased to receive online applications from disabled persons and persons with equivalent disabilities directly in response to this advertisement.

Title: V.I.E Software Developer (all gender)
Description:
Company Description

We are the designers of today for the world of tomorrow.

As one of the world's leading engineering service providers, we at ALTEN are committed to positively shaping the future of our partners, the careers of our employees and the challenges facing our society and environment.

More than 50,000 employees in 30 countries are already working on innovative solutions in various engineering and IT sectors such as automotive, aerospace, renewable energy, medical technology and railway technology.

Are you a graduate with EU citizenship aged 18 to 28 and want to gain work experience in Germany?

Find out more about the V.I.E programme atVoluntary program V.I.E - International career at ALTEN Germany (alten-germany.de)

Job Description

YOU...


develop and implement new software applications with C#
are responsible for the ongoing maintenance and further development of existing software requirements
create functional test scenarios, transfer them to the test automation framework and take responsibility for the technical implementation
supervise the execution of test scenarios with the test automation framework
create reports with dashboards


Qualifications

YOU...


fulfill the general V.I.E program requirements (EU graduate, aged between 18 and 28 years)
hold a degree in electrical engineering, automotive engineering, computer science or similar
have a first experience in software development with C#
have a very good knowledge of English
ideally already possess a first experience in embedded software/automotive industry
ideally have some initial experience in test automation


We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age and sexual orientation and identity.

Severely disabled persons will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified.

Do you have any questions?

Then contact me: Krystyna Kedziorek (Tel: +49 711 49091781)

Or apply now using our online application form.

Additional Information


Talent Management‚Äì we develop your career
Language skills‚Äì improve your language skills in your daily work or in online language courses
Work Life Balance‚Äì flexible working hours and mobile working possible
A to Z‚Äì Private International Health Care
Your future‚Äì possibility of permanent employment with ALTEN worldwide
and of course we offer the usual standards such as 30 days holiday, many events, relocation support and corporate benefits.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

We are the designers of today for the world of tomorrow.

As one of the world's leading engineering service providers, we at ALTEN are committed to positively shaping the future of our partners, the careers of our employees and the challenges facing our society and environment.

More than 50,000 employees in 30 countries are already working on innovative solutions in various engineering and IT sectors such as automotive, aerospace, renewable energy, medical technology and railway technology.

Are you a graduate with EU citizenship aged 18 to 28 and want to gain work experience in Germany?

Find out more about the V.I.E programme atVoluntary program V.I.E - International career at ALTEN Germany (alten-germany.de)

Job Description

YOU...

  • develop and implement new software applications with C#
  • are responsible for the ongoing maintenance and further development of existing software requirements
  • create functional test scenarios, transfer them to the test automation framework and take responsibility for the technical implementation
  • supervise the execution of test scenarios with the test automation framework
  • create reports with dashboards

Qualifications

YOU...

  • fulfill the general V.I.E program requirements (EU graduate, aged between 18 and 28 years)
  • hold a degree in electrical engineering, automotive engineering, computer science or similar
  • have a first experience in software development with C#
  • have a very good knowledge of English
  • ideally already possess a first experience in embedded software/automotive industry
  • ideally have some initial experience in test automation

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age and sexual orientation and identity.

Severely disabled persons will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified.

Do you have any questions?

Then contact me: Krystyna Kedziorek (Tel: +49 711 49091781)

Or apply now using our online application form.

Additional Information

  • Talent Management‚Äì we develop your career
  • Language skills‚Äì improve your language skills in your daily work or in online language courses
  • Work Life Balance‚Äì flexible working hours and mobile working possible
  • A to Z‚Äì Private International Health Care
  • Your future‚Äì possibility of permanent employment with ALTEN worldwide
  • and of course we offer the usual standards such as 30 days holiday, many events, relocation support and corporate benefits.

Title: Work Student, Machine Learning Research & Prototyping (all genders)
Description:
Responsibilities


Build proof of concepts and validate product hypotheses through machine learning prototypes
Support AI product management in proofing feasibility and value of strategic product roadmap items
Take the lead in discussing hypotheses, modelling approaches and implementation options for the AI projects you own end-to-end


Requirements


Currently enrolled in a German University
Fluency in English
Proficient coding skills in Python
Data engineering and back-end skills to acquire, harmonize, wrangle and store large amounts of data from various sources with minimal guidance
High curiosity for and strong ability to assess, grasp and implement theoretical concepts in the area of Knowledge Graphs, Semantic Web, Agentic Frameworks
Ability to explore and rapidly get up to speed with new technologies needed for project success (such as neo4j, LangGraph, MCP)
Proven record of conceptualizing and executing modelling-heavy machine learning projects (e. g. publications, your Git repository, experience from previous roles)
Of course, you will have access to a variety of the latest LLM frontier models


What We Offer


Contract location would be G√∂ppingen, Germany
Make an impact! Take on the responsibility and work on your own projects. Your passion and skills will be used in international projects and support the operations of our business!
Our Work Students in Germany receive a monthly salary of 1.566,00‚Ç¨ for a 20h/week, 1.253,00‚Ç¨ for a 16h/week and 1.400,00‚Ç¨ for an Intern position.
Do you need to gain your first work experience as a part of a mandatory internship? Maybe you are looking for some exciting and time flexible tasks along to your studies? Join us in a role that suits you! We also offer Bachelor and Master Thesis options.
Fixed Student Contract with above average salary and trust based working hours
Make yourself at home! We don't wear ties. In our casual office atmosphere, you can wear whatever you want and enjoy your breaks in one of our many lounge areas
Hungry for knowledge? Our TeamViewer Library offers a wide range of industry-related books selections, and our E-Learning Center is available 24/7
We truly live and celebrate our cultural diversity! Our colleagues come from more than 70 countries and speak more than 40 languages
We work hard and play harder! Look forward to our company celebrations, team events and other social gatherings
No matter if you are using private or public transportation means, we offer travel subsidy to all our students
Attractive workstations with modern and ergonomic equipment, fruits, soft drinks, sports offerings and many other corporate benefits wait for you!
In our HQ you have access to the office with a canteen, subsidized lunches and a terrace with BBQ
Our students are the potential employees of "tomorrow" - After your studies, you will have good chances of starting a full-time job


TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Title: SAP Developer (f/m/d) ‚Äì 12 months fixed term
Description:
About

TTI is a fast-growing world leader in Power Tools, Accessories, Hand Tools and Outdoor Power Equipment for do-it-yourself/DIY, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair, maintenance, construction and infrastructure industries. Powerful brands, innovative products, exceptional people and operational excellence: We are dedicated to improving the lives of homeowners and tradespeople around the world. Join us and become a part of our success story.

In order to support SAP projects/changes in the future and to strengthen our team in Winnenden, we are looking for an

SAP Developer (f/m/d) ‚Äì 12 months fixed term


Provide input into the design of SAP enhancements and rollouts, offering proactive advice to functional consultants and business partners
Analyze business requirements and create technical specifications for ABAP programming work and all module interfaces, translating requirements into an appropriate system design and version control of deliverables
Code application components
Ensure sustainable, scalable, flexible and template-conform solutions with good performance
Ensure developments are coded in a way that complies with SAP best practices
Project management of multiple small concurrent coding projects
Drive resolution and be responsible for assigned tasks and their deliverables
Ensure on time delivery of developments and proactively seek support when required
Document, prepare and execute unit test plans and support project test cycles
Perform quality reviews of documentation, code and test plans
Demonstrate a structured approach to time management and task prioritization
Guide and manage external ABAP developers if applicable
Provide periodic progress updates and development status
Good development skills of the following areas with relevant hands-on coding experience:
SAP ABAP and SAP ABAP OO, Data Dictionary, IDoc message processing, BADIs/BAPIs, ABAP Objects programming, SAP user exits/enhancements
Fiori, SAPUI5 preferred
Debugging skills in ABAP and trouble-shooting skills in general
Knowledge of SAP Gateway configuration and development
Experience in forms development with Adobe PDF and Smartforms preferred
Experience of working on a highly customized SAP system
Knowledge of SAP functional areas, particularly SD, LE and WM is a plus
An interest in understanding business processes and challenges in order to effectively develop technical solutions while considering changing demands to ensure efficiency
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies
Willingness to learn new technologies with an analytical approach to problem-solving
Willingness to travel within Europe when required
Good English skills
An interesting position with an attractive company ‚Äì recognised as a "top employer‚Äú by kununu
Flexible, trust-based working hours (40 hours per week) and 30 days annual leave
Company pension scheme
Free parking spaces directly next to the office and good public transport connections
Fresh fruit, water and hot beverages for free
Company fitness via ‚ÄúEGYM Wellpass‚Äú and bike leasing via ‚ÄúJobRad‚Äú
EAP/Employee Assistance Program (mental support for employees)
Learning platforms such as ‚ÄúGoodHabitz‚Äú and ‚ÄúLearn TTI‚Äú for your professional development
Special employee benefits via ‚ÄúFamily & Friends‚Äú and additional corporate benefits

Title: Solution Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About Us

At ATOSS Software SE, we are driving the future of workforce management. With our software solutions, we are helping our customers to work more creatively, intelligently and humanely, revolutionizing and optimizing the interplay between profitability and humanity. With 19 consecutive years of record growth, inclusion in the SDAX and TecDAX, we continue to expand globally.

The Person You are

At ATOSS, we hire for both character and skill, seeking individuals who embody resilience, a pioneering spirit, and the passion to grow.

We Value Those Who

Think like entrepreneurs ‚Äì taking ownership, pushing boundaries, and driving impact.

Challenge the status quo ‚Äì bringing fresh ideas and bold execution to the table.

Thrive in change ‚Äì seeing growth as a lifelong journey, both professionally and personally.

The Role

Are you passionate about bridging the gap between technology and customer needs?

As a Solution Engineer (m/f/d), you'll play a key role in understanding our clients' processes, identifying their unique requirements, and transforming them into our tailored software solutions. You'll work closely with Sales, Product Management, and Consulting teams to deliver value-driven solutions that make a real impact.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the primary contact for technical and functional inquiries, developing innovative solutions for complex customer challenges.
Support the sales process as a trusted advisor, building strong and lasting relationships with prospects and clients.
Conduct high-quality workshops (both virtual and on-site) to analyze customer needs and present tailored software solutions beyond basic feature demonstrations.
Collaborate with Product Management to stay ahead of market trends and ensure our solutions meet evolving customer demands.
Assist in the preparation of RFPs/RFIs and provide expert consultation during proposal processes.
Contribute to the team's success by sharing your expertise and fostering creative solutions.


Key Requirements


Successfully completed degree or vocational training in an IT-related field.
Experience with ATOSS software as a user or key user beneficial.
Strong interest in digitalization, software solutions, and process optimization.
Excellent presentation and communication skills in both German and English.
High service orientation and a structured, solution-focused approach to work.
Willingness to travel (approximately 2‚Äì3 days per week).


Our Benefits


Competitive Rewards: Including profit-sharing and employee stock program.
Structured Onboarding & Continuous Leadership Development: Clear career paths onboarding through Expert & Leadership Tracks, plus access to ATOSS Academy.
Flexible Work Culture: Hybrid options (remote within the EU), 30 days of vacation, and a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion.
Engaging Team Environment: Seasonal company events, team retreats, and an in-house barista.
Health & Wellbeing: Including regular check-ups, corporate wellness programs, and Wellpass membership.
Stability & Growth: Company listed on SDAX & TecDAX, with 19+ years of record-breaking revenue and a 30%+ EBIT margin. Certified Top Employer¬© for the 5th year in a row.


At Atoss, great talent knows no limits. We welcome professionals from all backgrounds and empower their growth through an inclusive, skill focused environment.

Join us and be part of a high-growth, future-focused company!
Show more

Title: Senior Software Solutions / Data Engineer
Description:
For our client, one of the world's largest provider of Automatic Test Equipment (Chip Test Systems for the Semiconductor Industry), we are looking for a Senior Software Solutions / Data Engineer (m/f/d) in permanent employment:




Key Responsibilities:

Application Ownership: Design, develop, and maintain full-stack, three-tier application, a Data Analytics Platform (Database, Application layer, Presentation Layers) in a cloud infrastructure, primarily AWS.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with Product Owners and offshore developers to ensure effective communication, alignment, and timely delivery of features.
Code Quality Management: Establish and enforce a structured code quality assurance process for the offshore development team, ensuring that all code meets high standards of reliability, functionality, and maintainability before release.




Required Qualifications:

Collaboration & Communication: Proven ability to work effectively with distributed teams, including offshore developers, contract manufacturers, and internal stakeholders.
Programming: Proficient in Python and SQL (mandatory)
Cloud Experience: Strong experience with AWS or similar cloud platforms; familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform.
DevOps & Infrastructure: Hands-on experience with relational databases, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-based applications.
Networking Knowledge: Solid understanding of network architecture, including IP routing and security, particularly in cloud environments.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with JavaScript, PySpark, Docker, Apache Airflow
Familiarity with identity and access management (IAM) systems




Sounds interesting? Apply today!

Title: Post-Doctoral Fellowship Position (m/w/d) Entwicklung innovativer KI Modelle zur Optimierung der Patientenversorgung im Rahmen des BHC-ETH Fellowship Programms zu angewandter KI im Gesundheitswesen
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

DerBosch Health Campusvereint alle Institutionen und F√∂rderaktivit√§ten der Robert Bosch Stiftung im Bereich Gesundheit. ‚ÄûBehandeln. Forschen. Bilden. F√∂rdern.‚Äú - Dieser Mission folgt der Campus mit seinen Einrichtungen f√ºr eine zukunfts- und patientenorientierte Gesundheitsversorgung. Es erwarten Sie ein abwechslungsreiches Arbeitsumfeld mit Schwerpunkt F√∂rder- und Forschungsaktivit√§ten, vielf√§ltige Themen sowie ein engagiertes und freundliches Team.

Weitere Informationen zum Bosch Health Campus:www.bosch-health-campus.de

Das Programm

Das Robert Bosch Centrum f√ºr Innovation im Gesundheitswesen f√∂rdert im Rahmen einer Partnerschaft zwischen dem Bosch Health Campus Stuttgart (koordiniert durch den Bosch Digital Innovation Hub (BDIH)) und der ETH Z√ºrich (koordiniert durch das ETH AI Center) gemeinsame KI-Forschungsstipendien f√ºr Nachwuchswissenschaftler (m/w/d). Mit dem Stipendienprogramm wollen die beiden Einrichtungen innovative Ans√§tze in der KI-Forschung entwickeln und so die Gesundheitsversorgung der Zukunft verbessern.

Das Centrum f√ºr Medizinische Datenintegration

Das Centrum f√ºr Medizinische Datenintegration (meDIC) hat zum Ziel, die vielf√§ltigen klinischen Daten der Regelversorgung am Robert Bosch Krankenhaus f√ºr die medizinische Forschung zug√§nglich zu machen. Hierzu werden technische L√∂sungen erarbeitet sowie organisatorische und regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen geschaffen. Das meDIC √ºbernimmt damit sowohl eine verbindende Rolle zwischen Medizin und Informatik, als auch zwischen klinischer Behandlung und medizinischer Forschung. Als zentrale Einrichtung am BHC f√ºr die Entwicklung innovativer digitaler L√∂sungen f√ºr eine patientenzentriete und personalisierte Versorgung und Forschung werden am meDIC bereits heute vielf√§ltige Projekte in enger Kooperation mit den Forschern und Klinikern am Campus umgesetzt. Ein besonderer Fokus liegt hierbei auf der Entwicklung und Implementierung von KI basierten Systemen zur Optimierung der Patientenversorgung sowie der klinischen Prozesse. Im Rahmen des BHC-ETH Stipendienprogramms ist eine Fellowship-Position am meDIC zu besetzen.

Title: V.I.E Software Developer for Autonomous Driving (all gender)
Description:
Company Description

We are the designers of today for the world of tomorrow.

As one of the world's leading engineering service providers, we at ALTEN are committed to positively shaping the future of our partners, the careers of our employees and the challenges facing our society and environment.

More than 50,000 employees in 30 countries are already working on innovative solutions in various engineering and IT sectors such as automotive, aerospace, renewable energy, medical technology and railway technology.

Are you a graduate with EU citizenship aged 18 to 28 and want to gain work experience in Germany?

Find out more about the V.I.E programme atVoluntary program V.I.E - International career at ALTEN Germany (alten-germany.de)

Job Description

YOU...


are responsible for system testing of autonomous driving systems (ADAS)
adopt the existing prototype software and port them to new hardware environments
take part of the development of the Ultra Long Range Radar Sensor Software based on the prototype software, including interfaces to Perception
Interface with German premium automotive OEM‚Äôs and suppliers


Qualifications

YOU..


fulfill the general V.I.E program requirements (European graduate, aged between 18 and 28 years)
hold a degree in Electronics, Electrical or Automotive Engineering
have knowledge in Linux, C/C++ programming, Python and DSpace or JIRA
Experience with AUTOSAR is a plus
are Fluent in English, good Knowledge of German, French is a plus


We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age and sexual orientation and identity.

Severely disabled persons will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified.

Do you have any questions?

Then contact me: Krystyna Kedziorek (+49 711 49091781)

Or apply now using our online application form.

Additional Information


Talent Management‚Äì we develop your career
Language skills‚Äì improve your language skills in your daily work or in online language courses
Work Life Balance‚Äì flexible working hours and mobile working possible
A to Z‚Äì Private International Health Care
Your future‚Äì possibility of permanent employment with ALTEN worldwide
and of course we offer the usual standards such as 30 days holiday, many events, relocation support and corporate benefits.

Title: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Forschungsbereich Bildverarbeitung in der Batteriezellproduktion
Description:
Ausschreibung f√ºr die Fachrichtungen wie z. B.: Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Mechatronik, Medientechnik oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang mit Schwerpunkt Bildverarbeitung / Computer Vision.

Sie wollen die Batteriezellenproduktion der Zukunft mitgestalten und begeistern sich f√ºr die Wertsch√∂pfungspotentiale der industriellen Digitalisierung sowie deren Realisierung in komplexen Produktionsumgebungen? Sie sind motiviert von den Herausforderungen bei der Entwicklung von Softwarel√∂sungen f√ºr Energiespeichertechnologien und m√∂chten einen Beitrag zur effizienten Nutzung zuk√ºnftiger Energieumwandlungs- und Speichertechnologien leisten? Sie sind auf der Suche nach vielf√§ltigen Herausforderungen, anspruchsvollen Aufgaben und der Arbeit in einem dynamischen, interdisziplin√§r besetzten Projektteam? Sie reizt der Forschungsfreiraum, durch den anwendungsnahe Innovationen entstehen und in die Industrie transferiert werden? Am Fraunhofer IPA bieten wir Ihnen die einzigartige Verbindung aus anwendungsnaher Wissenschaft und industrieller Beratungspraxis.

F√ºr das Zentrum f√ºr Digitalisierte Batteriezellenproduktion sucht das Fraunhofer IPA eine stud. Hilfskr. (m/w/d) mit Fachexpertise im Bereich der Bildverarbeitung in der Batteriezellproduktion, mit speziellem Fokus auf Echtzeitf√§higkeit der implementierten L√∂sung.

Was Sie bei uns tun

Im Rahmen dieser T√§tigkeit werden vorhandene Bilddaten von Li-Ion Elektrodenb√§ndern zun√§chst (h√§ndisch) klassifiziert und anschlie√üend unterschiedliche Modelle / Algorithmen zur automatischen Klassifizierung trainiert und evaluiert. Ihre Aufgaben umfassen:


Systematische Klassifizierung: Durchf√ºhrung einer (Literatur-)Recherche zur Identifikation und Klassifizierung von Bilddaten sowie m√∂glichen Fehlerarten an den Elektroden. Die definierten Klassen werden in das Modelltraining integriert
Entwicklung und Vergleich von Methoden: Evaluierung und Vergleich verschiedener Bildauswertungsmethoden unter Einsatz von YOLO, OpenCV, un√ºberwachtem Machine Learning und skriptbasierter Klassifizierung
Anforderungsanalyse: Untersuchung der daraus resultierenden Hard- und Softwareanforderungen, um die √úbertragbarkeit der Methoden auf ein bestehendes Visionsystem zu gew√§hrleisten
Leistungsoptimierung: Analyse der Einsatzm√∂glichkeiten und Vorteile von CUDA-Beschleunigungen zur Erreichung von Echtzeitf√§higkeit
Optional: Implementierung einer Kantendetektion, die sich auf ein normiertes Koordinatensystem bezieht, zur Erg√§nzung der Fehlerdetektion
Dokumentation, Interpretation und Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse
Ausf√ºhrung der Umsetzung / Implementierung der Software / Algorithmen als Docker-Container



Was Sie mitbringen


G√ºltige Immatrikulation an einer deutschen Hochschule/Uni
Student*in im Fachbereich Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Mechatronik, Medientechnik oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang mit Schwerpunkt Bildverarbeitung / Computer Vision
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Bildverarbeitung und Erfahrung mit Bildanalyse-Tools
Praktische Erfahrungen im Einsatz von YOLO, OpenCV und un√ºberwachtem Machine Learning
Sicherer Umgang mit skriptbasierten Programmierungen, idealerweise in Python
Grundverst√§ndnis f√ºr Hard- und Softwareanforderungen in visuellen Systemen
Optional: Kenntnisse in CUDA oder GPU-Programmierung sind von Vorteil
Selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise
Gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch
Grundkenntnisse im Umgang + v. a. Integration / Deployment mit Dockern notwendig



Was Sie erwarten k√∂nnen


M√∂glichkeit eigene Ideen in die Arbeit einflie√üen zu lassen
Flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort (1 Anwesenheitstag/Woche am IPA wird erwartet)
Aktive Mitarbeit an einem aktuellen, industrierelevanten Thema in einem engagierten und hilfsbereiten Team



Bei entsprechendem Interesse, Eignung und Definition eines Forschungsziels k√∂nnen die Inhalte im Rahmen einer Abschlussarbeit (Bachelor-/Studien-/Masterarbeit) vertieft werden.

Wir freuen uns √ºber Ihr Interesse.

Es werden nur vollst√§ndige Bewerbungen ber√ºcksichtigt, die ein spezifisches Anschreiben, einen Lebenslauf sowie aktuelle Zeugnisunterlagen (auch vorl√§ufige Notenspiegel) enthalten.

Wir wertsch√§tzen und f√∂rdern die Vielfalt der Kompetenzen unserer Mitarbeitenden und begr√º√üen daher alle Bewerbungen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identit√§t. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.

Mit ihrer Fokussierung auf zukunftsrelevante Schl√ºsseltechnologien sowie auf die Verwertung der Ergebnisse in Wirtschaft und Industrie spielt die Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft eine zentrale Rolle im Innovationsprozess. Als Wegweiser und Impulsgeber f√ºr innovative Entwicklungen und wissenschaftliche Exzellenz wirkt sie mit an der Gestaltung unserer Gesellschaft und unserer Zukunft.

Title: Site Reliability Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
About

Life is always about becoming‚Ä¶ Becoming means going on a journey to be the best version of our future selves. While we discover new things, we will face challenges, master them and grow beyond our individual limits.

Apply for a job at Mercedes-Benz and find your individual role and workspace to unleash your talents to the fullest. Empowered by visionary colleagues who share the same pioneering spirit. Joining us means becoming part of a global team that aims to build the most desirable cars in the world. Together for excellence.

Job-ID: MER0003NA5

Since 2016, Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services GmbH has been connecting the automotive and digital world around the connected vehicle: With innovative data-based solutions, the subsidiary of Mercedes-Benz AG enables its B2B customers to make business processes more efficient, improve customer experiences or develop new business models.

Mercedes-Benz Connectivity Services creates digital solutions of the future that help B2B customers to increase their process quality and efficiency, improve customer experiences, act more sustainably or develop new business models. It is based on real-time data from measuring points and signals inside and outside of Mercedes-Benz vehicles worldwide. This data is used to generate added value for products and processes in companies from a wide range of industries. The secure and responsible handling of data is hereby the basis for the acceptance of services around connected driving. The Stuttgart-based company has about 75 employees working on the development, operation and sales of digital data-based products.

Our Engineering & Technology Team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer (f/m/d) on a full-time basis as soon as possible.

Engineering & Technology Team


We are an experienced, passionate & self-organized team being in charge to develop & operate data driven award-winning digital products and innovative IoT services with cloud native microservices for business customers of Mercedes Benz
We are working agile, delivering new features to our customers with every sprint using our automated CI/CD pipeline


These Exciting Tasks Are Waiting For You


Assure high availability of our digital products in front of our customers
Run & monitor our digital products in the cloud
Maintain and enhance our CI/CD pipeline
Shape and enhance our developer platform which is used to develop our digital products
Analyze & solve problems arising in our development and production environments in a blameless culture
Contribute to reviews and share your knowledge with the team


The position is filled as soon as possible on a full-time basis.

Your Profile


You are breathing an agile, cloud native and DevOps mindset
You have a good IT Security & cryptography understanding
You know how to run solutions 24/7
You love automation & Infrastructure as Code
You are familiar with microservice and event driven architectures as well as distributed systems
You are familiar with the Azure cloud and Azure services such as AKS, ADX, API Management, Event Hubs, Log Analytics & Azure DevOps
You are familiar with SQL and NoSQL Databases
You know how to use & tweak tools like Grafana, Kibana, Prometheus and Datadog
You have experience in Gitops and running a CI/CD pipeline
You also like to touch code of our digital products
You are eager to learn new methods and technologies
You are fluent in English; German is a plus.


We Offer More Than Just An Employment Relationship


Shape the future in a mix of corporate and start-up culture with a highly motivated and experienced team
Special benefits, such as accident insurance, company pension scheme allowance, regular breakfast together and lunch lectures etc.
Independent work and freedom to contribute your own ideas
Very good infrastructural connections (close to motorway, car park, underground station)


Please apply online only and include a CV, a cover letter and relevant certificates (max. total size of attachments 6 MB).

Applications in both German and English are welcome.

We are particularly pleased to receive online applications from disabled persons and persons with equivalent disabilities directly in response to this advertisement.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently building a Global Data Science team for a Global Infectious Disease company. We are looking for 2 Data Science Contractors to help support the project.




You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality and cleansing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 2 - 3 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Only at McKinsey

Work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries‚Äì Identify micro patterns in data that our clients can exploit to maintain their competitive advantage and watch your technical solutions transform their day-to-day business.

Experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader‚Äì Develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.

Be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse multidisciplinary teams - Develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Impact

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers,‚ÄØmachine‚ÄØlearning‚ÄØengineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and‚ÄØmachine‚ÄØlearning‚ÄØto derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

You will be a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning‚ÄØfrom colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.‚ÄØ

As a Data Scientist, you will


Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions.
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client.
Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics.
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox.
You will do Machine Learning & statistical modelling as well as implementing generative AI and LLM use cases.
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish.
You will take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers; work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally.
Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact; you will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.‚ÄØ


Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
0-2 years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning) R and/or Python (must). Experience with PySpark/PyData is desirable
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Willingness to travel

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Impact

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers,‚ÄØmachine‚ÄØlearning‚ÄØengineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and‚ÄØmachine‚ÄØlearning‚ÄØto derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

You will be a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning‚ÄØfrom colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.‚ÄØ

As a Data Scientist, you will

  • Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions.
  • Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client.
  • Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics.
  • Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox.
  • You will do Machine Learning & statistical modelling as well as implementing generative AI and LLM use cases.
  • Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish.
  • You will take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers; work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally.
  • Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact; you will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.‚ÄØ

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
  • 0-2 years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
  • Programming experience (focus on machine learning) R and/or Python (must). Experience with PySpark/PyData is desirable
  • Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
  • Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
  • Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
  • Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
  • Willingness to travel

Title: Data Scientist (Consultant)
Description:
Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight‚Äôs purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




What does it mean to be a Data Scientist Consultant at Netlight?

It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.




As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.




As a Data Scientist Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Science. It can be working within Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.




Minimum Qualifications

Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
Verbal and written fluency in English
0,5-5 years of work experience within the data science field related to IT and software products in agile teams




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications.




We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
More independence, freedom, and better pay

Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.

It's not rocket science.

Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.

The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.

Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.

Why Coody

At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?

Maximized Compensation - Typically a +40% salary increase.

Freedom & Flexibility - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.

Employment Security - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.

Shaping the Future - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.

This is Coody

We‚Äôre a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.

Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.

Explore our Employee Handbook and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.

What you‚Äôll be doing

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Coody, you‚Äôll dive into exciting and challenging AI projects to build and optimize machine learning models for production use cases, ensuring they are highly efficient and scalable. You‚Äôll also design and build machine learning infrastructure, often in cloud environments, to support large-scale deployments for our customers. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products
Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems
Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment
Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies
Collaborate with clients, support colleagues, contribute to knowledge sharing


Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for Machine Learning Engineers with at least 3-4 years of experience and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you‚Äôve got the following, you‚Äôre probably a great fit:


A track-record of delivering machine learning models in production
Cloud experience (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
Experience with distributed data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or something related
Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


How to apply

Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role to design, build and maintain machine learning models for all our business areas. You will work on problems where you will get to utilize your skills in such interrelated disciplines as software engineering, data engineering, data science and machine learning. In the end, you will drive and contribute to solutions of some of our key problems around maximizing availability, reliability & safety, and parking. You will be joining the team that is uniquely positioned to ensure that our users have a scooter nearby at the time and place they need it. Further, you will have a big impact on anticipating and acting early on a vehicle‚Äôs maintenance needs, which plays a key role in the good user riding experience.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


You will be embedded in a cross-functional product team and contribute to building machine learning projects end-to-end, starting from a business problem, building solution hypotheses, defining data requirements, creating prototypes, implementing it into production, and measuring the business impact
Drive and co-develop production-grade models with a focus on reliability and scalability. Prioritize between different solution paths together with the product manager while focusing on expected business impact
With the team's support, make improvements and maintain our machine learning platform which ensures that machine learning products at Voi follow the state of the art MLOps standards
Collaborate with colleagues towards improving team ways-of-working and supporting each other through learning and sharing


What You Need To Embark

We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning professional with experience from working in a fast-paced environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:


Higher education in one of the mathematical sciences such as computer science, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics or with a similar, data centric, degree
A strong business sense with laser focus on business value and user impact
Fluency in Python and software engineering in general
Experience of working with real-time inference and/or MLOps in GCP is a bonus
Documented experience in developing production-quality software
Hands-on contribution to managing projects from start to finish ‚Äì from tackling business challenges to planning, building, launching, and keeping an eye on the results.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You‚Äôll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europes #1 micromobility company
Get ‚Äúskin in the game‚Äù through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation and a scalable ML function
Voi is a multicultural company with employees from all over the world, which is something we value deeply. With a flexible public holiday policy, you have the opportunity to choose which holidays, religious or cultural, you want to celebrate.
We do hackdays and lab days to inspire growth and explore new solutions to problems. We hope to see creative ideas to tackle hard problems that you find important to solve with colleagues outside your inner team.
While everyone is encouraged to meet their colleagues at the office, we do have a hybrid setup when it comes to remote work in order to find the optimal work-life-balance.
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values ‚Äì customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste ‚Äì are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Are you a data scientist who thrives on turning complex data into meaningful business insights and solutions? We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our AI & Analytics team at Scania. In this high-impact role, you will take the lead in driving data science initiatives end-to-end‚Äîfrom exploration to deployment‚Äîand act as a key contributor in building our future services.

You will collaborate closely with our Lead Data Scientist, development teams, and business stakeholders, with the freedom and trust to drive work with aligned autonomy. At the same time, you will contribute actively to broader team activities and cross-functional initiatives‚Äîbuilding trust, strengthening relationships, and helping us establish data science as a natural part of how we create value across Scania.

This is a unique opportunity to combine technical excellence, ownership, and collaborative leadership at a critical point in our transformation journey.

Job Responsibilities

You will:



Lead and deliver data science initiatives in a cross functional environment, applying advanced analytics, machine learning, and statistical modelling
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities and translate them into actionable data-driven solutions
Develop and maintain robust data pipelines and deploy models in a cloud-first environment (AWS and Databricks)
Support and mentor colleagues by sharing best practices, acting as a technical guide and enabler for the team
Simplify and communicate complex concepts to a wide audience, fostering engagement and understanding
Contribute to strengthening our data and analytics strategy, aligning innovation with practical business needs
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and new methods to continuously improve our capabilities



Who You Are

You are an experienced, and strategic data scientist who is passionate about creating real-world impact through data. You thrive when given ownership, but you also understand that building trust, relationships, and team spirit is just as crucial as building models.

You bring:



Experience working in cloud-first environments (AWS preferred) and familiarity with Databricks or similar platforms
A strong ability to plan, organize, and drive projects with a focus on customer outcomes
A flexible, positive, and collaborative attitude‚Äîyou contribute where needed to strengthen the team and build lasting relationships
Strong expertise in Python and modern data science workflows
A proven track record of applying advanced analytics to solve real business problems
An eagerness to mentor others and share knowledge in a collaborative environment
Curiosity and adaptability to embrace a fast-evolving organizational and technical landscape
Experience in handling large, complex datasets, MLOps principles, and familiarity with data architecture concepts is highly valuable.



This Is Us

We are an AI & Analytics team at Scania‚Äîa group of 20+ experts with deep knowledge in data engineering, analysis, and machine learning. We‚Äôre part of the Digital Customer Services and work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact tools and insights that supports Scania‚Äôs customers, as well as development and sales of our services.

Our environment is intellectually curious, technically progressive, and deeply collaborative. The team is navigating an exciting and challenging transformation, where individual drive, curiosity but also collaboration and flexibility are components on which we build our success. We are guided by data mesh principles, a cloud-first mindset, and lean-agile ways of working

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gr√∂ndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to S√∂dert√§lje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-25. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:

Group Manager Martin Wennerstein, martin.wennerstein@scania.com

We look forward to your application!
Show more

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gr√∂ndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to S√∂dert√§lje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-25. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:

Group Manager Martin Wennerstein, martin.wennerstein@scania.com

We look forward to your application!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description

Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company

Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.

Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.

Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.

Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 4+ years‚Äô professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and Vertex AI.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation


Application deadline: 25-05-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

üöÄ Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

üåü A secure monthly salary ‚Äì together we‚Äôll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

üöó Company car ‚Äì we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

üíº Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

üå¥ Vacation ‚Äì Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

üè• Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

üìö Skills development ‚Äì you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

üïë Quality of life ‚Äì Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are increasing our team with Machine Learning Engineer (Consultant)




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll be a key part of our team, helping clients solve critical business challenges by designing, building, and maintaining intelligent systems. Your work will span across software engineering, data engineering, and applied machine learning. And turning complex problems into scalable, real-world solutions.




What You'll Do

Build end-to-end ML solutions: explore large datasets, experiment with models, engineer features, test and evaluate performance, and deploy to production.




Develop components, services, and frameworks that support common ML needs. From feature reuse and version tracking to A/B testing and model monitoring.




Work closely with cross-functional product teams to take ideas from concept to deployment, starting from business goals and ending with measurable outcomes.




Own the reliability and scalability of production-grade models.




Continuously improve team practices through collaboration, feedback, and knowledge sharing.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

We're looking for someone with strong technical foundations, business focus, that likes to get things done!




A degree in a quantitative field like computer science, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics, or similar.




Fluency in Python and experience writing clean, production-level code.




A sharp business sense.




Experience working with cloud platforms and modern ML tooling.




Comfortable with both batch and streaming data; you understand the tools and trade-offs for processing large-scale, heterogeneous datasets.




Hands-on experience taking projects from business problem to deployed solution ‚Äî and staying involved to measure and refine impact.




Bonus if you have been deploying ML models in cloud-native environments




Why ANIMARUM

At ANIMARUM, it‚Äôs not just about the job‚Äîit‚Äôs about being part of a team where everyone supports one another. We believe in




A Human-Centered Approach

We‚Äôre a team that genuinely cares about each other and strives to create a workplace where everyone can grow and succeed.




Opportunities to Grow

Whether you‚Äôre just starting your career or you‚Äôre a seasoned pro, we provide opportunities to continue learning and advancing.




Work-Life Balance

We understand that life isn‚Äôt all about work. We support you in finding that perfect balance between career and personal life.




Benefits That Make Life Easier

At ANIMARUM, we want our team members to thrive‚Äînot just at work, but in life. That‚Äôs why we offer a range of benefits that make life a little easier:




Wellness Allowance

Boost your well-being with our 5000 SEK¬†wellness allowance each year. Whether it‚Äôs gym memberships, massage therapy, or anything that helps you feel great‚Äîit's yours to spend!




Company Car or Bike

Travel in style with the option of a company car or company bike‚Äîperfect for your daily commute or weekend adventures.




Salary Exchange

We offer salary exchange, so you can make smart financial choices for your future.




SL Travel Card

We make commuting easy with a SL travel card, so you can forget about buying tickets and focus on getting where you need to be.




Making Life Work

We know it can be tricky to juggle work and life, which is why we‚Äôve partnered with companies that offer discounted services for ANIMARUM employees, including: Childcare services, Cleaning services, Tutoring services. All to make your life a little less hectic.




Giving Back To Society

We believe in the power of doing good. That‚Äôs why every year, our employees get the chance to donate a set amount to a charity of their choice. Whether it‚Äôs supporting education, the environment, or helping those in need, we empower our team members to contribute to causes they‚Äôre passionate about.




Competitive Salaries & Stock-Options Program

We know our greatest asset is our amazing team, and we believe that should be reflected in your paycheck! That‚Äôs why we offer several flexible and competitive pay packages to suit everyone:




No matter which package you choose, we‚Äôre committed to ensuring you‚Äôre fairly rewarded and that you have the freedom to shape your earnings.

Whether you‚Äôre just starting your career or you‚Äôre a seasoned pro, we provide opportunities to continue learning and advancing.


Work-Life Balance

We understand that life isn‚Äôt all about work. We support you in finding that perfect balance between career and personal life.


Benefits That Make Life Easier

At ANIMARUM, we want our team members to thrive‚Äînot just at work, but in life. That‚Äôs why we offer a range of benefits that make life a little easier:


Wellness Allowance

Boost your well-being with our 5000 SEK wellness allowance each year. Whether it‚Äôs gym memberships, massage therapy, or anything that helps you feel great‚Äîit's yours to spend!


Company Car or Bike

Travel in style with the option of a company car or company bike‚Äîperfect for your daily commute or weekend adventures.


Salary Exchange

We offer salary exchange, so you can make smart financial choices for your future.


SL Travel Card

We make commuting easy with a SL travel card, so you can forget about buying tickets and focus on getting where you need to be.


Making Life Work

We know it can be tricky to juggle work and life, which is why we‚Äôve partnered with companies that offer discounted services for ANIMARUM employees, including: Childcare services, Cleaning services, Tutoring services. All to make your life a little less hectic.


Giving Back To Society

We believe in the power of doing good. That‚Äôs why every year, our employees get the chance to donate a set amount to a charity of their choice. Whether it‚Äôs supporting education, the environment, or helping those in need, we empower our team members to contribute to causes they‚Äôre passionate about.


Competitive Salaries & Stock-Options Program

We know our greatest asset is our amazing team, and we believe that should be reflected in your paycheck! That‚Äôs why we offer several flexible and competitive pay packages to suit everyone:


No matter which package you choose, we‚Äôre committed to ensuring you‚Äôre fairly rewarded and that you have the freedom to shape your earnings.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
The primary tasks for a Machine Learning Engineer in MLE area are:

Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company

Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.

Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.

Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.

Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.

Required skills and experiences:

Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.

Have 4+ years‚Äô professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.

A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.

Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.

Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.

Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and Vertex AI.

Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.

Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.

Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.

Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation

About Rasulson Consulting

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you‚Äôll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

Title: Data Scientist - Games
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Embark, you will play a crucial role in our team of data professionals, focusing specifically on gaming analytics. You will be instrumental in providing insights and support for our game titles, leveraging data to optimize player experience, and providing actionable insights for the game development team. This position presents an exciting opportunity to merge your love for gaming with your expertise in data analytics.

Example Of Responsibilities


Collaborate and work closely with game designers and business stakeholders
Research and develop metrics and performance indicators
Extract, analyze and communicate insights from gameplay data
Design telemetry logging
Communicate results clearly and concisely to stakeholders from both game and commercial teams



We would love if you have


A creative and curious mind
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with database querying, preferably using tools such as BigQuery
Experience in working with ETLs and data pipelines
Proficiency in Python scripting for data manipulation and analysis
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights and recommendations
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience from working in a fast-paced environment where your skills depend on personal independence and agility
Experience with game analytics and an interest in playing games
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."
Show more
