Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

Role Overview

The Lead Data Scientist is responsible for developing and deploying advanced AI/ML models, leveraging statistical techniques, machine learning, and deep learning to extract actionable insights. This role requires strong expertise in Python-based AI/ML development, big data processing, and cloud-based AI platforms (Databricks, Azure ML, AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI).

Key Responsibilities


Data Exploration & Feature Engineering
Perform thorough Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and identify key variables, patterns, and anomalies.
Engineer and select features for optimal model performance, leveraging domain understanding.
Machine Learning & Statistical Modelling
Implement both classical ML methods (regression, clustering, time-series forecasting) and advanced algorithms (XGBoost, LightGBM).
Address computer vision, NLP, and generative tasks using PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Transformer-based models.
Model Deployment & MLOps
Integrate CI/CD pipelines for ML models using platforms like MLflow, Kubeflow, or SageMaker Pipelines.
Monitor model performance over time and manage retraining to mitigate drift.
Business Insights & Decision Support
Communicate analytical findings to key stakeholders in clear, actionable terms.
Provide data-driven guidance to inform product strategies and business initiatives.
Ethical AI & Governance
Ensure compliance with regulations (GDPR) and implement bias mitigation.
Employ model explainability methods (SHAP, LIME) and adopt best practices for responsible AI


Qualifications


Technical Skills
Programming:
Python (NumPy, Pandas), R, SQL.
ML/DL Frameworks:
Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face Transformers.
Big Data & Cloud:
Databricks, Azure ML, AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI.
Automation:
MLflow, Kubeflow, Weights & Biases for experiment tracking and deployment.
Architectural Competencies
Awareness of data pipelines, infrastructure scaling, and cloud-native AI architectures.
Alignment of ML solutions with overall data governance and security frameworks.
Soft Skills
Critical Thinking:
Identifies business value in AI/ML opportunities.
Communication:
Distils complex AI concepts into stakeholder-friendly insights.
Leadership:
Mentors junior team members and drives innovation in AI.


Additional Information

Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:



Finance:
Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
Career Development:
Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
Learning Opportunities:
Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
Work-Life Balance:
Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
Health:
Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
Community:
Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


Our diversity makes us stronger - it drives meaningful change and enables us to build innovative technology solutions. We are committed to creating an inclusive community where all of us, regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics, feels valued, respected, and free from discrimination. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all individuals and base hiring decisions on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Rillion, we're looking for a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI product team. You'll help us improve and expand the machine learning components that power our Accounts Payable (AP) automation. From idea to deployment, you'll work closely with others across the company to bring smart, ML-driven features into our product. If you enjoy solving real problems with data and want to be part of a collaborative, fast-moving team, we‚Äôd love to have you on board!




Responsibilities:

You‚Äôll play a key role in building and integrating custom Machine Learning functionalities into our SaaS products, with a focus on developing our ML platform and creating data-driven solutions tailored to our needs:

Develop and scale our machine learning platform using Databricks.
Design and implement custom ML models tailored to real-world AP automation challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify user needs and integrate ML solutions seamlessly into our SaaS platform.
Stay informed on the latest ML advancements and contribute to shaping our ML strategy and solution design.




What You'll Bring:

Proven experience delivering ML solutions in SaaS or digital product environments.
Solid experience with ML / Data frameworks such as PyTorch, PySpark or similar.
Hands-on experience in production ML pipelines, including batch and real-time inference.
Experience working with both generic and customer tailored models.
A problem-solving mindset with a collaborative, proactive approach, and a curiosity to explore new solutions while staying up to date.
M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.




Bonus skills:

Experience working with Databricks in a production environment.
Experience with software development and microservices.




What we offer:

Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company.
Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path.
Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package.
Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office.
Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views).




The recruitment process:

We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernstr√∂m at victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com




About Rillion:

We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years‚Äô experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.

By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because we‚Äôre AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don‚Äôt.

Together with our owners at Altor, we¬¥re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!

Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?




Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malm√∂, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.




Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.




Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.




Who You Are

We expect you to have:

Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.




Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.

Required skills and experiences:

  • BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Have 4+ years of professional experience working in relevant role for a Machine Learning Engineer.
  • You love coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
  • Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
  • Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
  • Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and also Vertex AI.
  • Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
  • Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
  • Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
  • Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.

Deadline to submit: 20250505

Duration: 20250512 - 20251231

We recommend you to submit the application asap because position can be filled before the deadline.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a ML Engineer to our client.

Start: 26th of May

Length: 5 months with possible extension

Location: Stockholm on-site 2-3 days per week (fully remote not possible)




The primary tasks will be to:

Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company
Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.




Required skills and experiences:

Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 4+ years‚Äô professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and Vertex AI.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.




Required cloud certification: Yes, GCP, Azure or AWS

Title: Staff Data Scientist (Analytics), New Verticals
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About The New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world‚Äôs best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You‚Äôll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we‚Äôre looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you‚Äôll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You‚Äôll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Out humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in D√ºsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel‚Äôs innovation network.

What You¬¥ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in D√ºsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field‚Äîfor example, a Bachelor‚Äôs in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel‚Äôs global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: Founding Data Scientist / Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Zoometry is an AgTech startup on a mission to accelerate innovation in animal feed through data. We are developing the first end-to-end SaaS platform that centralizes, simplifies, and analyzes data from animal nutrition and health trials. Our north star is to empower our customers to develop more effective and sustainable health solutions, faster.




About the Role

As our Founding Data Scientist / Engineer (and our very first hire! üôÇ), you will work directly with the founder on a wide range of topics to build Zoometry's foundations and execute our strategy. You will be at the heart of creating our platform and our data culture.




This will include

Building and managing Zoometry's data infrastructure (pipelines, databases, cloud)
Developing and implementing analyses and models (statistical, ML) to extract valuable insights from trial data
Organizing how we work with data (processes, technology choices, best practices)
Contributing to the product vision by bringing a data perspective
Transforming raw data into actionable value for our users via the platform
Collaborating closely with the founder on data and product strategy
And much more... (it's the startup adventure!)




Qualifications

First and foremost, you believe that technology and data can transform traditional industries like animal nutrition, and you are passionate about contributing to more effective and sustainable animal feed. This pivotal role within an early-stage startup is perfect for a Data Engineer with an entrepreneurial spirit who wants to make a major impact. You will enjoy this role if you are a fast thinker, thrive in ambiguity and rapid change, and enjoy pushing the boundaries of your comfort zone.




You will also need to

Have solid technical expertise in Data Engineering and interest in Data Science (Python/R, SQL, Cloud platforms, ETL, Stats/ML)
Possess a solution-oriented, autonomous, and proactive mindset
Have a strong interest in the animal nutrition/health or AgTech domain ‚Äì this would be a fantastic plus
Embrace a positive, growth-oriented mindset ("infinite mindset")




Logistics & Diversity

The role can be based in Stockholm or remote (with a preference for France). We strongly believe that diverse teams perform better, so we would be thrilled if you bring a unique perspective that broadens ours




How to apply

Please send your CV and a cover letter explaining your interest in Zoometry and why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this founding role to zoometry.tech@gmail.com Highlight your relevant experience in Data Engineering and Data Science, your entrepreneurial spirit, and ideally, your interest in our industry.

About the Company

Zoometry is an AgTech startup on a mission to accelerate innovation in animal feed through data. We are developing the first end-to-end SaaS platform that centralizes, simplifies, and analyzes data from animal nutrition and health trials. Our north star is to empower our customers to develop more effective and sustainable health solutions, faster.


About the Role

As our Founding Data Scientist / Engineer (and our very first hire! üôÇ), you will work directly with the founder on a wide range of topics to build Zoometry's foundations and execute our strategy. You will be at the heart of creating our platform and our data culture.


This will include

  • Building and managing Zoometry's data infrastructure (pipelines, databases, cloud)
  • Developing and implementing analyses and models (statistical, ML) to extract valuable insights from trial data
  • Organizing how we work with data (processes, technology choices, best practices)
  • Contributing to the product vision by bringing a data perspective
  • Transforming raw data into actionable value for our users via the platform
  • Collaborating closely with the founder on data and product strategy
  • And much more... (it's the startup adventure!)


Qualifications

First and foremost, you believe that technology and data can transform traditional industries like animal nutrition, and you are passionate about contributing to more effective and sustainable animal feed.   • Possess a solution-oriented, autonomous, and proactive mindset

Logistics & Diversity

Please send your CV and a cover letter explaining your interest in Zoometry and why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this founding role to zoometry.tech@gmail.com Highlight your relevant experience in Data Engineering and Data Science, your entrepreneurial spirit, and ideally, your interest in our industry.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we‚Äôre always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don‚Äôt require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

üëâüèΩ Why we formed Odevo

üîç About Odevo

üåê Our Software

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Filed

Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America‚Äôs accounting firms. This industry might seem boring‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a $70B backbone of the economy that‚Äôs breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We‚Äôre fixing it‚Äîfast.

In just 9 months, we‚Äôve hit strong product-market fit, are generating fast-growing, sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We‚Äôre not a tool‚Äîwe‚Äôre the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We‚Äôre building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say ‚ÄúI was there when it all started.‚Äù

‚∏ª

Here‚Äôs Why This Is a Terrible Job

This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.

We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we‚Äôre going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we‚Äôre going in the right direction.

If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there‚Äôs already a handful of team members blocked behind you.

We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours‚Äînot quarters.

You‚Äôll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.

There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.

You‚Äôll ask yourself, is this really the work?

It is. And it‚Äôs not for everyone.

‚∏ª

Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make

We‚Äôre hyperscaling. We‚Äôre very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.

We‚Äôre building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.

We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.

You‚Äôll be paid above market. You‚Äôll earn equity that grows fast.

And you‚Äôll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.

You‚Äôll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.

You‚Äôll talk to users weekly. You‚Äôll drive outcomes end to end.

We‚Äôll tell you the goal. How you reach it‚Äîprompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data‚Äîis up to you.

We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.

That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.

‚∏ª

The Teammate We're Looking For


Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
No research-for-research‚Äôs-sake ‚Äî we ship fast and learn even faster
Big bonus if you‚Äôve shipped AI products into production, not just demos


‚∏ª

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For


Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head


‚∏ª

Your Hard Skillset


Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood‚Äîbeyond the hype
Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
Bonus if you‚Äôve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals


‚∏ª

Your Soft Skillset


Ruthlessly pragmatic‚Äîknows when to ship and when to iterate
Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
Obsessively curious‚Äîyou want to understand everything about the domain you‚Äôre automating
You own your outcomes‚Äîand love having your work in front of real users daily


‚∏ª

Growth And Levels

We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.

We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.

This isn‚Äôt a comfy AI role. It‚Äôs fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.

You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

‚∏ª

The process


Quick intro call
Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
Final round with our team
Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
Then we decide together if this is the right fight


‚∏ª

If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos‚Äîthis is it.

Compensation Range: $71.5K - $104K
Show more
HTML:
About Filed

Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America‚Äôs accounting firms. This industry might seem boring‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a $70B backbone of the economy that‚Äôs breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We‚Äôre fixing it‚Äîfast.

In just 9 months, we‚Äôve hit strong product-market fit, are generating fast-growing, sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We‚Äôre not a tool‚Äîwe‚Äôre the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We‚Äôre building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say ‚ÄúI was there when it all started.‚Äù

‚∏ª

Here‚Äôs Why This Is a Terrible Job

This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.

We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we‚Äôre going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we‚Äôre going in the right direction.

If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there‚Äôs already a handful of team members blocked behind you.

We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours‚Äînot quarters.

You‚Äôll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.

There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.

You‚Äôll ask yourself, is this really the work?

It is. And it‚Äôs not for everyone.

‚∏ª

Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make

We‚Äôre hyperscaling. We‚Äôre very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.

We‚Äôre building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.

We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.

You‚Äôll be paid above market. You‚Äôll earn equity that grows fast.

And you‚Äôll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.

You‚Äôll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.

You‚Äôll talk to users weekly. You‚Äôll drive outcomes end to end.

We‚Äôll tell you the goal. How you reach it‚Äîprompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data‚Äîis up to you.

We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.

That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.

‚∏ª

The Teammate We're Looking For

  • Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
  • Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
  • Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
  • No research-for-research‚Äôs-sake ‚Äî we ship fast and learn even faster
  • Big bonus if you‚Äôve shipped AI products into production, not just demos

‚∏ª

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For

  • Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
  • Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
  • Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
  • Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head

‚∏ª

Your Hard Skillset

  • Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood‚Äîbeyond the hype
  • Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
  • Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
  • Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
  • Bonus if you‚Äôve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals

‚∏ª

Your Soft Skillset

  • Ruthlessly pragmatic‚Äîknows when to ship and when to iterate
  • Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
  • Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
  • Obsessively curious‚Äîyou want to understand everything about the domain you‚Äôre automating
  • You own your outcomes‚Äîand love having your work in front of real users daily

‚∏ª

Growth And Levels

We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.

We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.

This isn‚Äôt a comfy AI role. It‚Äôs fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.

You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

‚∏ª

The process

  • Quick intro call
  • Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
  • Final round with our team
  • Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
  • Then we decide together if this is the right fight

‚∏ª

If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos‚Äîthis is it.

Compensation Range: $71.5K - $104K

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description


We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description


Day-to-day life

Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models ‚Äì crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications


We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).



Excellent communication is essential ‚Äì you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.

Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information


Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." ‚Äî Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don‚Äôt lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

¬†

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don‚Äôt worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

¬†

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Consumer, Ads
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Ads Analytics At Wolt

As the name Ads Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organisation, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education.

About The Ads Domain

The AdTech team is a team that owns the end-to-end experience of advertising at Wolt. They build tools for merchants and brands that can offer visibility and increased performance. Their long-term goal is to create a unified Wolt + DoorDash advertising platform that will benefit both global and local clients.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Marketing or AdTech, we're looking for someone like you.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Stockholm and Tallinn, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience with the Ads domain - as a huge plus.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Us

At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, P√©rez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role

Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We‚Äôre seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you‚Äôll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.

What You Will Be Doing


Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Legora
Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


Who you are


A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applicationsA strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
You‚Äôre autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
You‚Äôre a low ego, true team player
You‚Äôre a problem solver who‚Äôs not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


What's in it for you


Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.

We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

HTML:
About Us

At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, P√©rez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role

Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We‚Äôre seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you‚Äôll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Legora
  • Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
  • Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
  • Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges

Who you are

  • A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applicationsA strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
  • You‚Äôre autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
  • You‚Äôre a low ego, true team player
  • You‚Äôre a problem solver who‚Äôs not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI

What's in it for you

  • A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.

We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (Analytics), Merchant
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Merchant Group At Wolt

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: customers, couriers, and merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant‚Äôs daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

About The Merchant Analytics Team

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations that drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects that can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt‚Äôs marketplace strategy.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
4-5+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation and causal inference using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partners - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com) and Jaksa Marojevic (jaksa.marojevic@external.wolt.com)

Please note that we might have delays due to the festive season.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph Developer)
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph Developer)

Location: Stockholm or Malm√∂, Sweden

Contract Duration: 6+ months (extendable)

Experience Level: 8‚Äì10 years







We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist with Knowledge Graph Developer for a 6+ month contract to join a cutting-edge data engineering project in Sweden. This role is based in Stockholm or Malm√∂ and involves the design, development, and optimization of scalable knowledge graph solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement data models for knowledge graphs, including defining entities, relationships, and properties
Ingest and transform data using ETL pipelines tailored for knowledge graph integration
Manage and query graph databases such as Amazon Neptune or Neo4j
Write and optimize complex graph queries for data retrieval and analytics
Visualize graph data for reporting and insight generation
Apply graph neural networks (GNNs) and other machine learning algorithms where applicable
Tune graph performance for scalability and efficiency
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to translate requirements into robust solutions




Essential Skills:

Strong understanding of ontology principles (e.g., OWL, RDF)
Proficiency in Scala and Python for Data Science
Experience with graph databases (e.g., Neo4j, Amazon Neptune)
Data modeling and graph query languages (e.g., Cypher, Gremlin)
Expertise in building and managing ETL pipelines
Solid grasp of software engineering best practices




Desirable Skills:

Knowledge of Java in addition to Python/Scala
Familiarity with popular ETL tools and data transformation frameworks
Understanding of software development lifecycles and CI/CD
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams




Contract Details:

Type: Contract
Duration: Initial 6 months with potential extension
Location: Stockholm or Malm√∂ (hybrid/onsite, based on client requirement)
Country: Sweden




Apply now if you are interested in this role.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify‚Äôs Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify‚Äôs foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify‚Äôs platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify‚Äôs platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify‚Äôs platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify‚Äôs platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company‚Äôs long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what‚Äôs playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It‚Äôs in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we‚Äôre here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world‚Äôs most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Clinical Research Scientist - Biomarkers and Translational Medicine
Description:
Are you an analytical, forward-thinking, and goal-oriented person with experience in biomarker research related to immunology, chronic inflammation, or age-related diseases? Are you a medical doctor with clinical experience or a PhD or postdoc interested in working with cutting-edge cell therapies and contributing to groundbreaking research ‚Äì then take the opportunity to apply for the role as Clinical Research Scientist at Cellcolabs.

About Cellcolabs

Cellcolabs is an impact start-up specializing in the industrial GMP production of high-quality Mesenchymal Stromal Cells (MSCs). Our mission is to prevent and treat diseases by making high quality stem cells available and affordable. We do that by industrial scale production and collaborations. Based at Campus Solna, Cellcolabs builds on over 20 years of stem cell research and clinical expertise from Karolinska Institutet.

We are expanding through a series of clinical trials across different locations globally and need to expand our team with one more highly motivated and ambitious Clinical Research Scientist to interpret and communicate trial participants‚Äô results and generate research findings on the ICH-GCP compliant clinical data in these trials.

The role

As a member of our Clinical Success team, you will be responsible for analysing how MSCs influence biomarkers related to inflammation, immune regulation, and cellular aging, as well as developing strategies to optimize our therapies in collaboration with the RnD team. If you are a medical doctor and/or a driven scientist with a passion for translational research, we want you on our team!

Key Responsibilities:


Interpret large datasets generated within our clinical trials from initiation to close-out, focusing on long-term follow-up data in line with study protocols and quality standards.
Generate research findings from exploratory laboratory test results on +60 biomarkers, study questionnaires and qualitative data from follow-up visits between participants and investigators.
Analyse and draw conclusions on individual laboratory results on biomarkers related to inflammation, immunoprofiling and age-related diseases to be communicated externally in meetings with patients within our patient-funded trials.
Compile and present research findings internally and externally (conferences, scientific publications, regulatory reports).
Review validation reports and select clinical and laboratory partners in line with necessary quality standards, as well as build and maintain effective relationships with external laboratory partners within the clinical trials.
Collaborate interdisciplinary internally with teams in preclinical research, clinical development, and business strategy to advance our MSC-based therapies and product development initiatives.
Build the foundation and structure for the clinical biomarker data analytics as the company grows (we are a startup where we build ground as we go).


Qualifications And Requirements

We want you to grow together with us and we will do our best for you to develop and enjoy work. For this role you will need the following:


Clinical experience as medical doctor and/or PhD or postdoc experience in cell biology, immunology, molecular biology, biomedicine, precision medicine or a related field in inflammation and/or biomarker research.
Experience of quantifying biomarkers such as inflammatory cytokines, lymphocytes, telomere length, DNA methylation, clinical chemistry markers and other MSC relevant parameters using advanced techniques (Luminex, qPCR, flow cytometry, NGS etc).
Strong communication skills and excellent skills in written and spoken Swedish and English ‚Äì partly to be used in conversations with trials participants.
Basic knowledge of statistics and coding.
Bonus: Experience in bioinformatics and AI-driven analyses.
You are self-motivated, analytical, and innovative ‚Äì you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you take ownership and make an impact without compromising on quality and scientific integrity.
You have a flexible mindset and capability to operate in a company where multiple logics meet - ranging from GMP production of MSCs, B2B sales to clinical partners, development and operations within clinical trials and B2C marketing and diagnostics streams in our trials.


What We Offer

The role will involve collaboration and teamwork as well as independent work. The role may involve international travel, with our offices in Solna, Sweden as the base.

What is it like to work at Cellcolabs?

At Cellcolabs, we are committed to your growth and professional development. We offer a supportive and dynamic work environment, good employment conditions, and the opportunity to be part of a team that is making a real difference in the field of stem cell medicine.

We are committed to the growth of our cells, our company and ourselves, and are passionate about making a real difference in people¬¥s lives and to promote a better health globally. We win as one, embracing collaboration as an integral part of our culture. We believe that nothing is impossible, finding new and creative solutions. We celebrate victories and create a workplace where everyone feels valued and motivated. Our decisions are guided by scientific integrity, transparency, and high ethical standards.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • You have a flexible mindset and capability to operate in a company where multiple logics meet - ranging from GMP production of MSCs, B2B sales to clinical partners, development and operations within clinical trials and B2C marketing and diagnostics streams in our trials.

What We Offer

The role will involve collaboration and teamwork as well as independent work. The role may involve international travel, with our offices in Solna, Sweden as the base.

What is it like to work at Cellcolabs?

At Cellcolabs, we are committed to your growth and professional development. We offer a supportive and dynamic work environment, good employment conditions, and the opportunity to be part of a team that is making a real difference in the field of stem cell medicine.

We are committed to the growth of our cells, our company and ourselves, and are passionate about making a real difference in people¬¥s lives and to promote a better health globally. We win as one, embracing collaboration as an integral part of our culture. We believe that nothing is impossible, finding new and creative solutions. We celebrate victories and create a workplace where everyone feels valued and motivated. Our decisions are guided by scientific integrity, transparency, and high ethical standards.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Senior Backend Developer (Python) - Fin-Tech - Central Stockholm Office - 60,000 SEK - 70,000 SEK




A Fin-Tech that has successfully grown and grown for 15 years is looking to add 2 more Senior Python Developers to their team as they plan to expand further internationally.




Based in Central Stockholm, the company very much works in a hybrid fashion and wants their tech team to work in an autonomous way in order to keep updating their engine and handle their work load around payments.




There are over 100 people in the business with the cross-functionality between teams being key to the team maintaining their growth and enabling their developers to do what they do best.




It is great to see a business who have the determination and vision to be a leader in Europe and to excel here, you must be someone who loves problem solving and working with others to do so!




Tech:

Python / Django / AWS + Drive to Learn New Skills




Ways of Working:

Hybrid: 2 Days a week ideally in the office or can be less if that works for you + 32 Days Holiday




Must have RTW in Sweden - English Speaking Position




If you would like to know more - click apply or email josh@randallrecruitment.com

Title: AI Engineer (Computer Vision)
Description:
AI Engineer ‚Äì Visual/Generative AI




üìç Stockholm




We‚Äôre on the hunt for an ambitious AI Engineer with a focus on visual and generative AI to join our fast-growing Stockholm-based startup. We‚Äôre building a groundbreaking creative product with AI at its core‚Äîand we‚Äôre just getting started.




If you thrive on turning cutting-edge research into production-ready magic and have hands-on experience deploying LLMs in production, you‚Äôll feel right at home here.




üöÄ What You‚Äôll Do




Push the boundaries of visual generative AI through R&D and rapid experimentation.
Prototype, fine-tune, and deploy state-of-the-art models (diffusion, transformers, etc.).
Build robust infrastructure for training, data pipelines, monitoring, and performance optimization.
Work closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to shape an AI-native product experience.
Join a small but mighty team where your work has real impact‚Äîfrom day one.




‚úÖ You Should Have




3+ years of hands-on experience in ML/AI, with a focus on computer vision or generative models.
Proven experience deploying LLMs in production (this is a must-have).
Strong proficiency in Python and deep understanding of ML concepts and math.
Experience turning research into scalable, reliable production systems.




üåü Nice to Have




A passion for creative AI applications and pushing artistic boundaries.
Familiarity with advanced diffusion pipelines and GPU-based deployments.
Contributions to research papers or open-source projects.




üí° In Your First 6 Months




Rebuild and retrain production models with improved performance and creativity.
Deliver novel model approaches to solve real customer needs.
Optimize infrastructure for scale and cost-efficiency.
Help accelerate R&D and fuel continuous innovation.




üéÅ What We Offer




Competitive salary + equity program backed by top-tier investors (Creandum, EQT Ventures).
6 weeks of paid vacation, wellness stipend, learning budget, and no qualifying days off.
Office in central Stockholm, with flexible work arrangements.
A place where AI has a seat at the table‚Äînot a side project.
A chance to co-create the culture and shape the future of an early-stage AI company.




üé® We believe AI and creativity belong together.




If you do too‚Äîand you know how to build great products with large models in production‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to meet you.
