Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Senior Applied AI Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Senior Applied AI Engineer, you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.

Role

Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:


Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


What You Need To Embark

To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:


Strong software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
Proven experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
Curiosity and pragmatism ‚Äì you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
Strong collaboration skills ‚Äì comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You‚Äôll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe‚Äôs #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get ‚Äúskin in the game‚Äù through our employee options program
Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing ‚Äúsafe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone‚Äù
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

  • Join Europe‚Äôs #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
  • Get ‚Äúskin in the game‚Äù through our employee options program
  • Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing ‚Äúsafe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone‚Äù
  • Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Frostbite is EA‚Äôs proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools and technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline. Learn More: ea.com/frostbite

At Frostbite, we believe that data drives quality, accountability, and innovation in game engine development. We are growing our Frostbite Analytics team in service of this mission, and we want you to join us!

As a Data Scientist on the Frostbite Analytics team, you will report to the Senior Analytics Manager and work side-by-side with the Continuous Development team. Your projects will focus on enhancing developer workflows, increasing build farm efficiency, and improving automated failure triage, allowing engineers to work faster and with greater confidence in their code submissions.

We offer a hybrid working model with three days per week in office.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data-driven solutions to improve build-farm operations, CI/CD workflows, and automated test failure analysis.
Analyze telemetry, test results, and other data to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and optimization opportunities.
Integrate actionable analytics into developer tools through dashboards, REST APIs, and automated processes.
Work with data engineers to improve data processing and storage for efficiency, latency, and cost-effectiveness.
Communicate insights and recommendations to leadership and internal partners in business-friendly language


Requirements


2+ years of experience in data science or ML ops, or related analytics roles
Master's in Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience in a related field


Technical Skills


Proficiency in SQL and Python (Scala, C++, or C# is a plus), with experience in real-time analytics and data transformation workflows.
Familiarity with a range of quantitative methods for detecting failures, predicting outcomes, and optimizing processes, such as anomaly/time-series analysis, classification models, and reinforcement learning.
Experience working with telemetry data in software development or similar context
Experience with version control systems like Perforce or Gitlab.
Experience with ML and analytics platforms such as Databricks or SageMaker for developing and deploying models at scale.
Knowledge of CI/CD systems, automated build environments, and developer-facing analytics tools is a plus.


Soft Skills


Curious and analytical: You uncover patterns in data, ask the right questions, and explore new methods to foster continuous improvements that connect to the bigger picture.
Collaborative: You proactively seek out feedback and diverse perspectives, ensuring solutions are well-designed, scalable, and sustainable. You actively listen, adapt, and refine your approach for long-term impact.
Impact-focused: You prioritize high-value solutions that lead to measurable improvements, balancing technical rigor with real-world constraints to enhance efficiency and automation.


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.

We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is ideal for engineers with demonstrable skills in AI as well as for software engineers who have recently transitioned to AI and ML expertise, and offers an opportunity to develop your craft whilst working closely with clients on delivering AI solutions to real-world challenges.

Job Summary

We are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong intuition for AI and a genuine enthusiasm in building robust, scalable solutions to power innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a deep enthusiasm for advancing AI capabilities.

What We Offer


A chance to work closely with global brands on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and truly push the boundaries of what's possible.
A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


As an AI Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:


Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product‚Äôs UX
Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands


It‚Äôs a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:


PyTorch, Tensorflow
Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF


Who You Are

We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate


Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


Why Umain?

Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.

Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn‚Äôt pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.

Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.

Skills Over Degrees: We‚Äôre more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?

If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Let‚Äôs build something awesome together.

Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.

We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.
Show more

  • Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
  • You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product‚Äôs UX
  • Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
  • Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
  • Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
  • Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
  • Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands

It‚Äôs a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:

  • PyTorch, Tensorflow
  • Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
  • Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF

Who You Are

We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate

  • Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
  • Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
  • Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
  • You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
  • You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
  • You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
  • You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.

Why Umain?

Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.

Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn‚Äôt pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.

Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.

Skills Over Degrees: We‚Äôre more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?

If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Let‚Äôs build something awesome together.

Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.

We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (Analytics), New Verticals
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About The New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world‚Äôs best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You‚Äôll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we‚Äôre looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you‚Äôll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You‚Äôll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Out humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in D√ºsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel‚Äôs innovation network.

What You¬¥ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in D√ºsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field‚Äîfor example, a Bachelor‚Äôs in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel‚Äôs global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we‚Äôre always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don‚Äôt require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

üëâüèΩ Why we formed Odevo

üîç About Odevo

üåê Our Software

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Filed

Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America‚Äôs accounting firms. This industry might seem boring‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a $70B backbone of the economy that‚Äôs breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We‚Äôre fixing it‚Äîfast.

In just 9 months, we‚Äôve hit strong product-market fit, are generating fast-growing, sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We‚Äôre not a tool‚Äîwe‚Äôre the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We‚Äôre building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say ‚ÄúI was there when it all started.‚Äù

‚∏ª

Here‚Äôs Why This Is a Terrible Job

This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.

We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we‚Äôre going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we‚Äôre going in the right direction.

If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there‚Äôs already a handful of team members blocked behind you.

We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours‚Äînot quarters.

You‚Äôll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.

There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.

You‚Äôll ask yourself, is this really the work?

It is. And it‚Äôs not for everyone.

‚∏ª

Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make

We‚Äôre hyperscaling. We‚Äôre very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.

We‚Äôre building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.

We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.

You‚Äôll be paid above market. You‚Äôll earn equity that grows fast.

And you‚Äôll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.

You‚Äôll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.

You‚Äôll talk to users weekly. You‚Äôll drive outcomes end to end.

We‚Äôll tell you the goal. How you reach it‚Äîprompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data‚Äîis up to you.

We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.

That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.

‚∏ª

The Teammate We're Looking For


Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
No research-for-research‚Äôs-sake ‚Äî we ship fast and learn even faster
Big bonus if you‚Äôve shipped AI products into production, not just demos


‚∏ª

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For


Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head


‚∏ª

Your Hard Skillset


Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood‚Äîbeyond the hype
Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
Bonus if you‚Äôve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals


‚∏ª

Your Soft Skillset


Ruthlessly pragmatic‚Äîknows when to ship and when to iterate
Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
Obsessively curious‚Äîyou want to understand everything about the domain you‚Äôre automating
You own your outcomes‚Äîand love having your work in front of real users daily


‚∏ª

Growth And Levels

We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.

We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.

This isn‚Äôt a comfy AI role. It‚Äôs fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.

You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

‚∏ª

The process


Quick intro call
Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
Final round with our team
Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
Then we decide together if this is the right fight


‚∏ª

If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos‚Äîthis is it.

Compensation Range: $71.5K - $104K
Show more
HTML:
About Filed

Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America‚Äôs accounting firms. This industry might seem boring‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a $70B backbone of the economy that‚Äôs breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We‚Äôre fixing it‚Äîfast.

In just 9 months, we‚Äôve hit strong product-market fit, are generating fast-growing, sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We‚Äôre not a tool‚Äîwe‚Äôre the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We‚Äôre building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say ‚ÄúI was there when it all started.‚Äù

‚∏ª

Here‚Äôs Why This Is a Terrible Job

This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.

We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we‚Äôre going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we‚Äôre going in the right direction.

If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there‚Äôs already a handful of team members blocked behind you.

We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours‚Äînot quarters.

You‚Äôll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.

There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.

You‚Äôll ask yourself, is this really the work?

It is. And it‚Äôs not for everyone.

‚∏ª

Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make

We‚Äôre hyperscaling. We‚Äôre very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.

We‚Äôre building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.

We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.

You‚Äôll be paid above market. You‚Äôll earn equity that grows fast.

And you‚Äôll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.

You‚Äôll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.

You‚Äôll talk to users weekly. You‚Äôll drive outcomes end to end.

We‚Äôll tell you the goal. How you reach it‚Äîprompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data‚Äîis up to you.

We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.

That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.

‚∏ª

The Teammate We're Looking For

  • Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
  • Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
  • Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
  • No research-for-research‚Äôs-sake ‚Äî we ship fast and learn even faster
  • Big bonus if you‚Äôve shipped AI products into production, not just demos

‚∏ª

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For

  • Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
  • Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
  • Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
  • Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head

‚∏ª

Your Hard Skillset

  • Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood‚Äîbeyond the hype
  • Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
  • Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
  • Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
  • Bonus if you‚Äôve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals

‚∏ª

Your Soft Skillset

  • Ruthlessly pragmatic‚Äîknows when to ship and when to iterate
  • Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
  • Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
  • Obsessively curious‚Äîyou want to understand everything about the domain you‚Äôre automating
  • You own your outcomes‚Äîand love having your work in front of real users daily

‚∏ª

Growth And Levels

We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.

We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.

This isn‚Äôt a comfy AI role. It‚Äôs fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.

You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

  • Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
  • Final round with our team
  • Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
  • Then we decide together if this is the right fight

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
SmartCella Solutions is seeking a highly motivated Research Scientist to join our R&D team. The Research Scientist provides scientific expertise, oversees the planning and execution of projects related to cell culture and molecular lab work, and is accountable for delivering these in a timely manner. As a part of our dynamic team, this role would collaborate closely with other scientists to develop, optimize, validate and execute biochemical and/or cellular assays to support R&D projects. This position requires some weekend work.

Areas of responsibilities will include:


Lead the design, development, and execution of immunological assays, including: ELISApot, ELISA, FACs, detection of antigen-specific cells, functional assays, single-cell profiling techniques to characterize immune cell populations, identify exploratory biomarkers, and other relevant techniques.
Develop, optimize, validate and troubleshoot immunological assays and implement new techniques to assess mechanisms of action in a timely manner.
Evaluate, analyze, review raw data, and present results to scientific groups (internally & externally)
Keep abreast of scientific and other relevant literatures.
Work collaboratively in a team environment and independently to deliver against fast timelines.
Maintain a high standard of experimentation and documentations.


Qualifications needed for the role:

Required:


PhD in Molecular Biology, Immunology, Immuno-oncology, or relevant field.
Proven experience in cell culturing, passaging, freeze/thaw, general maintenance of human ES or IPSC or other stem cells.
Hand-on experience in development and implementation of immunological assays, such as: ELISpot, ELISA, FACs, detection of antigen specific cells, cytokine assays, B cell and T cell based assays, serological assays.
Experience in conceptualizing and leading innovative assay development and data analysis.
Demonstrated ability to effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Experience in working within a fast-paced team environment with a high degree of self-motivation, flexibility, collaboration and organization.
Meticulous laboratory approach, careful adherence to protocols and excellent lab notebook documentation.
Excellent verbal and writing skills for documentation of data, drafting of reports, and communication of progress within team and to manager.


Desired:


Prior experience in DNA/RNA biology is highly desirable.
Experience in cell and gene therapy
Experience with animal disease modelling
Experience with immune repertoire analyses.
Other related skills such as cell transfection/electroporation/nucleofection and basic molecular biology skills would be highly valued.
Strong publication record in an academic background in immunology, immune-oncology or cancer biology
Working knowledge in RNA therapeutic field
Fluent in English (writing and speaking), while fluency in Swedish is appreciated.


Interested? Submit your application today! We will review applications on an ongoing basis.

SmartCella is a world-leading biotech company pioneering the future of targeted therapies by combining first-in-class delivery platforms with cutting-edge cell and gene therapies. The SmartCella group consist of SmartCella Holding AB, ProCella Therapeutics AB, SmartWise AB and SmartCella Solutions AB with a total of 82 employees from more than 20 nationalities.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We‚Äôre looking for a talented‚ÄØData Scientist‚ÄØto join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You‚Äôll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You‚Äôre passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you‚Äôll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You‚Äôre always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you‚Äôll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence.‚ÄØOur vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings.‚ÄØ

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify‚Äôs Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify‚Äôs foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify‚Äôs platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify‚Äôs platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify‚Äôs platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify‚Äôs platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company‚Äôs long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what‚Äôs playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It‚Äôs in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we‚Äôre here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world‚Äôs most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Clinical Research Scientist - Biomarkers and Translational Medicine
Description:
Are you an analytical, forward-thinking, and goal-oriented person with experience in biomarker research related to immunology, chronic inflammation, or age-related diseases? Are you a medical doctor with clinical experience or a PhD or postdoc interested in working with cutting-edge cell therapies and contributing to groundbreaking research ‚Äì then take the opportunity to apply for the role as Clinical Research Scientist at Cellcolabs.

About Cellcolabs

Cellcolabs is an impact start-up specializing in the industrial GMP production of high-quality Mesenchymal Stromal Cells (MSCs). Our mission is to prevent and treat diseases by making high quality stem cells available and affordable. We do that by industrial scale production and collaborations. Based at Campus Solna, Cellcolabs builds on over 20 years of stem cell research and clinical expertise from Karolinska Institutet.

We are expanding through a series of clinical trials across different locations globally and need to expand our team with one more highly motivated and ambitious Clinical Research Scientist to interpret and communicate trial participants‚Äô results and generate research findings on the ICH-GCP compliant clinical data in these trials.

The role

As a member of our Clinical Success team, you will be responsible for analysing how MSCs influence biomarkers related to inflammation, immune regulation, and cellular aging, as well as developing strategies to optimize our therapies in collaboration with the RnD team. If you are a medical doctor and/or a driven scientist with a passion for translational research, we want you on our team!

Key Responsibilities:


Interpret large datasets generated within our clinical trials from initiation to close-out, focusing on long-term follow-up data in line with study protocols and quality standards.
Generate research findings from exploratory laboratory test results on +60 biomarkers, study questionnaires and qualitative data from follow-up visits between participants and investigators.
Analyse and draw conclusions on individual laboratory results on biomarkers related to inflammation, immunoprofiling and age-related diseases to be communicated externally in meetings with patients within our patient-funded trials.
Compile and present research findings internally and externally (conferences, scientific publications, regulatory reports).
Review validation reports and select clinical and laboratory partners in line with necessary quality standards, as well as build and maintain effective relationships with external laboratory partners within the clinical trials.
Collaborate interdisciplinary internally with teams in preclinical research, clinical development, and business strategy to advance our MSC-based therapies and product development initiatives.
Build the foundation and structure for the clinical biomarker data analytics as the company grows (we are a startup where we build ground as we go).


Qualifications And Requirements

We want you to grow together with us and we will do our best for you to develop and enjoy work. For this role you will need the following:


Clinical experience as medical doctor and/or PhD or postdoc experience in cell biology, immunology, molecular biology, biomedicine, precision medicine or a related field in inflammation and/or biomarker research.
Experience of quantifying biomarkers such as inflammatory cytokines, lymphocytes, telomere length, DNA methylation, clinical chemistry markers and other MSC relevant parameters using advanced techniques (Luminex, qPCR, flow cytometry, NGS etc).
Strong communication skills and excellent skills in written and spoken Swedish and English ‚Äì partly to be used in conversations with trials participants.
Basic knowledge of statistics and coding.
Bonus: Experience in bioinformatics and AI-driven analyses.
You are self-motivated, analytical, and innovative ‚Äì you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you take ownership and make an impact without compromising on quality and scientific integrity.
You have a flexible mindset and capability to operate in a company where multiple logics meet - ranging from GMP production of MSCs, B2B sales to clinical partners, development and operations within clinical trials and B2C marketing and diagnostics streams in our trials.


What We Offer

The role will involve collaboration and teamwork as well as independent work. The role may involve international travel, with our offices in Solna, Sweden as the base.

What is it like to work at Cellcolabs?

At Cellcolabs, we are committed to your growth and professional development. We offer a supportive and dynamic work environment, good employment conditions, and the opportunity to be part of a team that is making a real difference in the field of stem cell medicine.

We are committed to the growth of our cells, our company and ourselves, and are passionate about making a real difference in people¬¥s lives and to promote a better health globally. We win as one, embracing collaboration as an integral part of our culture. We believe that nothing is impossible, finding new and creative solutions. We celebrate victories and create a workplace where everyone feels valued and motivated. Our decisions are guided by scientific integrity, transparency, and high ethical standards.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more
HTML:
Are you an analytical, forward-thinking, and goal-oriented person with experience in biomarker research related to immunology, chronic inflammation, or age-related diseases? Are you a medical doctor with clinical experience or a PhD or postdoc interested in working with cutting-edge cell therapies and contributing to groundbreaking research ‚Äì then take the opportunity to apply for the role as Clinical Research Scientist at Cellcolabs.

About Cellcolabs

Cellcolabs is an impact start-up specializing in the industrial GMP production of high-quality Mesenchymal Stromal Cells (MSCs). Our mission is to prevent and treat diseases by making high quality stem cells available and affordable. We do that by industrial scale production and collaborations. Based at Campus Solna, Cellcolabs builds on over 20 years of stem cell research and clinical expertise from Karolinska Institutet.

We are expanding through a series of clinical trials across different locations globally and need to expand our team with one more highly motivated and ambitious Clinical Research Scientist to interpret and communicate trial participants‚Äô results and generate research findings on the ICH-GCP compliant clinical data in these trials.

The role

As a member of our Clinical Success team, you will be responsible for analysing how MSCs influence biomarkers related to inflammation, immune regulation, and cellular aging, as well as developing strategies to optimize our therapies in collaboration with the RnD team. If you are a medical doctor and/or a driven scientist with a passion for translational research, we want you on our team!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Interpret large datasets generated within our clinical trials from initiation to close-out, focusing on long-term follow-up data in line with study protocols and quality standards.
  • Generate research findings from exploratory laboratory test results on +60 biomarkers, study questionnaires and qualitative data from follow-up visits between participants and investigators.
  • Analyse and draw conclusions on individual laboratory results on biomarkers related to inflammation, immunoprofiling and age-related diseases to be communicated externally in meetings with patients within our patient-funded trials.
  • Compile and present research findings internally and externally (conferences, scientific publications, regulatory reports).
  • Review validation reports and select clinical and laboratory partners in line with necessary quality standards, as well as build and maintain effective relationships with external laboratory partners within the clinical trials.
  • Collaborate interdisciplinary internally with teams in preclinical research, clinical development, and business strategy to advance our MSC-based therapies and product development initiatives.
  • Build the foundation and structure for the clinical biomarker data analytics as the company grows (we are a startup where we build ground as we go).

Qualifications And Requirements

We want you to grow together with us and we will do our best for you to develop and enjoy work. For this role you will need the following:

  • Clinical experience as medical doctor and/or PhD or postdoc experience in cell biology, immunology, molecular biology, biomedicine, precision medicine or a related field in inflammation and/or biomarker research.
  • Experience of quantifying biomarkers such as inflammatory cytokines, lymphocytes, telomere length, DNA methylation, clinical chemistry markers and other MSC relevant parameters using advanced techniques (Luminex, qPCR, flow cytometry, NGS etc).
  • Strong communication skills and excellent skills in written and spoken Swedish and English ‚Äì partly to be used in conversations with trials participants.
  • Basic knowledge of statistics and coding.
  • Bonus: Experience in bioinformatics and AI-driven analyses.
  • You are self-motivated, analytical, and innovative ‚Äì you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you take ownership and make an impact without compromising on quality and scientific integrity.
  • You have a flexible mindset and capability to operate in a company where multiple logics meet - ranging from GMP production of MSCs, B2B sales to clinical partners, development and operations within clinical trials and B2C marketing and diagnostics streams in our trials.

What We Offer

The role will involve collaboration and teamwork as well as independent work. The role may involve international travel, with our offices in Solna, Sweden as the base.

What is it like to work at Cellcolabs?

At Cellcolabs, we are committed to your growth and professional development. We offer a supportive and dynamic work environment, good employment conditions, and the opportunity to be part of a team that is making a real difference in the field of stem cell medicine.

We are committed to the growth of our cells, our company and ourselves, and are passionate about making a real difference in people¬¥s lives and to promote a better health globally. We win as one, embracing collaboration as an integral part of our culture. We believe that nothing is impossible, finding new and creative solutions. We celebrate victories and create a workplace where everyone feels valued and motivated. Our decisions are guided by scientific integrity, transparency, and high ethical standards.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Stockholm
Description:
Position: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Are you a skilled Senior Machine Learning Engineer? Are you excited about bridging AI and real-world applications to solve meaningful problems? Join Apotea‚Äôs Data and AI team and help us transform e-commerce and digital healthcare through innovative AI and ML solutions!




AI + Apotea = < heart / >

Apotea is Sweden‚Äôs leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. we are seeking passionate and driven individuals who are eager to make a significant impact and be part of a small technical team. By following industry best practices, we develop end to end AI applications on top of modern data and AI architectures, making sure our AI products don't end up just being a POC and drive sustainable value in production. The AI organization sits right under CEO P√§r Sv√§rdson, ensuring that your work has high visibility and significant influence.




Your role as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Apotea:

Build, deploy, and own end-to-end ML systems ‚Äì from prototyping to maintaining production models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with team strategy.
Turn models into real-world solutions ‚Äì integrate ML into products that deliver measurable business value.
Apply MLOps and DevOps best practices ‚Äì use CI/CD, IaC, and cloud native solutions to deploy and monitor models.
Collaborate across teams ‚Äì work with Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Tech Lead, and Product Owner to align on data, integrations, architecture, and goals.
Define metrics and evaluation processes - establish performance metrics, evaluation and validation frameworks aligned with business logic and requirements
Take proactive initiatives - continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality
Mentor junior engineers - provide technical guidance, code reviews, and care for the junior engineers in the team.




Who you are?

We‚Äôre seeking Senior Machine Learning Engineers with diverse skills and a passion for solving complex problems and business impact.




You‚Äôre a SENIOR member who:

Mentors teams and elevates technical excellence
Takes ownership of complex systems end-to-end
Anticipates risks before they become problems
Measures success by real-world impact, not just accuracy
Balances innovation with practical constraints




You‚Äôre an ML EXPERT who:

Ships models to production, not just notebooks
Speaks the language of both algorithms and business KPIs
Stays ahead of the curve on AI/ML breakthroughs
Is proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.




You‚Äôre an ENGINEER who:

Writes code that outlasts the current project
Thinks in systems, not just scripts
Tests obsessively (A/B testing solutions, End-to-End testing softwares) and documents proactively
Knows cloud infra like the back of your hand (AWS preferred)




Bonus points for experience with:

Implementing CI/CD pipelines, MLOps practices, and infrastructure-as-code for robust and repeatable deployments
Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines
Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg
Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)




What Apotea Offer You

The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
Own projects from concept to deployment
A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.




About Apotea

Apotea.se is Sweden‚Äôs largest online pharmacy, with the country‚Äôs broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden‚Äôs most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Liding√∂, and Morgong√•va.

Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.




Recruitment Process

Apply
Interview: Screening
Interview: Technical Capabilities
Interview: Culture Fit
Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
Offer Presented




Location: Sveav√§gen 168, Stockholm, Sweden

Reports to: Chief AI Officer




Application

Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.




LinkedIn

Instagram




Join Us and Make a Difference - We hope you want to be a part of our team!

Submit your application today‚Äîinterviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.




Welcome to Apotea ‚Äì where technology meets health and creates magic!
