HTML:
Job Description

The Developer Experience tribe offers an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the productivity and satisfaction of Danske Bank‚Äôs developers as we set out to massively improve the developer journey.

We are excited to announce the new position of a DevOps Engineer in the Developer Journey Automation squad within the Developer Experience (DX) Tribe.

As a member of our motivated team, you'll collaborate with experienced individuals who are enthusiastic about creating great experiences for developers. You'll have the chance to shape the products, resources, and processes that empower developers to thrive, innovate, and deliver high-quality software solutions.

Joining us means being part of a diverse and forward-thinking team where you can contribute your expertise, learn from others, and play a crucial role in shaping the future of software development within the organization.

You will;

  • Be an integral part of building Danske Bank‚Äôs new Developer portal, serving as the entry into the paved / golden path of Danske Banks developer journey
  • Integrate the portal with a number of internal and external systems that will help create a first-class product for Danske Banks developers
  • Establish a highly optimized and automated paved paths for Danske Banks engineers to build applications on AWS
  • Transform functional and non-functional requirements to solid system designs
  • Integrate security practices into the path that ensures applications are secure and compliant with industry standards
  • Integration of vendor-built systems & packages

What You Bring

We imagine you have at least 5 years of programming experience (e.g., JAVA, C#, SQL, RabbitMQ, SpringBoot, Hibernate, Maven) and a degree in Computer Science or related technical subject area.

You are experience and familiarity with key cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, IBM Cloud etc.) and you bring a strong collaborative mind-set aimed at finding solutions through augmentation and facts.

  • A product mindset that enables you to focus on building products and offerings that solves actual developer needs
  • Experience with CI / CD tooling and practices
  • Experience working in a DevOps environment
  • An automation first mind-set
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal and explanation skills

What We Offer

Our employees can use our offers such as canteen, fitness centre, and much more. You will also benefit from a highly attractive benefits package offering health and dental insurance, pension and other benefits. You will also have flexible work hours and 6 weeks of vacation to ensure your work-life balance.

Would you like to join us

Title: Back End Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Description

√ònskeskyen / Gowish is looking for a Backend Developer to join our team. You will be working on the development of new features on the Platform within one of our dynamic Product Teams.




As a Backend Developer, you will be responsible for developing highly scalable and distributed backend services and infrastructure. You will work with a wide range of technologies, including Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, GraphQL, Apollo, Cypher, SQL, Kafka, Kubernetes, Postgres and more. You will collaborate closely with frontend and app developers to create user, admin, and 3rd party-facing features, as well as contribute to the development of our infrastructure and other backend services.




About us

At √ònskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally. As a Backend developer you will enhance our users feature set but also play a significant role in integrating and refining user satisfaction across the entire application lifecycle. This position offers a fantastic opportunity to refine your skills within our dynamic, cross-functional team and advance professionally in a forward-thinking environment.




Workplace

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offered.




Responsibilities

Develop highly scalable and distributed backend services
Work in an agile team with a focus on quality and continuous delivery
Work closely with product to understand the business needs and translate them into technical solutions
Work closely with the frontend team to ensure a seamless integration of the frontend and backend




Qualifications

Strong understanding of scalable and distributed systems
Experience working with Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, GraphQL, Kafka, Cypher
Strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to take ownership of tasks
A team player who is eager about sharing their knowledge and learning from others
Strong communication skills and ability to decompose complex problems into manageable workable items
Fluent in English




Preferred experience working with

Distributed systems and Microservices
Graph and SQL databases
Apollo Federated Graphs
Cloud infrastructure / Kubernetes




Salary will be negotiated based on skills and experience.




The start date is ASAP and the position is permanent. This position will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Title: Software Engineer in Test
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Start Date

ASAP

¬†

Description

At √ònskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally. As a Software Engineer in Test you will play a key part in ensuring that our users always get the best experience possible. Along with designing and developing automated tests, you will also assist in planning process and defining testing strategies. You will work with development and cross-functional teams across the company to make sure they have right tools, knowledge and support to deliver quality releases. The position requires excellent communication skills.

¬†

Please note

This position is not remote.¬†

Relocation packages are not offered.

¬†

What You Will Do

Design, develop and maintain automated tests (TypeScript) for web and mobile applications to ensure their functionality, performance, and scalability.
Design and implement backend/API tests to validate the accuracy and reliability of data interactions and integrations.
Identify and drive improvements in test framework and processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software requirements and define test strategies.
Conduct manual testing as needed to identify issues that are not covered by automated tests.
Write clear and concise test documentation.

¬†

Skills & Experience

Experience collaborating across teams to plan, prioritise and support the team¬†
3+ years of experience as SDET or QA with strong automation skills.
Proficiency in TypeScript or JavaScript for test automation.
Solid experience of web and/or mobile UI testing frameworks (e.g. Playwright, Cypress, Detox)
Hands-on experience in backend/API testing (REST, GraphQL), including data validation and integration testing.
Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (Danish not required).

¬†

Bonus Points For:

Experience leading a team.
Performance testing experience (e.g., k6, Gatling).
Implementing component testing.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g. Google Cloud, Kubernetes).
Guiding teams in best practices in testing.

¬†

If you feel you're a good fit, but don't check every box, we'd still love to hear from you!

¬†

Perks

Competitive salary package, including pension and private health insurance.
30 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra days).
Subsidised lunches in the office.
An engaging team environment with frequent social activities.¬†

¬†

Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere.¬†

¬†

Take this chance to join √ònskeskyen and help shape our mobile future while propelling your career to new heights. Apply now!

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description:
My client is looking for a Cloud Engineer with a passion for Microsoft Azure and a knack for building scalable and secure cloud environments. If you get excited about leveraging Infrastructure as Code to drive efficiency and consistency and if you're looking to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing Cloud Centre of Excellence (CCoE) in Copenhagen then they will want to speak to you.




The Opportunity:

As a Cloud Engineer within their CCoE, you will be instrumental in shaping and implementing our cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure. You'll bring your expertise in Infrastructure as Code (preferably Bicep) and your deep understanding of Azure services and security to help us build a robust, scalable, and efficient cloud platform. Your contributions will directly impact their ability to innovate and deliver value to our customers.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement Azure infrastructure and services using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles, with a strong preference for Bicep.
Manage and optimize our Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) environment for secure identity and access management across our cloud resources.
Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts for automation of cloud tasks, deployments, and configuration management.
Collaborate with architecture, security, and development teams to define and implement cloud best practices and standards within the CCoE framework.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of reusable Bicep modules and deployment pipelines.
Contribute to the documentation and knowledge sharing within the CCoE.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
Solid experience as a Cloud Engineer, with a strong focus on Microsoft Azure.
Deep understanding and hands-on experience with Entra ID (formerly Azure AD), including user management, group policies, conditional access, and security features.
Proven experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools and methodologies. Strong preference for Bicep. Experience with ARM templates or other IaC tools is also valuable.
Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation and management of Azure resources.
Danish speaking is required.




Cool Benefits You'll Enjoy:

Flexible Work Environment: Embrace a hybrid work model with the flexibility to balance working from our modern Copenhagen office and your home.
Generous Vacation & Leave: Enjoy a competitive number of vacation days plus additional leave for personal development or volunteering.
Comprehensive Health & Wellness: We offer a premium health insurance plan, access to mental wellness resources, and encourage an active lifestyle with potential fitness subsidies.
Innovation Days: Dedicate time to explore new technologies and ideas during our regular innovation days.
High-End Equipment: We provide you with the latest and greatest hardware and software to ensure you have the best tools for the job.
Company Socials & Events: Connect with your colleagues through regular social events, team-building activities, and company-wide celebrations.




If you are interested then please apply below, or feel free to reach out to george@kodastaff.dk for further information.

Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (C++) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with C++
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Front-End Developer Expertise for AI Training
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you a world-class front-end developer or web designer who wants to help shape the future of AI?

We collaborate with leading AI organizations to train large language models‚Äîteaching them how to design and code like the best front-end engineers and designers in the world. Our projects focus on helping generative AI improve its understanding of front-end technologies, UI/UX principles, and modern web standards.

This is a rare opportunity to put your coding and design skills to work in training cutting-edge AI systems‚Äîno prior experience with AI is required.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for exceptional front-end developers and designers to help train generative AI models.
This freelance role is fully remote and offers flexible hours‚Äîyou can work whenever works best for you.


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Creating and answering questions about front-end development and web design to help train AI models
Reviewing and evaluating code generated by AI in JavaScript, React, and other modern front-end frameworks
Assessing UI/UX quality, accessibility, and design choices made by AI-generated code
Offering expert-level feedback on what makes a user interface intuitive, functional, and beautiful


We‚Äôre looking for people with‚Ä¶


Strong technical skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React, Next.js, Vue, or similar
An eye for world-class design‚Äîdeep understanding of UI/UX principles, responsive design, and interaction patterns
Experience building polished, accessible, and production-ready web interfaces
A background in computer science, web development, or digital design (degree not required if experience is exceptional)
Outstanding attention to detail and ability to communicate clearly about visual and code quality


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work are up to USD $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: Principal Development Scientist - Research & Development, applied
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Principal Development Scientist

We are seeking a talented and motivated Scientist to join our team. The successful candidate will focus on developing biosolutions for a range of applications (Fresh Dairy, Plant Based Dairy Alternatives etc.) by combining different bacterial strains into fermentation cultures.

This role requires a strong foundation in microbiology, biochemistry, and food science, complemented by a passion for data analysis and working with data models. Additionally, an analytical mindset and a problem-solving approach are essential for tackling challenges effectively.

Welcome to Combinatorial Microbiology

You will become a part of the Combinatorial Microbiology department which is anchored within the Applied R&D Dairy and Dairy Alternatives organization. Our department plays an important role in both short and long-term new product development projects.

We develop fermentation cultures (biosolutions) for a wide range of applications including fresh dairy, and dairy alternatives by using a combinatorial microbiology approach. We translate market needs into biosolutions through combinations of microorganisms and enzymes using digital tools supported by application relevant model systems.

The department is composed of 36 highly skilled scientists and technicians who are distributed in four teams with different areas of responsibility. Furthermore, the department has a strong focus on developing laboratory methods in micro, small and medium scale, digital competences, and skills in general that are essential to develop the biosolutions of the future. We are now searching for a Principal Senior Development Scientist to focus on developing biosolutions for fermented food products (e.g., yogurt, cheese etc.).

How You‚Äôll Make An Impact

Designing and developing cultures for a wide range of fermented dairy products such as yogurts as part of our innovative biosolutions portfolio. Your expertise will be part of solving the latest challenges in the industry and drive the creation of biosolutions for our customers that are more effective, efficient, and sustainable. You will explore the synergistic effects of different microbial cultures and discover new ways to enhance product performance and drive innovation in the industry.

In This Pivotal Role, You Will


Revolutionize Fresh Dairy Fermented Products:‚ÄØDesign and develop microbial cultures for fresh dairy taking our‚ÄØbiosolutions portfolio‚ÄØto the next level. Your work will address the latest challenges in the industry, helping to create more efficient, effective, and sustainable products for our fresh dairy customers.
Explore Synergies:‚ÄØUnlock the potential of microbial interactions by exploring the synergistic effects of various bacterial strains, enhancing product performance and driving innovation.
Shape the Future of Biosolutions:‚ÄØContribute to the development of strategic roadmaps for combinatorial microbiology, guiding the integration of predictive models and data-driven insights into our innovation pipeline.


Key Responsibilities


Develop Cutting-Edge Cultures:‚ÄØCreate microbial cultures with combined functionalities to enhanceproperties such as acidification, texture, and flavor across diverse applications.
Design Experiments with Purpose:‚ÄØPlan, execute, and report experimental work using‚ÄØadvanced Design of Experiments (DoE)‚ÄØmethodologies to optimize culture performance, and related processes.
Apply Predictive Analytics:‚ÄØUse data-driven models and chemometric techniques to tailor microbial functionalities and improve product outcomes with precision.
Build High-Throughput Models:‚ÄØDevelop and validate high-throughput systems that mimic industrial applications, integrating statistical and computational tools to boost predictive accuracy.
Drive computational assisted Microbiology:‚ÄØChampion the use of combinatorial microbiology by integrating predictive analytics into departmental workflows.
Shape Strategic Direction:‚ÄØDefine objectives and roadmaps for combinatorial microbiology, aligning innovation with long-term business goals..


What We‚Äôre Looking For


A Ph.D. or Master‚Äôs degree in‚ÄØMicrobiology,‚ÄØBiochemistry,‚ÄØFood Science, or a related field, along with relevant industry or academic experience.
Proven Expertise in‚ÄØfermentation,‚ÄØexperimental design (DoE), and‚ÄØstatistical modeling.
Proficiency in applying‚ÄØdata analytics, chemometric techniques‚ÄØ(e.g. PCA, PLS) or other computational tools to solve scientific challenges.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to tackling technical challenges.
Excellent collaboration and communication abilities to work effectively across multidisciplinary teams and share knowledge clearly.


We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible

Application deadline: 1 June 2025

Location: H√∏rsholm

Contact details: Department Manager Denise Felix Da Silva - defe@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to spearhead the maturity and continuous development of our Kubernetes platform? Do you aspire to become key enabler in a team that is uniquely positioned to advance the future of Kamstrup‚Äôs cloud-native journey? Are you motivated by running cross-collaborative projects and looking for a role where your contributions have a direct impact on the company's success?

Here Is What The Job Entails

As our new Platform Engineer, your main responsibility will be to oversee the governance, capacity management, and operation of our Kubernetes platform based on the needs of our developers. Your focus will be on simplifying workflows for Kamstrup developers, enabling them to create and deploy high-quality software more effectively

More specifically, you will be:


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to optimize platform performance and reliability
Continuously evaluating our platform roadmap and adopting new technologies to improve our platform
Maintaining processes to ensure continuous deployment, vulnerability mitigation, disaster-recovery control, FinOps, and compliance
Acting as a valued advisor, providing support and guidance to our consumers and mapping requirements



In this role, you will have the freedom to act, as you will play a key role in elevating the developer experience and enabling them to reduce time to market. You will drive and have the opportunity to explore and deep dive into new technologies as we strive to stay at the technological forefront.

Meet your future team

With direct reference to our Head of Cloud and Platform Engineering, you will join a team of 9 skilled colleagues, consisting of IT Architects, Platform Engineers, DevOps Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our team is the backbone of our digital transformation journey, focusing on modern and microservices architecture. We are a growing and motivated team responsible for providing platforms for our development teams and enhancing the developer experience. Our team values transparency, high ambitions, good collegiality, diversity, knowledge sharing, and sparring.

Did you know? We deeply enjoy discussing technologies, so we frequently organize hackathons. Additionally, we share a common passion for cakes, which is why almost all our team meetings start with cake

Less About Us, More About You

We are looking for a proactive Platform Engineer who is driven by acting as the liaison between vendor products and internal developer requirements. Your natural curiosity leads you to seek new challenges, in which you secure a balanced mix between new and existing frameworks, allowing you to translate your insights into achievable solutions

In order to succeed, we imagine that you:


Have 5+ years of experience designing, deploying, and managing Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters
Have experience with Docker/Kubernetes, GitLab, CICD frameworks, and pipeline deployments
Are proficient with DevOps tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, GitHub Enterprise, and other CNCF-related tools
Have working knowledge of Role-Based Access Control, authentication, and authorization mechanisms
Have experience with Azure cloud resource setup and management



As we are an international organization it is important that you are fluent in English.

We want to support a diverse and inclusive workplace, so while you may not meet all the qualifications listed above, you could still be a good candidate for the position. If you find the role intriguing, do not hesitate to apply.

We are more than an ordinary workplace

We cherish the good colleagueship which we all contribute to, the only limit is your engagement. As we are a big organization you are bound to find one or more colleagues who share the same interest as you. This might be in our board game club, on our cycling team, during our yearly summer festival, or on the padel court. For example, our Team lead, Service Delivery is also our volunteer padel instructor while one of our Software Test Engineers run weekly spinning classes.

Besides the best colleagues you could imagine, we also offer:


Work life balance through flexible working hours
Employee benefits including a healthy canteen, fitness facilities, in-house dental clinic, hairdresser, and a free health clinic
An active employee association that fosters a collaborative and supportive workplace community
Beneficial health care and insurance package



Do you want to be a part of Kamstrup?

Please submit your application by using the link below. Applications are reviewed on a continuous basis, and you can expect a response within six weeks.

The job will be located at Kamstrup's headquarters in Stilling, between Aarhus and Skanderborg.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Head of EA, Infrastructure & Platforms, Anushree Pandey on phone: +45 89 93 10 00.

Get to know us

At Kamstrup, you'll become part of a close-knit community that genuinely cares about one another, fostering connections both in and out of the workplace. Our team comprises innovators, dreamers, and doers, united by an unyielding passion to challenge the status quo, find better solutions, and constantly push the boundaries of what's possible all with the purpose of securing clean water and energy to the maximum number of people. With an unwavering commitment to growth, we offer opportunities for you to leverage your skills and drive our business to new heights, empowering you to leave your mark on our future and grow with us.

Explore more on our website, see our annual report, and stay updated through LinkedIn for the latest news and job openings.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
üíª Role: Senior AI Engineer / Data Scientist

üåç Location: Remote, EU-based

üí∞ Salary: ‚Ç¨80,000 to ‚Ç¨120,000 + Equity

üõ† Key Skills: Python, AWS, LLMs/NLP, Vector DBs, Recommender Systems




A fast-growing technology company is seeking a skilled Senior AI Engineer to help build innovative AI solutions, including AI-driven agents and recommender systems. The role offers full ownership across the stack, from design and model development to deployment and iteration, and the opportunity to work with complex, large-scale data inputs.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and improve recommender systems.
Design and build AI agents with decision-making capabilities.
Create clustering models to extract insights from B2B datasets.
Work with diverse data sources and implement efficient pre-processing pipelines.
Optimise models for real-time applications and large-scale deployment.
Integrate AI models into production systems.
Maintain and enhance existing systems and support reliability efforts.
Deliver ad-hoc data analyses and actionable insights for the business.




Required Skills and Experience:

10+ years' professional experience in machine learning and AI.
Hands-on experience deploying ML models and LLM-based products to production.
Proficient in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks such as langchain/langgraph.
Strong background in data analysis, model performance evaluation, and cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS).
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, pgVector).




Preferred Profile:

Previous experience in a start-up environment.
Collaborative mindset, comfortable working with engineering, product, and design teams.
Practical approach to continuous improvement rather than perfectionism.
Bonus: experience in SalesTech.




Offer:

Competitive salary (‚Ç¨80,000‚Äì‚Ç¨120,000) plus equity (‚Ç¨10,000‚Äì‚Ç¨20,000).
Equipment allowance (‚Ç¨3,000 per year).
Permanent employment or B2B contracting option.
Fully remote role within the European Union.

Title: Research Engineer, Applied AI
Description:
As a research engineer you will work on improving kapa‚Äôs ability to answer harder and harder technical questions. Check out Docker‚Äôs documentation for a live example of what kapa is (look for the ‚ÄúAsk AI‚Äù button).

In This Role, You Will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Work on and do research in state-of-the-art retrieval and search techniques.
Work on and deploy machine learning models as part of RAG.
Continuously improve our quality evaluation frameworks to enable robust iteration.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.
Design and run experiments.


In addition to the founding team, you'll have support from a number of leading academics in the field that are all close advisors (incl. Douwe Kiela, author of the original RAG paper).

You May Be a Good Fit If You Have


A Master's/ PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
A detailed understanding of machine learning, deep learning (including LLMs) and natural language processing.
Hands-on experience in training, fine-tuning and deploying large language models.
Have prior experience working with vector databases, search indices, or other data stores for search and retrieval use cases.
Significant experience building evaluation systems for LLMs or search.
Familiarity with various information retrieval techniques, such as lexical search and dense vector search.
The ability to work effectively in a fast in a environment where things are sometimes loosely defined.
Want to learn more about machine learning research.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary set of attributes. Even if none of these apply to you, but you believe you will contribute to kapa.ai, please reach out.

Title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
Br√¶nder du for kvalitetssikring, og kan du se dig selv i en rolle, hvor struktur og overblik er afg√∏rende? Har du erfaring med test og risikovurdering, og trives du med at arbejde m√•lrettet for at sikre stabile og p√•lidelige softwarel√∏sninger? S√• er det m√•ske dig, Saphe A/S s√∏ger som deres nye Quality Assurance Engineer. Her f√•r du mulighed for at udvikle teststrategier fra bunden og bidrage til bedre trafiksikkerhed for millioner af mennesker.




Om jobbet

Jobbet som Quality Assurance Engineer kr√¶ver en strategisk og struktureret tilgang til kvalitetssikring. Du bliver ansvarlig for at udvikle teststrategier, prioritere test-indsatsen og gennemf√∏re risikovurderinger for at sikre, at de vigtigste funktioner altid er d√¶kket. Du er struktureret og detaljeorienteret med erfaring i at opbygge og forbedre testprocesser. Du trives med at tage ansvar og kan samarbejde effektivt p√• tv√¶rs af teams. Samtidig har du en praktisk tilgang til kvalitetssikring, hvor du form√•r at oms√¶tte analyser og vurderinger til handling.

Erfaring med eller indsigt i automatisering af tests

Personlige egenskaber, der v√¶gtes h√∏jt:

Ansvarsbevidst og selvk√∏rende
Samarbejdsorienteret og √•ben for dialog p√• tv√¶rs af teams

Title: App Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what‚Äôs possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

KAUZA and Kantar's Worldpanel team (the folks who analyze what people buy) are hiring an App Developer based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The Goal

They're building a new platform to give their clients much better and faster insights into consumer shopping habits. Your main job will be to help get this platform launched and then make it work globally.

Role Overview: We are looking for a talented React Native Developer to join our team. You will work closely with pentesters and tools engineers to ensure the app is both secure and insightful, while also driving long-term user engagement.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain features such as personalized insights and visualizations of spending habits.
Implement secure and smooth login/onboarding experiences.
Create gamification and streak tracking features.
Develop smart product suggestions and reminders.
Build budgeting tools and progress dashboards.
Implement push notifications and local alerts.
Create lightweight social and sharing features.
Develop in-store quick-log and barcode scanning tools.


What We're Looking For


Full Professional English Proficiency (C1 Level minimum required).
Strong experience in React Native and the Expo ecosystem (iOS & Android).
Familiarity with authentication flows (OAuth, biometrics, token storage).
Experience building data-driven UIs and interactive dashboards.
Comfort with state management (e.g., Redux, Zustand, Jotai).
Good grasp of TypeScript and component architecture.
Experience with local storage solutions (e.g., MMKV, SQLite, or Firestore).
Familiarity with analytics, retention metrics, and push notification systems.
Ability to collaborate effectively with backend, security, and UX teammates.
Bonus: Experience with mobile security, barcode scanning (e.g., ML Kit or react-native-camera), or gamification mechanics.


What You‚Äôll Get From Us


30 days annual leave
Hybrid & Flexible work schedule
Private Medical Insurance.
Flexible benefits across health, wealth, and lifestyle.


About Us

Kauza ApS is a consulting company based in Copenhagen that provides fact-based advisory and shopper insights to players in the FMCG industry in the Nordic market. Kauza‚Äôs services are delivered in innovative dashboard solutions powered by cloud technology and machine learning, ensuring that they meet the clients‚Äô key business questions with the right mix of data accessibility and data usability, making it possible to deliver shopper behavior and purchase data in rear real time.

Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies. Kantar‚Äôs 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar. We provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.

We have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to encourage new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that‚Äôs out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to build an equality of opportunity in a fair and encouraging working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well-being is taken into consideration.

We want to build a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Privacy and Legal Statement

PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (‚ÄúKantar‚Äù). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Country

Denmark

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Remote Coding Expertise for AI Training - Swift
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must know *Swift* for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in your native language
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with Swift
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $16 to $33 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: Internship - Frontend Developer in Startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a passion for front-end development and creating perfect design?

Do you want to work in a fast-growing tech startup where you‚Äôll get real responsibility and hands-on experience from day one? At AdPlenty, we‚Äôre looking for a motivated developer to help us shape the future of digital advertising! (please note - Unpaid internship)

About AdPlenty

At AdPlenty, we're working towards providing the ultimate local marketing platform. We are a software company developing SaaS advertising for B2B clients, with our fully automatic ‚Äúall-in-one‚Äù platform. It is designed to simplify professional online advertising by generating and streamlining marketing campaigns. But more than that, we are a community of dedicated individuals, who believe in fostering a supportive and inclusive culture where your ideas are valued.

We are now looking for an ambitious and driven front-end developer with a passion for developing great-looking web apps. If you are excited about delivering compelling digital user experiences then you are the right candidate.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall supporting the team with platform design implementation: implementation of new designs and features in collaboration with our designer and full-stack developers.


Develop & maintain frontend features that enhance the platform‚Äôs user experience. Work closely with experienced software engineers in an agile, fast-moving environment. Help set up banners, ads, and HTML structures that power our ad tech solutions Gain real-world experience with projects that directly impact businesses


Details

The internship is 3 months

Start Date

15 May 2025 or

15 August 2025

Please note the internship is unpaid.

Who You Are

You have an interest in frontend development and min. 1 year work experience Have experience with frontend frameworks (React, Angular JS, etc.), good understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript Detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and Eager to learn and contribute to real projects

Need To Have Qualifications


HTML5, CSS3
Javascript
AngularJS / Angular / React


Nice To Have Qualifications


Node JS, Docker
Amazon AWS (ECS, S3)
Figma


We are based in central Copenhagen at Matrikel1 - in a fun and innovative startup community. Its an on-site position

Ready to Apply?

If this sounds like a good fit for you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you

Do not hesitate to send your application. We need you urgently and will be interviewing candidates as applications come in. For more information or questions please contact our Technical Lead Ignas @ advative.io

Title: Software Engineer, React
Description:
Are you passionate about building software and ready to take your developer skills to the next level? Can you develop within a complex core system? And are you experienced with React? If so, then you might be the person we are looking for!




We are currently in search of a Software Engineer to join our web development team at JYSK. This role involves collaboration with various business units, and as an integral part of the team, you will contribute significantly to implementing web applications used by over 100 million customers across 28 countries. Your responsibilities will include creating intuitive user interactions for both our customers and store employees.




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

You will be working in a cross functional agile scrum team of skilled and motivated engineers with room for planning and building features by following best practices. You will work closely together with our E-Commerce and Java teams to find the best solutions.




Furthermore, we offer you:

a great opportunity to develop and grow professionally and personally
a relaxed and open-minded work environment
plenty of opportunities to influence technical solutions
several social activities during the year, including Friday bars, DHL run, winter party etc.
a well-functioning work-from-home policy
a healthy work-life balance as well as a loyal company culture




WHAT YOUR NEXT JOB WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities in the job include:

developing and maintaining JYSK‚Äôs web applications with a focus on performance and scalability
working closely with team members and stakeholders to build seamless user experiences
taking ownership of existing applications and drive continuous improvements
stay updated on Web technologies and share knowledge in the department
receiving and giving technical guidance and mentorship in the development team to constantly improve yours and your colleagues‚Äô skills




You can read more about our department at here.




WHAT SHOULD YOU BRING

We are looking for a new colleague who:

proficiency in React, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS
good communications skills and work well in a small or cross-functional team
experience with scalable web applications and performance optimisation
a proactive approach to improving solutions and challenging the status quo
maybe experience with payment solutions




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Team Leader, Danni Larsen +45 3190 8900.




Please send us your CV with a short motivation for the position by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. We process applications on an ongoing basis and complete the recruitment once we have found the right candidate.




ABOUT US

We believe our employees are key to our success. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing and finding new challenges within JYSK. Since our founder, Lars Larsen, opened his first store in Denmark in 1979, JYSK has expanded our global presence with stores and web shops in countries around the world.




Our three fundamental JYSK Values ‚Äì Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit ‚Äì express the behaviour and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in Empowerment and freedom with responsibility. We also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. With the right attitude, opportunities abound in JYSK.




JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.




For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Software Test Engineer - start your career in quality assurance here
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Test Engineer ‚Äì start your career in quality assurance here

Have you graduated within the last year or about to do so? And do you believe that quality assurances makes a real impact? Then join us in Copenhagen, as our new Software Test Engineer and help us test high-quality on our software training platform for the defence sector.

The position
SitaWare Aspire, our next-generation training platform designed for modern Defence operations, is expanding the team in Copenhagen, hence we are looking for our new Software Test Engineer.

Being our new test colleague, you will be responsible for ensuring a high level of test and quality assurance of our products. This happens throughout the entire feature development phase and with your close cooperation with your developer team, and early test involvement. Together with the Test team in Systematic Defence, you will be the guardian of high quality standards and processes.

Some of your overall responsibilities will be:


Asking all the critical questions in the development process, understanding the assignment, ensuring close cooperation with all stakeholders e.g. developers, product owners, designers, and project managers
Owning the quality assurance and ensure that quality is built in from the beginning
Ensuring new features have a testable design
Being responsible for establishing test strategies, create test cases from user stories, participate in risk analysis, ensuring requirements are met and tested alongside executing manual testing
Participating in all test activities like system test, bug hunt and integrations tests etc.



Join the Aspire team in Copenhagen
We are establishing a new team for Aspire in Copenhagen. Hence, you will join a growing Defence business, where we develop software that support critical decision-making, when it matters the most.

We would like to offer you the following:


Meaningful mission ‚Äì Contribute to defence tech that enhances real-world operational readiness
Central Copenhagen office ‚Äì Join our new team in a modern office just steps away from everything the city has to offer as well as public transportation
Strong foundation, startup feel ‚Äì Aspire is our youngest Defence product with strong adoption and more to come
International, collaborative culture ‚Äì Work alongside skilled teams in Aarhus, and across nationalities.



Your Qualifications
As a our new Software Test Engineer, we expect you to be curious and be the one to ask the questions such as ‚Äúhow can this be tested?‚Äù, ‚Äúhow will this be useful for the customer?‚Äù when we are discussing the features.

Furthermore, we are looking for someone, who will enjoy being part of a new team in Copenhagen by creating and contributing a good team spirit, both locally and across locations.

Last but not least you should recognise yourself in the following:


Bachelor- or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar
Experience with software testing; either from a student job, internship or full time experience after graduation



As a Test Engineer you will be working with a lot of different technologies.

Some of them could be:


JIRA, Xray and R4J
Linux CLI
Bash and PowerShell
Docker
Git



You should be expect to be at our headquarter in Aarhus around 20 days a year.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO and/or an EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Welcome to Systematic Copenhagen
When you join us in Copenhagen, you're not just getting a desk at one of the city‚Äôs best locations‚Äîyou‚Äôre stepping into a workplace where community matters. Our Employees Club keeps things lively with monthly social events, and our office catering makes sure you‚Äôre always well taken care of. Whether you‚Äôre into casual games or just good company, you‚Äôll find both at our foosball table or during our relaxed Friday bar gatherings.

Never stop developing
Systematic is uniquely people-centric, truly international and proudly rooted in Denmark with more than 1100 employees. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.‚ÄØ

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Rebecca Johannsen, Senior Test Project Manager.

Get in touch

Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Software Engineer (Full-Stack)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Copli

Copli is a fast-growing GenAI software company transforming content creation workflows for the world‚Äôs largest pharmaceutical companies. Over the past 12 months, we‚Äôve established ourselves as a trusted partner, collaborating with many of the top pharma companies globally and are experiencing strong demand for our solution.




We‚Äôre building an innovative, agentic system that pushes the boundaries of what GenAI can do - redefining the ‚ÄúMedical, Legal, and Regulatory‚Äù (MLR) review process for promotional materials. This process is currently conducted 100% manually and requires specialized medical, legal, and regulatory expertise. At Copli, we‚Äôre automating it, saving days of manual work for our users.




We are principled, focused entirely on building useful, practical products our customers genuinely value. We leverage AI extensively but know great ideas require real human insight - yours.




About the role

We‚Äôre seeking a full-stack software engineer to help us reshape how marketing content is produced within one of the most regulated industries in the world. You'll work closely with our team on defining and building core product features. This could involve everything from developing AI agents that understand research papers, building evaluation pipelines to ensure their performance, and help shape how their output should be delivered to the end user.




You‚Äôre adaptable, proactive, and enjoy deeply understanding complex domains in order to automate them with software. Our team is lean and fast-moving, so you should thrive in a low-structure environment and be comfortable communicating clearly and effectively.




A few things to think about as you're reaching out to us:

What core principles guide your work? Which of these have remained stable for you across the pre- and post-GenAI landscape?
In the context of GenAI, how do you ensure you're solving genuine customer problems and adding tangible value - not just chasing hype?
How do you balance leveraging AI capabilities with essential human judgment or 'organic intelligence'? Where is human oversight most critical?
What's your approach to addressing inherent limitations, potential biases, or inaccuracies associated with GenAI tools?




What you will work on

Product development: Design and implement end-to-end AI solutions that automate complex MLR workflows
Innovation and prototyping: Explore new ideas and push the boundaries of what's possible with GenAI in regulated industries
System performance and evaluation: Optimize and benchmark our AI systems to ensure they meet the high standards required in pharmaceutical regulatory processes
Knowledge integration: Ensure our models have access to perfect sources including regulatory rules, medical information, and other domain-specific content to make accurate decisions
Internal tools: Build and maintain tools that improve our team's productivity and capabilities - we are a team of builders where everyone contributes where needed




You are a great fit if you:

Have strong experience with Python, and ideally React
Have worked in a startup or similarly fast-paced environment and thrive with autonomy and ambiguity
Have experience or strong interest in GenAI and building agentic/autonomous systems
Are comfortable working across the stack and rapidly prototyping and shipping solutions
Possess natural curiosity and a desire to learn and understand complex domains
Are relentlessly resourceful - able to deliver solutions and figure things out even when the path isn't clear




What we offer:

A highly collaborative and innovative team culture with a strong focus on learning and growth
The opportunity to shape cutting-edge AI technology in a fast-growing startup
Significant ownership and impact from day one
Excellent breakfast, chef-prepared lunch, and great coffee




Tech stack

Back-end: Python following Domain-Driven Design principles, cloud-native with Azure as our provider, LLMs from different providers
Front-end: React




How to Apply

Email Jacob (CEO, co-founder) at hello@copli.io with your CV/resume and a short note about your motivation.




We look forward to hearing from you!

We‚Äôre building an innovative, agentic system that pushes the boundaries of what GenAI can do - redefining the ‚ÄúMedical, Legal, and Regulatory‚Äù (MLR) review process for promotional materials. This process is currently conducted 100% manually and requires specialized medical, legal, and regulatory expertise. At Copli, we‚Äôre automating it, saving days of manual work for our users.


We are principled, focused entirely on building useful, practical products our customers genuinely value. We leverage AI extensively but know great ideas require real human insight - yours.


About the role

We‚Äôre seeking a full-stack software engineer to help us reshape how marketing content is produced within one of the most regulated industries in the world. You'll work closely with our team on defining and building core product features. This could involve everything from developing AI agents that understand research papers, building evaluation pipelines to ensure their performance, and help shape how their output should be delivered to the end user.


You‚Äôre adaptable, proactive, and enjoy deeply understanding complex domains in order to automate them with software. Our team is lean and fast-moving, so you should thrive in a low-structure environment and be comfortable communicating clearly and effectively.


A few things to think about as you're reaching out to us:

  • What core principles guide your work? Which of these have remained stable for you across the pre- and post-GenAI landscape?
  • In the context of GenAI, how do you ensure you're solving genuine customer problems and adding tangible value - not just chasing hype?
  • How do you balance leveraging AI capabilities with essential human judgment or 'organic intelligence'? Where is human oversight most critical?
  • What's your approach to addressing inherent limitations, potential biases, or inaccuracies associated with GenAI tools?


What you will work on

  • Product development: Design and implement end-to-end AI solutions that automate complex MLR workflows
  • Innovation and prototyping: Explore new ideas and push the boundaries of what's possible with GenAI in regulated industries
  • System performance and evaluation: Optimize and benchmark our AI systems to ensure they meet the high standards required in pharmaceutical regulatory processes
  • Knowledge integration: Ensure our models have access to perfect sources including regulatory rules, medical information, and other domain-specific content to make accurate decisions
  • Internal tools: Build and maintain tools that improve our team's productivity and capabilities - we are a team of builders where everyone contributes where needed


You are a great fit if you:

  • Have strong experience with Python, and ideally React
  • Have worked in a startup or similarly fast-paced environment and thrive with autonomy and ambiguity
  • Have experience or strong interest in GenAI and building agentic/autonomous systems
  • Are comfortable working across the stack and rapidly prototyping and shipping solutions
  • Possess natural curiosity and a desire to learn and understand complex domains
  • Are relentlessly resourceful - able to deliver solutions and figure things out even when the path isn't clear


What we offer:

  • A highly collaborative and innovative team culture with a strong focus on learning and growth
  • The opportunity to shape cutting-edge AI technology in a fast-growing startup
  • Significant ownership and impact from day one
  • Excellent breakfast, chef-prepared lunch, and great coffee


Tech stack

  • Back-end: Python following Domain-Driven Design principles, cloud-native with Azure as our provider, LLMs from different providers
  • Front-end: React


How to Apply

Email Jacob (CEO, co-founder) at hello@copli.io with your CV/resume and a short note about your motivation.


We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Proteomics Specialist - DTU Biosustain
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

The Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Biosustainability (DTU Biosustain) at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) aims at developing new knowledge and technologies to help facilitate the transformation from the existing oil-based chemical industry to a more sustainable bio-based society in which chemicals are produced biologically. The Biofoundry is an important part of DTU Biosustain and ensures effective development and implementation of strain design procedures in our design-build-test-learn workflow using big data and data science. The Analytics team is part of the Biofoundry and is providing reliable, accurate and high-throughput analytical services by means of state-of-the-art analytical techniques. We are now seeking a Proteomics Scientist to join the team for a one-year temporary position.

The job

As a Proteomics Specialist (Staff Scientist) you will be part of a dynamic international team where you will be supporting the on-going activities and projects focusing research on sustainable chemicals, natural products and microbial foods. You will be reporting directly to the Head of Analytics and your immediate responsibilities will be:


Developing new and running previously implemented LC-MS based proteomics workflows (sample preparation, absolute and relative quantification as well as identification)
Implementing quality control systems for all proteomics related analyses
Handling and reporting experimental data in reports, lab notebooks and LIMS-systems
Writing and maintaining SOPs
Flexibly and proactively helping other team members within the Analytics Team and efficiently collaborating with other research groups and departments within DTU


Daily maintenance and troubleshooting of LC-MS equipment (preferably experience with Orbitrap instruments)

Our expectations of you

We are looking for a colleague who likes to create results via positive and efficient teamwork. As part of this, you must thrive in a multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural and highly interactive environment where knowledge sharing, and collaboration are keys to succeed. Additionally, your CV comprises:


PhD in analytical chemistry or similar
Proven experience in setting up and performing proteomics/protein analyses (sample preparation, method development (both DDA and DIA), data processing & reporting) of biological samples by LC-MS
Excellent understanding of the technology involved in performing proteomics analyses (including liquid chromatography, high-resolution mass spectrometry, bioinformatics and related software)
Strong oral and written skills in English ‚Äì our communication language is English
Flexibility, enthusiasm, responsibility, team spirit and excellent collaboration skills
Capable of working on your own initiative when appropriate


What We Offer In Return

We offer an interesting and challenging job in an international atmosphere with the focus on research, teaching, innovation and scientific advice for the benefit of the surrounding community. We place emphasis on a high level of professionalism among our staff, so skills development is an integral part of our organization. We offer a great flexibility in the position. In the area of technical and natural sciences, DTU is one of the leading research and education institutions in Europe.

Salary and appointment terms

The salary and appointment terms will be based on the collective agreement with the Confederation of Professional Associations (AC) and take into account the qualifications and experience of the candidate.

The position is a 1 year time-limited position, full-time, with a preferred starting date no later than July 1 st , 2025 (or according to mutual agreement).

The place of work will be the Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Biosustainability (DTU Biosustain), DTU Lyngby Campus.

Application and contact

Please submit your online application no later than Saturday 31 May 2025. Open the ‚ÄúApply now‚Äù link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.

If you would like additional information about the position, please contact Linda Ahonen, Head of Analytics, linaho@biosustain.dtu.dk

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. As DTU works with research in critical technology, which is subject to special rules for security and export control, open-source background checks may be conducted on qualified candidates for the position.

The Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Biosustainability (DTU Biosustain)

Recent progress in our ability to read and write genomic code, combined with advances in automation, analytics and data science, has fundamentally changed the scope and ambition of harnessing the potential of biological systems. Big data approaches and analysis of biological systems are key research instruments at the Center. DTU Biosustain utilizes these advances for microbial cell factory design to foster sustainable lifestyles in relation to three application areas: Sustainable Chemicals, Natural Products, and Microbial Foods.

Technology for people

DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN‚Äôs 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian √òrsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.
Show more

Title: Full Stack Developer - Shape the future of defence software training technology
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a full stack developer with skills in Java and Angular, with +2 years of experience, looking to contribute to the defence domain? Then go ahead and read more about this opportunity at Systematic

The position‚ÄØ
At Systematic, we are expanding our Defence software team in Copenhagen and are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join the team in Copenhagen to contribute to SitaWare Aspire ‚Äì our next-generation training platform designed for modern Defence operations.‚ÄØ

Joining as our new Full Stack Developer, reporting to our Project Manager for Aspire in Copenhagen your primary responsibility will be contributing to feature development, development and implementation of new feature design ‚Äì all in order to enhance user learning outcomes. As this is a newly established team at our hub in Copenhagen, you will have a great opportunity to make your mark on the product, contribute and establish team culture and shape the team together with your colleagues.

In short, you can look forward to:


Designing and implementing high-quality integrations
Drive design, discuss and implement solutions for new features,
Implementing new custom-requested functionalities or features
Implementing best practices and finding optimum solutions together with the rest of the team



Last but not least, we want to enhance our focus on DevOps, looking into automation by extending our build and deployment pipeline and support the SaaS solution.

Join the Aspire team in Copenhagen
We are growing our department with a new team in Copenhagen. Hence, you will join a growing Defence business unit, where we develop software that support critical decision-making when it matters the most.

We would like to offer you the following:


Meaningful mission ‚Äì Contribute to Defence tech that enhances real-world operational readiness‚ÄØ
Strategic role ‚Äì You will be part of shaping the architecture and practices of a fast-growing platform‚ÄØ
Central Copenhagen office ‚Äì Join our new team in a modern office just steps away from everything the city has to offer as well as public transportation
Strong foundation, startup feel ‚Äì Aspire is our youngest Defence product with strong adoption and more to come‚ÄØ
International, collaborative culture ‚Äì Work alongside skilled teams in Aarhus, Bucharest, and beyond‚ÄØ



Your Qualifications‚ÄØ
Beyond your experience ‚Äì that you see below ‚Äì we like to put emphasis on who you are as a person. We hope to meet someone who is able to communicate well and would like to share your thoughts and ideas while at the same time contribute to a strong team culture in the new team in Copenhagen.

Bachelors or Masters degree within Software Engineering or related field
+2 years of experience from a similar full time position
Java/Kotlin and Spring‚ÄØ
Build/deployment pipelines‚ÄØ
Experience with Azure or other cloud provider platforms‚ÄØ



Furthermore, experience with Angular, Typescript, scripting in Bash/PowerShell, DevOps, building and deploying services, relational databases and Keycloak‚ÄØas well as deployment automation is beneficial.

‚ÄØPlease note‚ÄØthat you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more‚ÄØhere.‚ÄØ

Welcome to Systematic Copenhagen
When you join us in Copenhagen, you're not just getting a desk at one of the city‚Äôs best locations‚Äîyou‚Äôre stepping into a workplace where community matters. Our Employees Club keeps things lively with monthly social events, and our office catering makes sure you‚Äôre always well taken care of. Whether you‚Äôre into casual games or just good company, you‚Äôll find both at our foosball table or during our relaxed Friday bar gatherings.

Never stop developing
Systematic is uniquely people-centric, truly international and proudly rooted in Denmark with more than 1100 employees. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.‚ÄØ

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen, Senior TA Consultant

Get in touch

Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Backend Goland Developer for venture-funded MLaaS solution
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With the recent advancements in AI and machine learning, it‚Äôs no surprise that the fastest growing occupation over the next five years will be software roles related to ML and AI.




The roughly 1 million new ML practitioners will face the same challenges that current ML practitioners do: to schedule ML jobs, you must not only be a strong ML engineer or data scientist but also be proficient in infrastructure setup, code packaging, virtual environments, and data engineering‚Äîall at once.




The stats speak for themselves:




58% of ML practitioners spend up to 20 hours per month on environment setup alone
93% report that AI team productivity would increase if real-time compute resources could be self-served easily
74% see clear value in having compute and scheduling functionality as part of a single, unified AI/ML platform




Mimiry is changing how ML is accessed today. Our platform makes it easier than ever to launch ML jobs. Utilizing a mix of cloud technologies and distributed ML, users can start training with the click of a button and access advanced machine learning capabilities -¬†without needing substantial in-house mastery or infrastructure.




We take you from code to compute in minutes.




You are




A solid back-end developer with experience in several of the following areas: Cloud/SaaS development/architecture, Cloud infrastructure/DevOps, and machine learning
You hold a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or another relevant major
You like to work in a dynamic environment where the focus is on the product (what we make) and where team performance is what counts
You have an opinion, you are open-minded, and you like to cooperate on collectively finding the best-suited solutions
You have a burning passion for being part of a deep-tech start-up on the forefront of technological innovation. That means being comfortable starting in a small team with the potential for rapid growth




Technical Requirements




You have experience with most of the following

Golang (Phyton, Javascript/Typescript is a big plus)
Implementing APIs (RESTful and/or GraphQL)
Event Driven Development/Design/Architecture
Cloud Security
Kubernetes
Microservices/(event-)functions
Docker/Contained




It is much appreciated if you have experience with




KEDA
Dapr
Redis
MongoDB
Kafka
OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Tempo
Schema standards, like OpenAPI or Avro
Open Source (using and/or contributing)
Front-end frameworks like Angular, React, Next, Vue, or Svelte‚Ä¶




We offer




The opportunity to work on innovative solutions with both a domain and the tech being most relevant for the future developer role
One of the best office spaces in Copenhagen, at Bloxhub, next to the canals
Fully flexible work options with remote, hybrid, and in-office solutions
An ambitious team that truly wants to make an impact
Industry-standard salary and the possibility of stock option intensives




For more information or questions please contact us at¬†martin.vang@mimiry.com
