Title: Student Data Scientist
Description:
Join a data-driven team focused on automation, analysis, and onboarding of financial clients.

Are you currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in computer science, mathematics, economics, or something similar ‚Äì and passionate about data, automation, and hands-on analysis? Then we have an exciting student position waiting for you in our Data Services & Automation team and we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Why Aleta?

Aleta is a fast-moving fintech company that empowers family offices, wealth managers, and advisors with a holistic wealth overview and unparalleled insights in a next-generation wealth platform.




By bringing all investment data into one place and offering advanced AI-powered analytics tools, our platform enables users to seize control and turbocharge their productivity.




We‚Äôre a tight-knit team of specialists in finance and software development, working in a dynamic and collaborative environment. We love taking initiative, hosting social events, and fostering a team culture where ideas thrive and innovation is encouraged.




What you‚Äôll be doing ‚≠ê

Our team works with complex data structures, automation of manual processes, and supports onboarding of new clients to our platform ‚Äì often in close collaboration with both developers and business stakeholders.




As our new Student Data Scientist, you‚Äôll become an integral part of the team and work with tasks like:

Analyzing transaction data and validating data quality.
Developing smaller automation tools and data models.
Developing and implementing scripts for onboarding flows and client reporting.
Supporting operations and troubleshooting data flows.
Contributing to documentation and systematization of solutions.
Assisting with development of ML-based tools or data mapping.

You‚Äôll work on real tasks that create real value for both clients and internal operations ‚Äì and you‚Äôll get professional sparring from experienced colleagues with both technical and financial backgrounds.




What we‚Äôre looking for üéØ

You‚Äôre probably a great match if you:

Are currently studying a relevant master‚Äôs program (e.g., computer science, data science, math-econ, etc.).
Have solid skills in SQL and Python ‚Äî and ideally some experience with Power BI or similar.
Are analytical, detail-oriented, and care about data quality.
Have an interest in finance and investment (no need to be an expert ‚Äì curiosity goes a long way).
Are proactive, self-driven, and enjoy working in a team that values collaboration and high standards.




What we offer üéÅ

A study-relevant part-time job (approx. 15-20 hours/week) with flexibility around exam periods.
The chance to gain practical experience with data work on a scalable fintech platform.
A key role in a high-impact, cross-functional team.
A steep learning curve and plenty of room to grow your skills in a real-world setting.
The opportunity to grow in the role ‚Äì potentially joining development or operations projects over time.




Sounds like you? üöÄ

If you‚Äôre excited about joining a bunch of passionate nerds who are building the future of wealth management software, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




We‚Äôll be conducting interviews on a rolling basis.

Title: Back End Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior PHP Backend Developer

At JOE & THE JUICE, we‚Äôre more than just great coffee, juice, and sandwiches ‚Äì and that‚Äôs where you come in. With an in-house ERP system, mobile app, and multiple websites for both internal and external use, we‚Äôre constantly working to create seamless integrations between our internal systems and external suppliers.




We are on the lookout for a talented and driven **Senior Backend Developer (PHP)** to join our dynamic team. If you‚Äôre passionate about coding and enjoy building efficient, scalable solutions, this is the opportunity you‚Äôve been waiting for!




Key Technologies

PHP (Phalcon/Symfony Framework)
Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
API Platform
MySQL, with expertise in MySQL queries
Doctrine (PHP)
Docker
PHP Unit Testing
Queues and Jobs
REST APIs




Bonus: Frontend Experience

TypeScript
React
Redux
MUI (Material-UI)
Cypress




You‚Äôll be working with these technologies (and more) to develop applications for internal use, helping us continuously improve and innovate.




Key Qualifications

Experience implementing RESTful APIs in PHP
Ability to write clean, testable code
Familiarity with modern frontend development to occasionally assist with frontend tasks, though your primary focus will be backend development




The Benefits

We offer a benefits package that includes a progressively increasing paid pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-benefits:




Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 130+ employees.
Our office facilities include a fully staffed Joe & the Juice bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice and barista coffee.
Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
In Joe we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
You will have a BTC (Behind the Counter) shift in one of our bars twice a year.
Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings and Friday bars.
Coming: Fitness facilities where you will be able to do your daily workouts and filled with all equipped you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible 4 showers with complimentary towels as well as a steam room.







The Process

If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Apply today and join us in creating innovative solutions at JOE & THE JUICE!




#Hiring #PHPDeveloper #Symfony #OOP #APIs #MySQL #TechJobs #DeveloperJobs #JobOpening #Careers




We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible and will conduct interviews ongoingly. We will only consider applications through Easy Apply.

If you have any questions, please direct them to the Engineering Manager, Qutub Uddin Ahmed, at qutub@joejuice.com







Read how JOE & THE JUICE ("We," "Us") handles your personal data when you engage with us during the recruitment process here: https://www.joejuice.com/policy/recruitment-privacy-notice

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Join BESTSELLER TECH and Shape the Future of Fashion with Scalable AI!

Do you want to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI research and real-world impact?

We‚Äôre looking for an MLOps Engineer to help us deploy and maintain robust, scalable machine learning systems that drive critical planning decisions across our global fashion business.

YOUR TEAM

You will be part of BESTSELLER TECH‚Äôs AI Fashion Planning team ‚Äì a cross-functional product team of data scientists, product owners, and engineers working together to develop innovative solutions for demand forecasting, allocation, and replenishment. Our AI models support planners across BESTSELLER‚Äôs global fashion business, ensuring the right products reach the right stores at the right time.

YOUR ROLE

As an MLOps Engineer, your mission is to take our machine learning models from prototype to production, ensuring they‚Äôre reliable, scalable, and deliver real business value. You will work closely with data scientists to build reusable pipelines, automate model lifecycle management, and set up monitoring to track model health over time.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Designing and implementing CI/CD workflows, (especially GitHub Actions) and deployment strategies for ML models.
Maintaining and improving our MLOps infrastructure built on Databricks and Azure.
Ensuring robust monitoring, versioning, and logging of data, features, and models.
Ensuring reproducibility, scalability, and performance of our ML services.
Setting up automated testing and model validation pipelines to ensure production quality.
Driving best practices in MLOps across the AI department through shared tooling and documentation.


Your Benefits


Join one of the world‚Äôs leading fast fashion companies and help build the future of AI-powered fashion planning.
Work in a modern MLOps setup using Databricks, Unity Catalog, MLflow, and infrastructure-as-code tools.
Collaborate with passionate, skilled colleagues across data science, engineering, and product disciplines.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to influence the future direction of AI at BESTSELLER


YOUR PROFILE

You are an experienced MLOps Engineer or a software/data engineer with strong DevOps skills and a passion for building production-ready ML systems. You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy translating experimental code into scalable services.

We expect you to bring:


Solid hands-on experience with Databricks, Azure, MLflow, and modern data engineering tools.
Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, PyTorch, XGBoost).
Strong understanding of CI/CD for ML, version control, containerization (Docker), and orchestration tools.
Familiarity with the concepts of the medallion architecture, feature stores, and model monitoring.
A proactive mindset with a drive to improve systems and processes.
2-4 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Fluent in English, both verbal and written.


CURIOUS FOR MORE?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send your application and CV as soon as possible, and no later than May 29 2025.We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidate.

Work location: Aarhus, Denmark

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there‚Äôs more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We‚Äôre democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels‚Äîa privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We‚Äôre a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product‚Äîand having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a skilled Senior Software Engineer to join our product team focused on empowering coaches and players with the tools and insights to level up their team and individual performance. Whether it's designing seamless user experiences, leveraging edge AI to craft the optimal solution or building scalable systems, your work will touch the sports community worldwide.

What You Will Do


Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to deliver products that empower coaches, players, and their supporters, and meet business goals
Contribute to the full product lifecycle‚Äîideation, development, deployment, and monitoring‚Äîwhile leveraging customer feedback loops to iteratively refine and improve products
Ensure high performance, security, and scalability across all aspects of the software
Leverage and enhance Veo‚Äôs design system to create intuitive user experiences
Participate in technical discussions, reviews, and decisions to shape Veo‚Äôs technology landscape




What You Could Bring


5+ years of experience in software engineering, in a high growth environment
A collaborative spirit, working well with others to reach shared goals
A drive for building products that solve real problems and bring value to users
A growth mindset, focused on continuous improvement and learning
A problem-solving mindset and clear understanding of what good looks like when it comes to building and operating large-scale systems.
An eye for architecture: you can discuss the tradeoff between architectural choices, both on a theoretical level and on an applied level
An appreciation for clean, maintainable code and best practices
Proficiency in both backend (e.g., Python, typescript, Node.js ‚Ä¶ and with ability to pick up new ones) and frontend (e.g. React) technologies
Experience with testing practices, including unit testing, integration testing, and implementing CI/CD pipelines
Interest in coaching others and supporting their growth as engineers
Comprehensive verbal and written English communication skills




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology ‚Äì with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Values we hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn‚Äôt completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.

Title: Front-End Developer Expertise for AI Training
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you a world-class front-end developer or web designer who wants to help shape the future of AI?

We collaborate with leading AI organizations to train large language models‚Äîteaching them how to design and code like the best front-end engineers and designers in the world. Our projects focus on helping generative AI improve its understanding of front-end technologies, UI/UX principles, and modern web standards.

This is a rare opportunity to put your coding and design skills to work in training cutting-edge AI systems‚Äîno prior experience with AI is required.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for exceptional front-end developers and designers to help train generative AI models.
This freelance role is fully remote and offers flexible hours‚Äîyou can work whenever works best for you.


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Creating and answering questions about front-end development and web design to help train AI models
Reviewing and evaluating code generated by AI in JavaScript, React, and other modern front-end frameworks
Assessing UI/UX quality, accessibility, and design choices made by AI-generated code
Offering expert-level feedback on what makes a user interface intuitive, functional, and beautiful


We‚Äôre looking for people with‚Ä¶


Strong technical skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React, Next.js, Vue, or similar
An eye for world-class design‚Äîdeep understanding of UI/UX principles, responsive design, and interaction patterns
Experience building polished, accessible, and production-ready web interfaces
A background in computer science, web development, or digital design (degree not required if experience is exceptional)
Outstanding attention to detail and ability to communicate clearly about visual and code quality


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work are up to USD $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more
HTML:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Generate prompts that challenge AI
  • Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
  • Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
  • Code review experience is a must
  • Experience with AI projects is a plus
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue‚Äîand now, no powerful AI without a robust platform. We need you to help us shape both.

Doctors and nurses are facing immense pressure: growing administrative burdens, tighter resources, and the risk of burnout. They deserve tools that restore their focus on care, not paperwork. Corti began by building the world‚Äôs leading AI assistant for healthcare, supporting clinicians in real time by listening, documenting, prompting, and safeguarding critical conversations.

Now, we‚Äôre opening up that intelligence through our API platform‚Äîenabling developers, partners, and providers to build with Corti‚Äôs AI in their own tools and workflows. From ambient scribing to clinical decision support, our infrastructure is unlocking new ways to scale healthcare excellence.

Entire health systems trust Corti. Millions of patient interactions have already been improved by our AI. With your help, we‚Äôll reach millions more.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

üìå As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti‚Äôs domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!
Show more

Title: Data & AI Engineer, Aarhus DK üìå
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about developing large enterprise solutions with the latest technology? Do you want to implement large cloud-based solutions in Microsoft Azure?

üìç Location: Ballerup, Aarhus

As a data engineer, you will develop and implement Azure-based solutions that improve data integration, data quality, and data flow to support business processes and strategies. You will be a key part of our projects from start to finish and contribute to decisions regarding technology selection that meets customer needs.

Your role

Responsibilities

In this role, you will help customers achieve their data and analytics strategy by setting up robust data warehouse and reporting solutions for processes such as finance, logistics, sales, manufacturing, projects and more. You will collaborate with developers, customers and business consultants to implement solutions on Azure. You will have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services and the Power BI Premium platform. A senior data engineer has extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data warehouses, ETL tools, SQL, APIs and data modeling. You understand complex requirements and thrive when transforming these into robust data flows and structured views with high data quality and where future changes can be easily implemented. In this role, you will manage how decisions within each area affect the overall solution. Responsibilities will include:


Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a variety of processes
Building the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a variety of sources
Write good, clean and efficient code
Use new technology like Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more
Create fast and accurate data models


Why is this a great job opportunity?

We focus on the latest trends in the market and Microsoft technology to ensure that we match the customer's needs to develop their own business with our technological insight. This means that you will work with the latest solutions for a future in the cloud. We want a lifelong customer relationship and work together with exciting companies, both locally and internationally. We are committed to following standards so that the solutions we deliver have a long life and are easy to develop as the customer's needs change.

Qualifications

Just like us, you are passionate about making the world more data-driven based on the latest technologies and methods.

To be successful in the role, we see that you have:


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud (AWS or Azure)
Experience with ETL processes, data warehousing and data modeling
Very good skills and experience with SQL
Speaks fluent Danish and English
Experience with developing SSIS, SSAS and Power BI and preferably Microsoft ERP
Proficiency in programming languages as Python, Java or Scala
Danish residency


Why become part of Columbus?

At Columbus, we care about each other as much as we care about our business. Therefore, we offer:


Not just a job, but a career:‚ÄØYou will have access to a varied training program, including online and physical courses, to accelerate your career development and support your personal and professional growth
Belonging:‚ÄØAt Columbus, we value teamwork and have a good collaborative environment. You will be part of a company where your colleagues have deep industry insight and a strong understanding of our customers' needs
Work-life Balance:‚ÄØThe well-being of our employees is a priority. We want you to be the best version of yourself at work, so we offer high flexibility to shape your own workday
Global Impact:‚ÄØYou will be part of a local and global team that is at the forefront of industry trends, with opportunities to influence and improve our service offerings on an international level


Become a part of Columbus!

You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV via the link. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Columbus

At Columbus, you‚Äôll be joining a global IT consulting company with over 1,600 dedicated professionals. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, present in 7 countries helping 1,100 customers securing their future by driving growth through data-driven insights and creating seamless digital experiences.

With our broad industry experience in both B2B and complex B2C, we stand out as the leading digital sales partner in the Nordic region. You‚Äôll be part of a team that designs and implements top-tier, industry-specific solutions, unleashing the full potential of our customers' digital businesses.

We believe in Digital transformation for a better tomorrow, where we also commit to drive positive social and environmental change on a global scale!

www.columbusglobal.com

Work at Columbus

Curious about life at Columbus? Check out our Instagram or LinkedIn feed to see our team in action, get insights into our culture, and discover what makes Columbus a great place to work!


Show more

Title: Principal Development Scientist - Research & Development, applied
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Principal Development Scientist

We are seeking a talented and motivated Scientist to join our team. The successful candidate will focus on developing biosolutions for a range of applications (Fresh Dairy, Plant Based Dairy Alternatives etc.) by combining different bacterial strains into fermentation cultures.

This role requires a strong foundation in microbiology, biochemistry, and food science, complemented by a passion for data analysis and working with data models. Additionally, an analytical mindset and a problem-solving approach are essential for tackling challenges effectively.

Welcome to Combinatorial Microbiology

You will become a part of the Combinatorial Microbiology department which is anchored within the Applied R&D Dairy and Dairy Alternatives organization. Our department plays an important role in both short and long-term new product development projects.

We develop fermentation cultures (biosolutions) for a wide range of applications including fresh dairy, and dairy alternatives by using a combinatorial microbiology approach. We translate market needs into biosolutions through combinations of microorganisms and enzymes using digital tools supported by application relevant model systems.

The department is composed of 36 highly skilled scientists and technicians who are distributed in four teams with different areas of responsibility. Furthermore, the department has a strong focus on developing laboratory methods in micro, small and medium scale, digital competences, and skills in general that are essential to develop the biosolutions of the future. We are now searching for a Principal Senior Development Scientist to focus on developing biosolutions for fermented food products (e.g., yogurt, cheese etc.).

How You‚Äôll Make An Impact

Designing and developing cultures for a wide range of fermented dairy products such as yogurts as part of our innovative biosolutions portfolio. Your expertise will be part of solving the latest challenges in the industry and drive the creation of biosolutions for our customers that are more effective, efficient, and sustainable. You will explore the synergistic effects of different microbial cultures and discover new ways to enhance product performance and drive innovation in the industry.

In This Pivotal Role, You Will


Revolutionize Fresh Dairy Fermented Products:‚ÄØDesign and develop microbial cultures for fresh dairy taking our‚ÄØbiosolutions portfolio‚ÄØto the next level. Your work will address the latest challenges in the industry, helping to create more efficient, effective, and sustainable products for our fresh dairy customers.
Explore Synergies:‚ÄØUnlock the potential of microbial interactions by exploring the synergistic effects of various bacterial strains, enhancing product performance and driving innovation.
Shape the Future of Biosolutions:‚ÄØContribute to the development of strategic roadmaps for combinatorial microbiology, guiding the integration of predictive models and data-driven insights into our innovation pipeline.


Key Responsibilities


Develop Cutting-Edge Cultures:‚ÄØCreate microbial cultures with combined functionalities to enhanceproperties such as acidification, texture, and flavor across diverse applications.
Design Experiments with Purpose:‚ÄØPlan, execute, and report experimental work using‚ÄØadvanced Design of Experiments (DoE)‚ÄØmethodologies to optimize culture performance, and related processes.
Apply Predictive Analytics:‚ÄØUse data-driven models and chemometric techniques to tailor microbial functionalities and improve product outcomes with precision.
Build High-Throughput Models:‚ÄØDevelop and validate high-throughput systems that mimic industrial applications, integrating statistical and computational tools to boost predictive accuracy.
Drive computational assisted Microbiology:‚ÄØChampion the use of combinatorial microbiology by integrating predictive analytics into departmental workflows.
Shape Strategic Direction:‚ÄØDefine objectives and roadmaps for combinatorial microbiology, aligning innovation with long-term business goals..


What We‚Äôre Looking For


A Ph.D. or Master‚Äôs degree in‚ÄØMicrobiology,‚ÄØBiochemistry,‚ÄØFood Science, or a related field, along with relevant industry or academic experience.
Proven Expertise in‚ÄØfermentation,‚ÄØexperimental design (DoE), and‚ÄØstatistical modeling.
Proficiency in applying‚ÄØdata analytics, chemometric techniques‚ÄØ(e.g. PCA, PLS) or other computational tools to solve scientific challenges.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to tackling technical challenges.
Excellent collaboration and communication abilities to work effectively across multidisciplinary teams and share knowledge clearly.


We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible

Application deadline: 1 June 2025

Location: H√∏rsholm

Contact details: Department Manager Denise Felix Da Silva - defe@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to spearhead the maturity and continuous development of our Kubernetes platform? Do you aspire to become key enabler in a team that is uniquely positioned to advance the future of Kamstrup‚Äôs cloud-native journey? Are you motivated by running cross-collaborative projects and looking for a role where your contributions have a direct impact on the company's success?

Here Is What The Job Entails

As our new Platform Engineer, your main responsibility will be to oversee the governance, capacity management, and operation of our Kubernetes platform based on the needs of our developers. Your focus will be on simplifying workflows for Kamstrup developers, enabling them to create and deploy high-quality software more effectively

More specifically, you will be:


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to optimize platform performance and reliability
Continuously evaluating our platform roadmap and adopting new technologies to improve our platform
Maintaining processes to ensure continuous deployment, vulnerability mitigation, disaster-recovery control, FinOps, and compliance
Acting as a valued advisor, providing support and guidance to our consumers and mapping requirements



In this role, you will have the freedom to act, as you will play a key role in elevating the developer experience and enabling them to reduce time to market. You will drive and have the opportunity to explore and deep dive into new technologies as we strive to stay at the technological forefront.

Meet your future team

With direct reference to our Head of Cloud and Platform Engineering, you will join a team of 9 skilled colleagues, consisting of IT Architects, Platform Engineers, DevOps Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our team is the backbone of our digital transformation journey, focusing on modern and microservices architecture. We are a growing and motivated team responsible for providing platforms for our development teams and enhancing the developer experience. Our team values transparency, high ambitions, good collegiality, diversity, knowledge sharing, and sparring.

Did you know? We deeply enjoy discussing technologies, so we frequently organize hackathons. Additionally, we share a common passion for cakes, which is why almost all our team meetings start with cake

Less About Us, More About You

We are looking for a proactive Platform Engineer who is driven by acting as the liaison between vendor products and internal developer requirements. Your natural curiosity leads you to seek new challenges, in which you secure a balanced mix between new and existing frameworks, allowing you to translate your insights into achievable solutions

In order to succeed, we imagine that you:


Have 5+ years of experience designing, deploying, and managing Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters
Have experience with Docker/Kubernetes, GitLab, CICD frameworks, and pipeline deployments
Are proficient with DevOps tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, GitHub Enterprise, and other CNCF-related tools
Have working knowledge of Role-Based Access Control, authentication, and authorization mechanisms
Have experience with Azure cloud resource setup and management



As we are an international organization it is important that you are fluent in English.

We want to support a diverse and inclusive workplace, so while you may not meet all the qualifications listed above, you could still be a good candidate for the position. If you find the role intriguing, do not hesitate to apply.

We are more than an ordinary workplace

We cherish the good colleagueship which we all contribute to, the only limit is your engagement. As we are a big organization you are bound to find one or more colleagues who share the same interest as you. This might be in our board game club, on our cycling team, during our yearly summer festival, or on the padel court. For example, our Team lead, Service Delivery is also our volunteer padel instructor while one of our Software Test Engineers run weekly spinning classes.

Besides the best colleagues you could imagine, we also offer:


Work life balance through flexible working hours
Employee benefits including a healthy canteen, fitness facilities, in-house dental clinic, hairdresser, and a free health clinic
An active employee association that fosters a collaborative and supportive workplace community
Beneficial health care and insurance package



Do you want to be a part of Kamstrup?

Please submit your application by using the link below. Applications are reviewed on a continuous basis, and you can expect a response within six weeks.

The job will be located at Kamstrup's headquarters in Stilling, between Aarhus and Skanderborg.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Head of EA, Infrastructure & Platforms, Anushree Pandey on phone: +45 89 93 10 00.

Get to know us

At Kamstrup, you'll become part of a close-knit community that genuinely cares about one another, fostering connections both in and out of the workplace. Our team comprises innovators, dreamers, and doers, united by an unyielding passion to challenge the status quo, find better solutions, and constantly push the boundaries of what's possible all with the purpose of securing clean water and energy to the maximum number of people. With an unwavering commitment to growth, we offer opportunities for you to leverage your skills and drive our business to new heights, empowering you to leave your mark on our future and grow with us.

Explore more on our website, see our annual report, and stay updated through LinkedIn for the latest news and job openings.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
üíª Role: Senior AI Engineer / Data Scientist

üåç Location: Remote, EU-based

üí∞ Salary: ‚Ç¨80,000 to ‚Ç¨120,000 + Equity

üõ† Key Skills: Python, AWS, LLMs/NLP, Vector DBs, Recommender Systems




A fast-growing technology company is seeking a skilled Senior AI Engineer to help build innovative AI solutions, including AI-driven agents and recommender systems. The role offers full ownership across the stack, from design and model development to deployment and iteration, and the opportunity to work with complex, large-scale data inputs.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and improve recommender systems.
Design and build AI agents with decision-making capabilities.
Create clustering models to extract insights from B2B datasets.
Work with diverse data sources and implement efficient pre-processing pipelines.
Optimise models for real-time applications and large-scale deployment.
Integrate AI models into production systems.
Maintain and enhance existing systems and support reliability efforts.
Deliver ad-hoc data analyses and actionable insights for the business.




Required Skills and Experience:

10+ years' professional experience in machine learning and AI.
Hands-on experience deploying ML models and LLM-based products to production.
Proficient in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks such as langchain/langgraph.
Strong background in data analysis, model performance evaluation, and cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS).
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, pgVector).




Preferred Profile:

Previous experience in a start-up environment.
Collaborative mindset, comfortable working with engineering, product, and design teams.
Practical approach to continuous improvement rather than perfectionism.
Bonus: experience in SalesTech.




Offer:

Competitive salary (‚Ç¨80,000‚Äì‚Ç¨120,000) plus equity (‚Ç¨10,000‚Äì‚Ç¨20,000).
Equipment allowance (‚Ç¨3,000 per year).
Permanent employment or B2B contracting option.
Fully remote role within the European Union.

Title: Research Engineer, Applied AI
Description:
As a research engineer you will work on improving kapa‚Äôs ability to answer harder and harder technical questions. Check out Docker‚Äôs documentation for a live example of what kapa is (look for the ‚ÄúAsk AI‚Äù button).

In This Role, You Will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Work on and do research in state-of-the-art retrieval and search techniques.
Work on and deploy machine learning models as part of RAG.
Continuously improve our quality evaluation frameworks to enable robust iteration.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.
Design and run experiments.


In addition to the founding team, you'll have support from a number of leading academics in the field that are all close advisors (incl. Douwe Kiela, author of the original RAG paper).

You May Be a Good Fit If You Have


A Master's/ PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
A detailed understanding of machine learning, deep learning (including LLMs) and natural language processing.
Hands-on experience in training, fine-tuning and deploying large language models.
Have prior experience working with vector databases, search indices, or other data stores for search and retrieval use cases.
Significant experience building evaluation systems for LLMs or search.
Familiarity with various information retrieval techniques, such as lexical search and dense vector search.
The ability to work effectively in a fast in a environment where things are sometimes loosely defined.
Want to learn more about machine learning research.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary set of attributes. Even if none of these apply to you, but you believe you will contribute to kapa.ai, please reach out.

Title: App Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what‚Äôs possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

KAUZA and Kantar's Worldpanel team (the folks who analyze what people buy) are hiring an App Developer based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The Goal

They're building a new platform to give their clients much better and faster insights into consumer shopping habits. Your main job will be to help get this platform launched and then make it work globally.

Role Overview: We are looking for a talented React Native Developer to join our team. You will work closely with pentesters and tools engineers to ensure the app is both secure and insightful, while also driving long-term user engagement.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain features such as personalized insights and visualizations of spending habits.
Implement secure and smooth login/onboarding experiences.
Create gamification and streak tracking features.
Develop smart product suggestions and reminders.
Build budgeting tools and progress dashboards.
Implement push notifications and local alerts.
Create lightweight social and sharing features.
Develop in-store quick-log and barcode scanning tools.


What We're Looking For


Full Professional English Proficiency (C1 Level minimum required).
Strong experience in React Native and the Expo ecosystem (iOS & Android).
Familiarity with authentication flows (OAuth, biometrics, token storage).
Experience building data-driven UIs and interactive dashboards.
Comfort with state management (e.g., Redux, Zustand, Jotai).
Good grasp of TypeScript and component architecture.
Experience with local storage solutions (e.g., MMKV, SQLite, or Firestore).
Familiarity with analytics, retention metrics, and push notification systems.
Ability to collaborate effectively with backend, security, and UX teammates.
Bonus: Experience with mobile security, barcode scanning (e.g., ML Kit or react-native-camera), or gamification mechanics.


What You‚Äôll Get From Us


30 days annual leave
Hybrid & Flexible work schedule
Private Medical Insurance.
Flexible benefits across health, wealth, and lifestyle.


About Us

Kauza ApS is a consulting company based in Copenhagen that provides fact-based advisory and shopper insights to players in the FMCG industry in the Nordic market. Kauza‚Äôs services are delivered in innovative dashboard solutions powered by cloud technology and machine learning, ensuring that they meet the clients‚Äô key business questions with the right mix of data accessibility and data usability, making it possible to deliver shopper behavior and purchase data in rear real time.

Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies. Kantar‚Äôs 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar. We provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.

We have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to encourage new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that‚Äôs out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to build an equality of opportunity in a fair and encouraging working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well-being is taken into consideration.

We want to build a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Privacy and Legal Statement

PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (‚ÄúKantar‚Äù). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Country

Denmark

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Trust)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way‚Äîbut there‚Äôs still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

A core value proposition of Trustpilot is Trust. We work hard to ensure our platform has real content from real people with real experiences. That means eliminating fraudulent reviews and sanctioning suspect behaviour to keep our platform authentic. Our Trust Data Science team aims to be an established name in the use of advanced modelling to safeguard the integrity of online reviews, and we have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust where Data Science is integral to achieving our goals.

We are seeking a skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our Trust team in our mission. You and your team will work within a focus area to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative models at scale, alongside a cross-functional team of software developers, product managers, ML engineers, and designers. You will have the opportunity to collaborate widely across the business, including with those in our Legal, Platform Engineering, and Data Science teams within Consumer, B2B, and Commercial.

You will have prior experience in developing and deploying ML models to succeed in this role. You have a solid technical background and are already an accomplished Data Scientist in your field, with hands-on ability in all stages of modelling from concept through to production. You have an adaptable mindset and advanced knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. Experience working in an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you already have experience with fraud detection algorithms for an online platform.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Be directly engaged in delivering the Data Science component of key strategic projects for our Trust initiatives, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modelling and anomaly detection to identify spurious patterns.
Own, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers, and analyse data to set the direction of what we should build next, and why
Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
This role provides an opportunity to contribute positively to our business through the integration of innovative Data Science approaches.
The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies, including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace.


Who You Are


Experience with analytical and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques, machine learning, and deep learning methods, e.g. sequence modelling, classification, generative tasks, anomaly detection, etc. Experience with graph techniques and graph neural networks is considered a bonus.
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP, but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modelling, and scripting.
Experience in working with large datasets from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioural data and detecting misbehaviour at scale.
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments.
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
Technical experience in a Data Science role, typically in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It‚Äôs complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We‚Äôre excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don‚Äôt feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever ‚Äî to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial ‚Äî we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we‚Äôre headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We‚Äôre driven by connection. It‚Äôs at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh ‚Äì‚Äì it‚Äôs built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way‚Äîbut there‚Äôs still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

A core value proposition of Trustpilot is Trust. We work hard to ensure our platform has real content from real people with real experiences. That means eliminating fraudulent reviews and sanctioning suspect behaviour to keep our platform authentic. Our Trust Data Science team aims to be an established name in the use of advanced modelling to safeguard the integrity of online reviews, and we have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust where Data Science is integral to achieving our goals.

We are seeking a skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our Trust team in our mission. You and your team will work within a focus area to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative models at scale, alongside a cross-functional team of software developers, product managers, ML engineers, and designers. You will have the opportunity to collaborate widely across the business, including with those in our Legal, Platform Engineering, and Data Science teams within Consumer, B2B, and Commercial.

You will have prior experience in developing and deploying ML models to succeed in this role. You have a solid technical background and are already an accomplished Data Scientist in your field, with hands-on ability in all stages of modelling from concept through to production. You have an adaptable mindset and advanced knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. Experience working in an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you already have experience with fraud detection algorithms for an online platform.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Be directly engaged in delivering the Data Science component of key strategic projects for our Trust initiatives, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modelling and anomaly detection to identify spurious patterns.
  • Own, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers, and analyse data to set the direction of what we should build next, and why
  • Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
  • This role provides an opportunity to contribute positively to our business through the integration of innovative Data Science approaches.
  • The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies, including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
  • Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace.

Who You Are

  • Experience with analytical and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques, machine learning, and deep learning methods, e.g. sequence modelling, classification, generative tasks, anomaly detection, etc. Experience with graph techniques and graph neural networks is considered a bonus.
  • Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP, but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
  • Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modelling, and scripting.
  • Experience in working with large datasets from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioural data and detecting misbehaviour at scale.
  • Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments.
  • Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
  • Technical experience in a Data Science role, typically in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.

  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops

Title: Software Architect
Description:
mpeople is hiring on behalf of Systematic to find a skilled Software Architect for their Mobile Program.

This is your chance to develop next-generation mobile defense products that save lives. The software supports military and disaster relief operations, integrating with sensors and drones to provide real-time situational awareness.




Your Role

As a Software Architect, you‚Äôll join a skilled Scrum team and help shape the technical direction of the product alongside the Program Architect.

You'll ensure new features meet high standards for usability, security, scalability, and performance while guiding your team through development.

You‚Äôll also collaborate with project managers to improve efficiency and code quality.




Competences on our radar

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in software engineering with 2+ years as a software lead or similar.
Strong skills in Java, Angular, and TypeScript; experience with Docker & Kubernetes is a plus. Familiarity with Windows, Android, and Linux platforms.
Architectural certification is an advantage but not required.
Fluent in English (oral & written).




Must have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past 7 years and be able to present a clean criminal record.




Why Join?

At Systematic, you'll work on cutting-edge software solutions that make a real impact. Expect an engaging work culture, a strong Employee Club, a top-tier canteen, and benefits like paid home internet, health insurance, and a pension scheme. Plus, enjoy a friendly game of padel at their Aarhus headquarters!




Interested?

If you wish to hear more about the job, please contact Susanne Plykker at sup@mpeople.dk. Applications are only processed via the application link.

The position will be filled in as soon as possible, therefore interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

Apply now through mpeople! press Apply

Bidrage aktivt til teamets DevOps-setup og vores teknologiske retning

V√¶re med til at s√¶tte retning og udvikle teamets arbejdsformer

Interesse for DevOps og at arbejde med drift og udvikling i samme team
Et √∏je for kvalitet og evnen til at t√¶nke i helheder
Lyst til at tage ansvar og bidrage aktivt til teamet



Hvad tilbyder vi?


Opgaver med direkte indflydelse p√• brugeroplevelsen i mobil- og netbank
Et erfarent og fagligt st√¶rkt team med h√∏j trivsel og samarbejde
Udviklingsmuligheder gennem kurser, guilds og l√∏bende sparring

Send os dit CV allerede i dag via nedenst√•ende link. Tiltr√¶delse er snarest muligt ‚Äì vi indkalder l√∏bende til samtaler. Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Nikolas Bram, leder for Team Native Tech, p√• nbm@bankdata.dk eller +45 24770158.

Velkommen til Bankdata

Bankdata bygger software til finanssektoren. Vi er n√¶sten 1000 kolleger p√• holdet, og vi udvikler digitale produkter, platforme og infrastruktur, som ca. hver tredje dansker, 200.000 virksomheder og flere tusinde bankansatte bruger hver dag.

Vi tror p√• struktureret personlig udvikling, et st√¶rkt kollegialt f√¶llesskab og at ambiti√∏se medarbejdere med fleksible og b√¶redygtige arbejdsliv pr√¶sterer bedre. Bliv klogere p√• arbejdslivet i Bankdata her.

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset k√∏nsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at s√∏ge job hos os.

Title: Backend Goland Developer for venture-funded MLaaS solution
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With the recent advancements in AI and machine learning, it‚Äôs no surprise that the fastest growing occupation over the next five years will be software roles related to ML and AI.




The roughly 1 million new ML practitioners will face the same challenges that current ML practitioners do: to schedule ML jobs, you must not only be a strong ML engineer or data scientist but also be proficient in infrastructure setup, code packaging, virtual environments, and data engineering‚Äîall at once.




The stats speak for themselves:




58% of ML practitioners spend up to 20 hours per month on environment setup alone
93% report that AI team productivity would increase if real-time compute resources could be self-served easily
74% see clear value in having compute and scheduling functionality as part of a single, unified AI/ML platform




Mimiry is changing how ML is accessed today. Our platform makes it easier than ever to launch ML jobs. Utilizing a mix of cloud technologies and distributed ML, users can start training with the click of a button and access advanced machine learning capabilities -¬†without needing substantial in-house mastery or infrastructure.




We take you from code to compute in minutes.




You are




A solid back-end developer with experience in several of the following areas: Cloud/SaaS development/architecture, Cloud infrastructure/DevOps, and machine learning
You hold a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or another relevant major
You like to work in a dynamic environment where the focus is on the product (what we make) and where team performance is what counts
You have an opinion, you are open-minded, and you like to cooperate on collectively finding the best-suited solutions
You have a burning passion for being part of a deep-tech start-up on the forefront of technological innovation. That means being comfortable starting in a small team with the potential for rapid growth




Technical Requirements




You have experience with most of the following

Golang (Phyton, Javascript/Typescript is a big plus)
Implementing APIs (RESTful and/or GraphQL)
Event Driven Development/Design/Architecture
Cloud Security
Kubernetes
Microservices/(event-)functions
Docker/Contained




It is much appreciated if you have experience with




KEDA
Dapr
Redis
MongoDB
Kafka
OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Tempo
Schema standards, like OpenAPI or Avro
Open Source (using and/or contributing)
Front-end frameworks like Angular, React, Next, Vue, or Svelte‚Ä¶




We offer




The opportunity to work on innovative solutions with both a domain and the tech being most relevant for the future developer role
One of the best office spaces in Copenhagen, at Bloxhub, next to the canals
Fully flexible work options with remote, hybrid, and in-office solutions
An ambitious team that truly wants to make an impact
Industry-standard salary and the possibility of stock option intensives




For more information or questions please contact us at¬†martin.vang@mimiry.com

Title: Student Data Scientist
Description:
Join a data-driven team focused on automation, analysis, and onboarding of financial clients.

Are you currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in computer science, mathematics, economics, or something similar ‚Äì and passionate about data, automation, and hands-on analysis? Then we have an exciting student position waiting for you in our Data Services & Automation team and we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Why Aleta?

Aleta is a fast-moving fintech company that empowers family offices, wealth managers, and advisors with a holistic wealth overview and unparalleled insights in a next-generation wealth platform.




By bringing all investment data into one place and offering advanced AI-powered analytics tools, our platform enables users to seize control and turbocharge their productivity.




We‚Äôre a tight-knit team of specialists in finance and software development, working in a dynamic and collaborative environment. We love taking initiative, hosting social events, and fostering a team culture where ideas thrive and innovation is encouraged.




What you‚Äôll be doing ‚≠ê

Our team works with complex data structures, automation of manual processes, and supports onboarding of new clients to our platform ‚Äì often in close collaboration with both developers and business stakeholders.




As our new Student Data Scientist, you‚Äôll become an integral part of the team and work with tasks like:

Analyzing transaction data and validating data quality.
Developing smaller automation tools and data models.
Developing and implementing scripts for onboarding flows and client reporting.
Supporting operations and troubleshooting data flows.
Contributing to documentation and systematization of solutions.
Assisting with development of ML-based tools or data mapping.

You‚Äôll work on real tasks that create real value for both clients and internal operations ‚Äì and you‚Äôll get professional sparring from experienced colleagues with both technical and financial backgrounds.




What we‚Äôre looking for üéØ

You‚Äôre probably a great match if you:

Are currently studying a relevant master‚Äôs program (e.g., computer science, data science, math-econ, etc.).
Have solid skills in SQL and Python ‚Äî and ideally some experience with Power BI or similar.
Are analytical, detail-oriented, and care about data quality.
Have an interest in finance and investment (no need to be an expert ‚Äì curiosity goes a long way).
Are proactive, self-driven, and enjoy working in a team that values collaboration and high standards.




What we offer üéÅ

A study-relevant part-time job (approx. 15-20 hours/week) with flexibility around exam periods.
The chance to gain practical experience with data work on a scalable fintech platform.
A key role in a high-impact, cross-functional team.
A steep learning curve and plenty of room to grow your skills in a real-world setting.
The opportunity to grow in the role ‚Äì potentially joining development or operations projects over time.




Sounds like you? üöÄ

If you‚Äôre excited about joining a bunch of passionate nerds who are building the future of wealth management software, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




We‚Äôll be conducting interviews on a rolling basis.

Show more
